column2: About the job

Clarivate(tm) is a global leader in providing solution to accelerate the lifecycle of innovation. Our bold mission is to help customer solve some of the world's most complex problem by providing actionable information and insight that reduce the time from new idea to life-changing invention in the area of science and intellectual property. We help customer discover, protect and commercialize their invention using our trusted subscription and technology-based solution coupled with deep domain expertise.

We now have more than 8,500 colleague in over 40 country worldwide, and we work with over 200 partner to deliver value and success for our customers. Today, Clarivate is a publicly traded company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker NYSE:CLVT.
Clarivate is committed to building, nurturing, and developing a diverse culture of belonging where new colleague can bring their authentic self to work every day! Join us!
We are actively seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst in our MedTech Data team. This position is remote based.
Position responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain process and system to analyze structured & unstructured “big data” sources.

Develop and code software programs, algorithm and automated process to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate source with an emphasis on US medical device and supply markets.

Understand the worldview and pain point of Clarivate customers, working closely with them a a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 company to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile client regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusion to them.
Evaluate data output with an keen eye for details, proactively finding potential error and omissions.
Identify opportunity and issue for data analysis and experiments, with bias towards driving customer delight.
Personal traits:
Passionate about data and have hands-on experience wrangling through large data using SQL and BI tools.
Effective communicator who can explain complex idea using clear and concise language, including through written communication.
Strong ability in communicating directly with customers, helping to deliver and interpret data, while soliciting feedback for future improvements.
Excel at collaborating with a diverse group of internal colleagues, including subject matter experts, product managers, sale leaders, technical experts, and other client-facing analysts.
Solutions oriented
Education/Knowledge/skills required:
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject area (science or business)
You have strong quantitative foundations, a evidenced by your educational and professional background.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (e.g. pivot tables, VLOOKUP, INDEX MATCH).
Proficient with SQL
Experience/strong interest in converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models.
Experience/strong interest in building market forecast models.
You know how to deliver an effective presentation.
Preferred:
Experience from life science
Advanced degree (MA, MBA, MPH, MS, or PhD in life sciences, social science or statistics) and/or relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors.

It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all person regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individual with disabilities.
About the job
Who We Are

Ford wa built on the belief that freedom of movement drive human progress. As we look to the future and the changing need of society, we are committed to becoming the world’s most trusted mobility company – delivering smart vehicle for a smart world. Join our team a we create tomorrow! We believe in putting people first, working together, and facing challenge head-on.
The Role
The Analytics Platform team is looking for a passionate data analyst to join the Enterprise Connectivity organization to help u collect, understand and drive conclusion based on automotive data.
Your Impact

The Data Analyst will join a team that manages and maintains our rapidly growing analytics platform. You will be working a part of a motivated team in a fast-paced working environment, where quality and attention to detail are vital. The successful candidate will be responsible for working with the team to ensure the proper data is being collected that is needed to solve difficult technical problem a well a ensuring we are delivering feature that the customer loves. The Data Analyst will be performing complex modelling and analysis of the data in order to produce well thought out finding and presentations. Those presentation and visualization should be able to turn the data into an exciting story that influence the direction of the team and company. The Data Analyst will be aware of all the intricacy and complexity of the data and be able to communicate those effectively a part of the evaluation of the data.
Leverage industry best practice to collect, analyze and present various data aspect of the program
Work in an agile team of software developers, tester and other data analyst
Work with the team to ensure the data needed is being collected at all time and is enumerated, tracked and valid
Ensuring the team is aware of personal identifiable information and that all process are being followed.
Write code to perform complex data query across various data collection system
Perform complex analysis of the data taking into account the problem/feature being looked at and the source of data in order to identify trend and relationships.
Present summary and visualization to the team and others on finding either a a one time investigation or a a report that is continuously pulling data on a timely basis.
Basic Qualifications
WHAT YOU'LL NEED:

Bachelor’s Degree in data science, data engineering or related field (Successful candidate will be required to provide proof of degree completion for the highest level of education attained. If the degree wa obtained from a school outside of Canada, an Education Credential Assessment report showing Canadian equivalency is also required.)
2+ year work experience
Ability to deep dive into complex issue and help drive investigation via data.
Ability to recognize when the result don't make sense, and help identify why.
Extensive experience with data querying tool such a HiveQL and SQL.
Extensive experience with building and managing ETL process through tool such a SSIS, SSAS.
Extensive experience with data analysis method and employing tool such a PySpark
Extensive experience with data reporting, visualization and presentation employing tool such a PowerBI (Preferred), Microsoft BI Stack (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), and Tableau.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skill
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with automotive technologies.
Knowledge of ML/AI technologies.
Experience working in an agile environment.
We thank all applicant for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Ford of Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to a culturally diverse workforce. Accommodations for applicant with disability throughout the recruitment, selection and / or assessment processes, where needed, are available upon request. Please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.
Candidates for this position must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Ford Motor Company of Canada, Limited doe not sponsor work permit applications.
About the job

David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, ha partnered with one of our well-established client in Ottawa to recruit a talented Tableau Data Analyst to join their office in either Ottawa or Montreal. Working with the IT and Business team leaders, the successful incumbent will communicate the key insight that can be leveraged into outcome that the team can act upon. They will also develop specs, proposal and standard process to manage large complex data sets.
The Role
Create data driven model to identify pattern of behavior, correlation to performance improving usage scenario and impact data based on those model
Perform analysis across existing data source and recommend new data source to provide accurate and reliable measure to customer program outcome
Undertake complex analysis but instill key insight in a simple model for business stakeholder to understand and review
Build dashboards, report and metric to help team measure/monitor success
Present data and insight in a clear and concise manner through the use of visuals, slide decks, and in unconventional way
Leverage the power of SQL, R or Python in building reproducible and concise analysis
Identify and develop automation capability to extract and populate data set
Contribute to the team’s effort to create and maintain training and project documentation
The Ideal Candidate
Demonstrated usage of automation to extract core data, translate/manipulate data set and push to visualization dashboard consumer
Expert level proficiency working with Tableau
Translate technical subject to non-technical audience
Expert knowledge of Excel including tables, charts, and advanced formula for data manipulation
Demonstrated example of working with business partner to deliver a solution that meet project objective (requirements generation, functional specification generation to project execution)
Expert SQL skill including experience querying large complex data set
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering Sciences or similar
Knowledge of SAP ERP Systems, Applications and Processes and data construct
The ability to obtain a Secret Security Clearance is required

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to David Newark, Consultant. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tip and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.

If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group ha been Canadian owned since 1975. Our professional consultant are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly four decade long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core area for complete recruiting and HR solution across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!
Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all our current job opportunities, career tips, and tool at www.aplin.com.
About the job

You are a unique a your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleague - expert in their field - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leader will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunity to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the life of individuals, family and community around the world.
Job Description

Sun Life ha an exciting opportunity to work on an analytics team that ha been developing and successfully building out new data and analytical capability within Group Retirement Services (GRS) at Sun Life (SL) Canada. Working with the Manager – Reporting Analytics, the mandate of the Data Analyst will focus on supporting the evolution of key performance metric for GRS clients, business intelligence, and client insights.
The Candidate Must Be Able To Communicate Effectively With Business Partners And Understand The Following Areas
Given the mandate of the role, the Data Analyst requires an analyst with a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience who posse a breadth of analytical and data skill coupled with business acumen.
Business/data analysis – i.e. performance metrics, data analysis
Data discovery - i.e. identifying and investigating data anomalies, understanding, and leveraging current data source for client insight
Visual presentation of data i.e. the ability to translate numerical output into effective visual illustration for clients.
What will you do?
Support the analytical need of a main business unit and identify insight in support of the business and client
Build process for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from a wide variety of data sources. Maintenance of the data pipeline process for end-user reporting
Develop expert knowledge of Sun Life customer data and be knowledgeable of external / 3rd party macro-micro data; working closely with business contact to understand data availability and attribute
Support the design, development, and production of meaningful performance metric report including insight and trend analysis for GRS client
Enable leader to make timely data-driven product, market-development, and distribution decision
Comply fully with all privacy, confidentiality, data security, and other requirement related to customer data
What do you need to succeed?
Minimum 3 years’ experience with SQL / SAS
Must be able to effectively communicate result to a business audience not familiar with data and analytics
3+ year of demonstrated experience in analytics, data warehousing, quantitative data analysis tools, and reporting tool
Proven ability to work well independently, but also function in a team environment, with frequent contact with people at all level of the Sun Life Canada organization
Proven balance of analytical and creative problem-solving skill
A strong quantitative skill and background
Assets
Undergraduate in Business, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or Physics (or equivalent university degree or college diploma)
Strong presentation skill
Experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial service industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property, and casualty insurance)
Working knowledge of one or more Sun Life Canada business unit
Working knowledge of VBA skills, Python, Tableau, or another BI tool
Bilingual (English/French)
What's in it for you?
15 vacation day per year
Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the need of you and your family
Pension, stock and saving program to help build and enhance your future financial security
The opportunity to move along a variety of career path with amazing networking potential

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employee participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sale focused role have sale incentive plan based on individual or group sale results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our value at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspective and creative idea benefit our clients, the community where we operate and all of u a colleagues. We welcome application from qualified individual from all backgrounds.
Persons with disability who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job posting in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com .

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employee are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work option are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirement and individual needs.
We thank all applicant for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Salary Range
Job Category
Advanced Analytics
Posting End Date
About the job
Company Description

Dropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered user across more than 180 countries, our mission is to design a more enlightened way of working. From our headquarters in San Francisco to eight dedicated Studios and a worldwide team of employee who choose where they work best, our Virtual First approach is leading the way into the future of work.
Team Description

At Dropbox, we aim to put the customer at the center of everything we do. With over 500 million users, the Customer Experience (CX) team is at the forefront of simplifying how our user and customer interact with Dropbox. We focus on solution that work for our customer a well a implementing technology that will simplify our customers’ journey. We bring the customer voice across the organization to ensure Dropbox delivers the best possible customer experience.
Role Description

The Customer Intelligence team build analytical solution and generates insight to drive strategy within the Customer Experience organization at Dropbox. Using your technical skill and creativity, and leveraging the best open source and proprietary tool available, you will develop cutting edge data pipelines, analytical tools, and reporting solutions. You’ll be involved in project from inception to delivery, ensuring your work delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business. Working alongside talented analyst and data scientists, you will champion data-driven insight to add value for our stakeholder across Customer Experience.

You're a self-starter with an affinity for problem-solving and deep knowledge of data, data architecture, and analytical tool and approaches. You will work with team across Customer Experience to understand their evolving requirements, and alongside other analyst on the team to deliver impactful and innovative solutions. You'll use your creativity, curiosity, and drive to build solution at scale, and to provide training and guidance to team member and partners.
Responsibilities
Devise, drive, and deliver technical solution that generate data-driven insights.
Build, automate, and refactor robust, scalable data pipeline and datasets.
Troubleshoot complex issue throughout the data lifecycle, identify and implement effective solutions.
Proactively engage with stakeholder across Customer Experience to ensure relevant and accurate delivery of business requirements.
Build informative, insightful dashboard and data platform across different domain and audiences.
Create new workflow processes, associated monitoring, and alerts.
Contribute to schema design, data consistency, and overall data governance.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field
3+ years’ work experience in a data-centric role
Proficient SQL skill with excellent hands-on exposure to ETL principle
Strong hands-on experience with R and/or Python
Ability to tackle and solve complex technical problem with little direction
Flexible and adaptable, willing to quickly learn and understand new technology
Strong communication skill
Strong problem solving and collaboration skill
Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skill
Preferably:
Experience with Python, R, Airflow, React/JavaScript
Experience with shell scripting and the Linux/Unix command line
Experience with good code management practices, expertise with git
Expertise in data warehousing principles, schema design, data governance, data pipeline automation

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for member and ally of internal group like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).
About the job
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
You will be in charge of these responsibilities:
Data analysis
Analyze Archer data to ensure consistency of referential data us (ie: organizational, geography, legal entity) and feasibility of reporting requirement
Escalate any data issue such a duplication of records, unreportable multi selects, invalid record etc…
Review impact analysis on referential or taxonomy change
Perform ad hoc check to guarantee data integrity
Clean and normalize the data
Data quality
Gather data quality need with various risk team
Develop automatic check on data

Perform regular and automatized check to ensure that data quality in GRC tool is good. Checks will include completeness of information a well a simple data quality check (ie: event reported within # days)
Machine Learning /Artificial Intelligence
Identify opportunity for Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence
Gather Business Requirements and need from end user
Develop Proof of Concept and perform demo to end user
Reporting support
Develop reports/dashboards in BI tool (Power BI) a per reporting need provided
Provide demo to end user and release to production environment
Profile Required
Profile
You are graduated with a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Engineering and/or Computer Science or related subject.
Required
Python or knowledge of another language (VBA/Java/C#/Javascript). Willingness to learn Python.
Data analysis skills, database & SQL
A plus
Experience in reporting and data aggregation.
Experience in Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence.
Experience with Business Intelligence Tool such a Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.
Knowledge of risk management and/or GRC tool will be extremely valued.
Business Analyst skill to translate business need in requirements.
You are proficient in Microsoft Office.
You are fluent in English.
The VIE assignment in a nutshell
This VIE in Montreal is to begin a soon a possible but you need to plan 3 month between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 24 months.
The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France’s eligibility criteria, opened to candidate under 28 and from the member state of the European Economic Space.
Please see Civiweb www.civiweb.com, in order to have more detail regarding your financial indemnities.

We would like to draw your attention to the fact there that your VIE mission could potentially get postponed, depending on the evolution of the health crisis and subject to the decision made by the Crisis and Support Centre of the Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE). In addition, the selected candidate will only be paid upon confirmation from Business France and arrival in the country of assignment.
To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.
Why join u

As soon a you arrive, you will be integrated into our team and will learn every day alongside our experts, who will support you in your tasks. Gradually, you will become more independent in your projects, making this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our businesses, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.
At the end of your VIE, various opportunity could be offered to you, in France and abroad.
Business insight
At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are driver of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.
Whether you’re joining u for a period of months, year or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.
If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!
Still hesitating?

You should know that our employee can dedicate several day per year to solidarity action during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skill with charities. There are many way to get involved.
About the job
Awesome tech is made by awesome people. And we’re always looking for new team member who bring the energy, passion, commitment, and collaboration that ha made Auth0 the great company it is today.

So what do we exactly build? Auth0 is an authentication and authorization platform designed by developer for developers. Basically, we make companies’ login box safe, secure, and seamless for anyone logging in. Our mission is to secure the world’s identity so innovator can innovate. But it’s a big mission that requires a lot of teamwork.
Words, code, or people, whatever your skill, there’s a place for you here

The Data and Analytics team at Auth0 delivers the tool and technology that enable our business team and customer to make data driven decisions. We make data work!

The Auth0 Data and Analytics team is looking for a very experienced, business savvy, articulate and creative Business Data Analyst to help deliver analytic asset (reports, dashboards) a well a one-off analyses, and insight to business partner across the organization. The analyst will also monitor key business metrics, initiate and perform deep dive where required and alert business to challenge and opportunities.

As part of the Business Analytics team, the successful candidate will partner with the Data Warehouse, the Data Science team, the Enterprise Data organization and embedded analytics team to enable business unit to make data driven decisions.

The ideal candidate ha to be an intellectually curious perfectionist who thrives on uncovering insight hidden in data, ha a consultative mindset and is used to partner with team across an organization. He/she need to be an excellent story-teller and easily be able to select and focus on high impact, complex data projects. The candidate will have extensive experience in managing customer expectations, delivering complex, cross departmental analytics project on time, monitor data accuracy of the data, driving adoption and measuring impact to business.
This is a full-time position that is suitable for work from home.
Responsibilities
Build a repeatable process and deliver analytics asset (reports, dashboards, KPI readouts..) to empower business team and their leadership with insight and data driven decision making capabilities.
Proactively identify, analyze and interpret trend or pattern in complex and sensitive data. Alert, inform and educate business a needed.
Monitor and ensure data integrity and security for business data.
Define best practice and template for reporting data to business units.
Improve and advise on data normalization between various data sources.
Measure and report on KPIs for business.
Create an intake process for ad hoc report demands.
Ensure data is set up and accessible for the proper parties.
Make recommendation for new metrics, techniques, and strategy to improve team performance and measurement in the future.
Job Requirements
4+ year of data analysis and knowledge of business statistics.
4+ year of experience writing performant SQL query on large data sets.
4+ year of developing scalable reporting solutions/products that are intuitive to use.
Strong knowledge of Tableau, Looker or similar BI platform.
Familiarity with cloud-native databases, especially Snowflake.
Strong business intuition a well a outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to convey complex concept and information to diverse audiences.
Track record of working independently, with strong time management and organizational skills.
Comfort working in a globally distributed environment with a remote workforce.
Experience performing complex analysis including regression, forecasting and probability modeling is a plus.
BA/BS in quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Prior experience in a consulting environment is desired.
Auth0 make the internet safer by safeguarding billion of login transaction each month.

Our team is spread across more than 35 country and we are proud to continually be recognized a a great place to work . Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principle . We practice N+1>N which applies to everything from our people to how we iterate our tech; we believe in one team, one score; and we give a shit about everything we do.

Research show that candidate from underrepresented background often don’t apply unless they meet all the job criteria. We aren’t looking for someone who tick every single box on a page; we’re looking for lifelong learner and people who can make u better with their unique experiences. If you think you’d be a great fit, then please get in touch to tell u about yourself.

About the job
Working At CBC
At the CBC, we all have a story to tell. What’s yours?
If you share our passion for Canadian storytelling and you wish to help u engage with individual and community across our various digital platforms, this is where you’ll want to be!

Every day, you will have an opportunity to shape the way in which Canadians see themselves reflected in our digital services. Your work will have a direct impact on how million of Canadians from various community connect with our products, with one another, and with the diverse voice that make our country so unique.

You will have the opportunity to play a part in enlightening and entertaining Canadians through our innovative work in building the medium that deliver our content. We are an innovative hub, where the talented professional we work with are respected and valued for their contributions. Our product team are vibrant and our work culture strives to achieve the highest standard of diversity and inclusion. We believe that hiring people with different career path and background is fundamental in our shared success and in building healthy and highly performant teams. When you join our mission, you are not only shaping the vision of the CBC, but the future of our country.

We know that commitment to equity, inclusion and diversity is essential to creating content that mirror and resonates with the rich and evolving makeup of our country. We’re also committed to reaching out and connecting with our audience on multiple platform this includes creating virtual place where community can come together.
Why is this role important?

The Data Analyst drive strong partnership between Data Audience Activation, business client and other analytics team partners. You will enable data driven decision making for various business group by crafting scalable business solution that retrieve and aggregate data from multiple source and presenting it in a digestible and actionable format.

Successful candidate will demonstrate a passion for data analysis, a bias for action, deep dive, attention to details, ownership and customer-obsession. We are looking for a data storyteller who can identify and interpret trend from a variety of sources, and give meaning to the numbers. A successful candidate need excellent critical thinking skills, a fine eye for detail, practical experience a a data analyst, and solid understanding of popular data analysis tool and databases. The Data Analyst work in concert with our data audience activation and BI team in a fast-paced environment with the goal of making data insight accessible to all. Eaton’s Electrical Engineering Services Division is currently seeking a Data Analytics Specialist to join our team. This position is based in our Burlington, ON location
Position Overview:

This role will be responsible for designing and executing Eaton Canada’s data analytics roadmap to support our strategic initiatives. This role will provide actionable business insight using various source of data, visual, and statistical techniques. This includes partnering with the stakeholder to uncover their critical question and analytic need and designing a data dashboard to provide the additional business insights. This role will also support the entire Profit Planning cycle from creating the Excel model to working with the product manager throughout the process and supporting the sale district operating plans.

Making what matter work at Eaton take the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professional like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help u reach ours.
In this function you will:
You will support and execute the multi-year analytics maturity roadmap for Eaton Canada that support the overall Canada Strategy.
Manage analytics dashboards, design a roadmap for each, and continuously gather Voice of the Customer (VOC) feedback to ensure actionable insight to it users.

You will become the analytics resident expert by partnering with the business stakeholder to understand what matter to them and use advanced analytics and data to provide additional insight and actionable recommendations.
You will facilitate better decision making by optimizing the KPIs and “what if scenarios”, automating the process (speed and efficiency), and taking the process through cycle of improvement.
You will identify pattern and insight from structured and unstructured data set utilizing graphs, tree and/or other data representation techniques.
You will document and critically ass the business and analysis questions, then create metric and dashboard to provide the insights.
You will own and advance existing data dashboard to ensure they continue to support data driven decision making for the user of the dashboards.
You will perform ad-hoc strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data and reporting across multiple data sources.
You will upgrade the understanding of the organization by conducting seminar and presentation on data analytics and the value of data driven decision making.
You will advance and support the profit planning Excel model for the product manager and the stakeholders.
When we embrace the different ideas, perspective and background that make each of u unique, we — a individual and a a company — are stronger

University degree or college diploma.
Minimum 1 year of experience in a data analytics, financial analyst, or operational analyst role.
Minimum 1 year of experience with statistical and numerical method to model complex dynamic and build a prediction model.
No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidate that currently reside within 80 km of Burlington, ON will be considered
Must be legally authorized to work in the Canada without company sponsorship
Preferred qualifications:
University degree in in finance, economics, math, or engineering from an accredited institution.
Proficiency in data analytic tool such a Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Python, R, SAS, SQL
Demonstrated experience using internal/external data source to create dashboard using data analytic tool using Power BI, OBIE, and/or Qlik to forecast and uncover business insights.

Company Description

Dropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered user across more than 180 countries, our mission is to design a more enlightened way of working. Proactively engage with stakeholder across Customer Experience to ensure relevant and accurate delivery of business requirements.
Build informative, insightful dashboard and data platform across different domain and audiences.
Create new workflow processes, associated monitoring, and alerts.
Contribute to schema design, data consistency, and overall data governance.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field
3+ years’ work experience in a data-centric role
Proficient SQL skill with excellent hands-on exposure to ETL principle
Strong hands-on experience with R and/or Python
Ability to tackle and solve complex technical problem with little direction
Flexible and adaptable, willing to quickly learn and understand new technology
Strong communication skill
Strong problem solving and collaboration skill
Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skill
Preferably:
Experience with Python, R, Airflow, React/JavaScript
Experience with shell scripting and the Linux/Unix command line
Experience with good code management practices, expertise with git
Expertise in data warehousing principles, schema design, data governance, data pipeline automation

Working with the IT and Business team leaders, the successful incumbent will communicate the key insight that can be leveraged into outcome that the team can act upon. They will also develop specs, proposal and standard process to manage large complex data sets.
The Role
Create data driven model to identify pattern of behavior, correlation to performance improving usage scenario and impact data based on those model
Perform analysis across existing data source and recommend new data source to provide accurate and reliable measure to customer program outcome
Undertake complex analysis but instill key insight in a simple model for business stakeholder to understand and review
Build dashboards, report and metric to help team measure/monitor success
Present data and insight in a clear and concise manner through the use of visuals, slide decks, and in unconventional way
Leverage the power of SQL, R or Python in building reproducible and concise analysis
Identify and develop automation capability to extract and populate data set
Contribute to the team’s effort to create and maintain training and project documentation
The Ideal Candidate
Demonstrated usage of automation to extract core data, translate/manipulate data set and push to visualization dashboard consumer
Expert level proficiency working with Tableau
Translate technical subject to non-technical audience
Expert knowledge of Excel including tables, charts, and advanced formula for data manipulation
Demonstrated example of working with business partner to deliver a solution that meet project objective (requirements generation, functional specification generation to project execution)
Expert SQL skill including experience querying large complex data set
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering Sciences or similar
Knowledge of SAP ERP Systems, Applications and Processes and data construct
The ability to obtain a Secret Security Clearance is required

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to David Newark, Consultant. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tip and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.

If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group ha been Canadian owned since 1975. Our professional consultant are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly four decade long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core area for complete recruiting and HR solution across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!
Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all our current job opportunities, career tips, and tool at www.aplin.com.

About the job
Awesome tech is made by awesome people. And we’re always looking for new team member who bring the energy, passion, commitment, and collaboration that ha made Auth0 the great company it is today.

So what do we exactly build? Auth0 is an authentication and authorization platform designed by developer for developers. Basically, we make companies’ login box safe, secure, and seamless for anyone logging in. Our mission is to secure the world’s identity so innovator can innovate. But it’s a big mission that requires a lot of teamwork.
Words, code, or people, whatever your skill, there’s a place for you here
Awesome tech is made by awesome people. And we’re always looking for new team member who bring the energy, passion, commitment, and collaboration that ha made Auth0 the great company it is today.

So what do we exactly build? Auth0 is an authentication and authorization platform designed by developers, for developers. Basically, we make companies’ login box safe, secure, and seamless for anyone logging in. Our mission is to secure the world’s identity so innovator can innovate. But it’s a big mission that requires a lot of teamwork.
Words, code, or people, whatever your skill, there’s a place for you here.
The Data and Analytics team at Auth0 delivers the tool and technology that enable our business team and customer to make data driven decisions. We make data work!

The Auth0 Data and Analytics team is looking for a very experienced, business savvy, articulate and creative Business Data Analyst to help deliver analytic asset (reports, dashboards) a well a one-off analyses, and insight to business partner across the organization. The analyst will also monitor key business metrics, initiate and perform deep dive where required and alert business to challenge and opportunities.

As part of the Business Analytics team, the successful candidate will partner with the Data Warehouse, the Data Science team, the Enterprise Data organization and embedded analytics team to enable business unit to make data driven decisions.

The ideal candidate ha to be an intellectually curious perfectionist who thrives on uncovering insight hidden in data, ha a consultative mindset and is used to partner with team across an organization. He/she need to be an excellent story-teller and easily be able to select and focus on high impact, complex data projects. The candidate will have extensive experience in managing customer expectations, delivering complex, cross departmental analytics project on time, monitor data accuracy of the data, driving adoption and measuring impact to business.
This is a full-time position that is suitable for work from home.
Responsibilities
Build a repeatable process and deliver analytics asset (reports, dashboards, KPI readouts..) to empower business team and their leadership with insight and data driven decision making capabilities.
Proactively identify, analyze and interpret trend or pattern in complex and sensitive data. Alert, inform and educate business a needed.
Monitor and ensure data integrity and security for business data.
Define best practice and template for reporting data to business units.
Improve and advise on data normalization between various data sources.
Measure and report on KPIs for business.
Create an intake process for ad hoc report demands.
Ensure data is set up and accessible for the proper parties.
Make recommendation for new metrics, techniques, and strategy to improve team performance and measurement in the future.
Job Requirements
4+ year of data analysis and knowledge of business statistics.
4+ year of experience writing performant SQL query on large data sets.
4+ year of developing scalable reporting solutions/products that are intuitive to use.
Strong knowledge of Tableau, Looker or similar BI platform.
Familiarity with cloud-native databases, especially Snowflake.
Strong business intuition a well a outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to convey complex concept and information to diverse audiences.
Track record of working independently, with strong time management and organizational skills.
Comfort working in a globally distributed environment with a remote workforce.
Experience performing complex analysis including regression, forecasting and probability modeling is a plus.
BA/BS in quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Prior experience in a consulting environment is desired.
Auth0 make the internet safer by safeguarding billion of login transaction each month.

Our team is spread across more than 35 country and we are proud to continually be recognized a a great place to work . Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principle . We practice N+1>N which applies to everything from our people to how we iterate our tech; we believe in one team, one score; and we give a shit about everything we do.

Research show that candidate from underrepresented background often don’t apply unless they meet all the job criteria. We aren’t looking for someone who tick every single box on a page; we’re looking for lifelong learner and people who can make u better with their unique experiences. If you think you’d be a great fit, then please get in touch to tell u about yourself.

About the job
Job Description
Role: Data Analyst
Welland or Toronto, ON
Permanent, Full Time

Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which our industry is transforming ha increased exponentially in recent year and we are committed to being a leader. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technology and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive u forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Customer Service & Operations team at our retail Bank. The Customer Service & Operations team build loyalty to our brand by delivering an excellent experience to our Customer no matter how we interact, creating Customers for Life.

Reporting to the Manager of Data Governance, Automation & Reporting, the successful candidate will support Customer Service & Operations objective to develop reporting, analytics and a vision to provide insight that drive the Division’s goal to provide industry leading customer service and innovation with how the Contact Centre embrace technology; All with the underlying objective of supporting our goal to be Canada’s #1 retailer.

You will be integral in supporting the revitalization and enhancement of existing relational data model and reporting structures, identifying new opportunity for automation, accurately analyzing and estimating new processes, quickly assessing feasibility and documenting the business process in detail where required. Creating and maintaining solution documentation. Supporting existing automated process and implementing change requirement a part of a structured change control process.

The ideal candidate will posse a strong understanding of Information Technology, business process and data architecture. Possessing a solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, statistic that will contribute to the development of best in class processes, techniques, procedure and ensuring best practice are followed.
Who You Are
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help u take bold, strategic move in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Outcome focused, critical thinker with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team player who build relationship easily across various stakeholder group to move initiative forward
An individual who is self-motivated with the ability to operate independently with limited guidance and direction, and to multitask and manage several project and deliverable at one time
What You Bring
3-5 year of experience with Data & Analytics
3-5 year in demonstrated data transformation & manipulation experience
Experience delivering superior innovative analytical insight to line of business
3-5 year implementing relational data models, insightful reporting and predictive modeling
Proficiency utilizing SAS, Python, VB scripting and SQL
Working experience with Linux/UNIX and Oracle
Understanding of traditional ETL tool
Familiar with PEGA, Chordiant, IEX, UCCE and IVR application relating call centre data is an asset
Solid understanding of system management, data architecture principle and data governance
Basic understanding of Robotic Process Automation concept
Exposure to end-to-end process automation including RPA proof of concept
What You’ll Do
Participate in project meeting to gain an understanding of the new system and the associated process workflow
Convert large volume of structured and unstructured call centre data using advanced analytical solution
Create high quality data visualization
Create and execute test script to test and learn data associated to the new system
Maintain documentation of the outcome of data test script
Clearly articulate the outcome of data test script to the project team
Share your knowledge of the data with other data analyst across the organization
Required Skills
Post Secondary degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or similar
Excellent data management skill with proven data transformation and manipulation experience; Allowing insightful interpretation of data
Communication of analytical result in a clear, concise manner
Strong organizational skill
Ability to work independently and a part of a team
Ability to establish and maintain strong working relationship
Preferred Skills
Call Centre experience and knowledge of telephony system
Credit Card, Insurance or other Financial Services experience
Proven ability to translate business need into mathematically sound solution

About the job

Goodmans LLP is internationally recognized a one of Canada’s leading and most innovative law firms, offering market leading expertise in M&A, corporate, security and finance, private equity, real estate, tax, restructuring, litigation and other business-related specialties. We are a community of committed, talented, hardworking professional who are motivated by exceeding our clients’ expectations, with a law firm culture that is second to none.

Goodmans LLP is seeking a Specialist, Data Analysis and Information Management to join it Knowledge and Risk Management team. Reporting to the Director, Professional Support this position will contribute to a dynamic team that provides key support to a wide cross-section of firm members. The ideal candidate will be interested in information management and maintaining and enhancing the quality and accuracy of data. The Specialist, Data Analysis and Information Management will have a broad-base of research and searching skill across multiple platforms, and will be an outgoing people person eager to contribute to our firm’s culture.
Specific responsibility include:
Information Management
Assisting with the organization, storage, retention and disposition of client and firm business records, both physical and electronic, in accordance with firm policy and procedures;
Maintaining the firm’s record database to ensure they are accurate and up-to-date;
Overseeing and conducting regular audit and review of firm data, information and record in accordance with internal and Law Society policies, standard and best practices;
Reconciling and processing monthly invoices, and preparing the annual offsite storage budget;
Maintaining statistic on offsite storage usage, and preparing report for senior management;
Assisting with data, information, record and conflict issue relating to incoming or departing lawyers, including the transfer of file to other law firm or clients;
Training firm member on the firm’s data, information and record management policy and procedures;
Responding to information and record related query or request from firm members;
Assisting with analyzing data, information, records, procedure and/or workflow by practice area;

Developing and utilizing expertise on the following internal and cloud-based platforms: Accounting (i.e., Elite, 3E), WorkFlow, MinuteBox, Closing Folders, Open Text DM (document management), and Emergent.
Team and Firm Support
Supporting the Team Leader, Conflicts, Business Intake and Information Management, including with research, data confirmation and data analysis;
Assisting legal professional with “know your client” rules, data collection and conflict analysis;
Supporting the Administrator, Records and Information Management, including with document production of Closing Books/Record Books and research into Estates matters;
Provide assistance to others during absence a needed; and
Other special project & duty a assigned.
The ideal candidate possesses:
A university or college degree in Information Management, Information Science, Library Science or other related field;
Relevant experience within a professional service environment (preferred);
Proficiency in MS Office application including Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Adobe;
Proficiency in role-specific software and platforms, research and searching;
The ability to change, adapt and go with the flow;
An eye for detail and a tendency towards perfection;
The ability to multi-task and prioritize in a deadline-driven environment;
Solid written & verbal communication skills, a self-starter with a strong work ethic, and a team player with excellent client service skills.

Goodmans LLP is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identity and perspectives. Goodmans LLP invite application from all qualified candidates. For applicant with disability requiring accommodation at any point in the recruitment process, please contact HR.

Why you should join u

You will use your expertise to

About the job
Data Analyst
Calgary Homeless Foundation (CHF)

Calgary Homeless Foundation is the guide on the fight against homelessness in Calgary. We allocate resource or highest impact and outcomes, maximizing benefit for people experiencing homelessness. With our database and research, we build knowledge and understanding, and we galvanize public and political will so people have the right housing at the right time. In partnership with government and community, we serve a the trusted advisor on how to leverage our combined resource so Calgarians can journey out of homelessness into a home with the support they need to thrive.
We are looking for passionate, entrepreneurial and talented people to join our action-oriented, high impact team.
The Position

Reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics, the Data Analyst is responsible for performing statistical analysis that help CHF and agency in Calgary’s Homeless Serving System of Care to enhance their ability to provide support to those at risk of or experiencing homelessness. The Data Analyst work closely with internal and external stakeholder to create insight from data. This position involves retrieving, modelling, analyzing and interpreting data and requires strong attention to detail and advanced statistical modelling knowledge.
Our Staff

CHF staff are action-oriented individual who are leaders, courageous collaborators, evidence inspired, and vision dedicated. They choose to bring their professional expertise and personal talent to the non-profit sector, adding value to the community.

They work cooperatively with others in a strong team environment and demonstrate flexibility in organizing and undertaking work. They show a high degree of initiative, discernment and resourcefulness, exhibit excellent communication and relational skills, and demonstrate thoughtfulness and intelligence in decision-making. Most importantly, they are focused on creating positive outcome for people experiencing homelessness.
Accountabilities and Deliverables
Perform complex statistical analysis and create descriptive and predictive model to gain insight from data;
Query, analyze and interpret data from the CHF’s data warehouse and a variety of other data sources;
Work closely with System Planners and CHF staff to understand and support analytical needs;
Create regular, and ad-hoc, reports, data visualisation and dashboard using our internal business intelligence tool to both internal and external audience
Support the HMIS team and the data warehouse developer to optimize data quality, data availability and usability of the CHF data warehouse and associated data assets;
Support research project to enhance CHF’s research profile;
For more information on HMIS please see http://calgaryhomeless.com/agencies/hmis/
Education and Experience

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, data science, computer science, economics, and other discipline with 1-3 years' experience and strong analytical elements or equivalent experience is required;
Experience in developing report and insight based upon statistical analysis;
Knowledge in a variety of statistical modelling technique for descriptive and predictive analyses;
Proven ability to communicate and explain complex technical material in a manner understood by the general public;
Proficient in using SQL to extract, collate and manipulate data from different databases;
Experience with a leading BI tool and data visualization best practices;
Ability to thrive and deliver result in a fast-paced environment;
Excellent time management skills;
Experience with Qlik Sense, R or Python will be an asset;
Past social sector experience would be an asset
General Competency Requirements
Personal Initiative: Self-starter with willingness to learn on their own.
Culturally Congruent: A passion for, belief in and communication of CHF vision, mission and core values. Demonstrates a strong service ethic and customer service approach.
Teamwork:  Ability to work independently and a part of a team. Is willing to provide assistance and support to others and defines success in term of the whole team.
Organizational: Is able to manage multiple project and prioritize work based on various deadlines; high attention to detail

Collaborative and Collegial: Works well with others, whether at the most senior levels, with direct report or with others across the organization. Understands how to work with the community in a collaborative manner.
Communication: Excellent listening, verbal and written communication skill combined with an  ability to communicate effectively with a diverse group of key external stakeholder
Analytical: Able to quickly ass situations, build appropriate plan and execute those plan flawlessly.

Results Oriented: Sets high standard of performance including setting goal and priority that maximize available resource to deliver result against CHF direction, objective and public expectations. Will monitor progress and make adjustment a necessary on an ongoing basis.
Project Management Skills: Proven strong project management skill with ability to multi-task and set priority within tight timelines.
Enhancing Organizational Image: Focuses on building and protecting the image, reputation and long-term interest of CHF including promoting CHF’s reputation a a leader in ending homelessness.
Resource Management: Is able to identify, obtain and effectively allocate resource required to achieve CHF goal and applies appropriate resource to problem and opportunities.
Credibility: Demonstrated ability to build organizational trust based on professionalism, expertise and ability to create solution and deliver desired outcomes.
Honesty & Integrity: Demonstrates the highest level of honesty and integrity in all dealing with internal and external stakeholders.
Application Deadline:  September 30, 2021

Role Summary

Our work lead to better health care for British Columbians. Using evidence-informed strategies, we shift culture, improve clinical practice and accelerate our partners’ improvement effort to support the best care possible for every person in our province.

Reporting to the Director, Analytics & Strategic Initiatives, the Health Data Analyst is responsible for performing statistical analysis and generating meaningful display of data to inform data-driven improvements. This includes working with subject matter expert to determine requirements, processing data from a variety of sources, conducting analysis and preparing report for presentation to diverse audiences. Working in partnership with the Council’s quality and clinical leads, the Health Data Analyst will be looked to a an expert in measurement and analysis to support the effective use of data in improvement, research and evaluation.
Key Accountabilities

Receive, analyze and support the interpretation of clinical data, in conjunction with subject matter experts, to inform provincial improvement initiatives. This includes receiving data from multiple sources, cleaning the data a required, analyzing the data, working with subject matter expert to identify meaningful trend and producing finding that can be shared with a variety of stakeholders.

Advise Council team on the creation of robust measurement plans, including the selection of indicators, data collection methods, interpretation and analysis option for multiple purpose such a research, evaluation and improvement initiatives.
Develop report and presentation to share relevant finding with diverse audiences, including the creation of compelling and intuitive display of data.
Provides advice, guidance, and support, to quality and clinical leads, along with external stakeholders, on using data for improvement, evaluation and research.
Qualifications

A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science, Math, Statistics, Business or Health Administration, or a related program, plus three (3) year recent related experience. Experience with statistical analysis and quality improvement is preferred, along with a working knowledge of health care data source and relevant privacy legislation. Proficiency with a variety of software tool is essential, including Microsoft Office, database software and SPSS or equivalent. Experience with Statistical Process Control technique is an asset.

The successful candidate will posse exceptional analytic capability and attention to detail, including the ability to manage multiple demand and pressure while producing high quality work. Problem solving, curiosity and self-motivation are essential. Working with a diverse team and external stakeholders, the Health Data Analyst will need to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with tact and diplomacy.

About the job

Before you read any further: Our strength at Opencare relies on the diversity of perspective that we work hard to craft on our team. We are all solving the same set of problem from our own unique lenses, and this is fundamental to our success a a business. Experience mean something different to each of us, and your unique combination of skills, passions, and experience make you a valuable asset to our team.
Opencare’s Vision
To enable people to have optimal health of mind and body, by ensuring they get the preventive care they need.

Opencare is re-designing the dentist visit with a focus on wellness. We live our most important life moments, from laughing and smiling to eating and talking, through our mouths. Yet for such an important body part, the thought of visiting the dentist instills fear and confusion in most people. To us, that doesn’t make any sense.

That’s why we’re rebuilding every moment of the dental experience; not only to be impactful during the visit, but life enriching afterward, too. If you never thought you’d say “Wow, I love my dentist!”, our goal is to get you there.

We believe that people reach their full potential at work when they are happy and healthy outside of work. You can learn more about our culture, a well a our professional and personal benefit here. You can also hear about it directly from our team here.
Our Data Team’s Vision

Our Data team is driven by providing meaningful insight across the business that will accelerate our growth. Our analyst and data scientist work on problem that dive deep into understanding how our customer behave and how we can serve them better because we know that when we can help someone find a great dentist and prioritize their mouth wellness it’s a win-win-win. This mean that our team is focused on big problem like supply / demand balancing, event-based attribution across multiple channel both online and offline, understanding the impact of complex communication flows, and ensuring that when we run experiment we’re learning a much a we can.
How will you help to get u there?

We are bringing a Data Analyst to work with our Sales and Marketing team to uncover new opportunity to scale patient demand by exploring our complex digital ad data to help identify new optimization and experiment to optimize patient acquisition. You will be unlocking growth opportunity for Opencare by understanding consumer behaviour, and finding pattern in place previously unexplored. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a deep understanding of paid advertising who is very comfortable rolling their sleeve up in data sets. If you’re someone who get excited about the “so what” of your analysis and want to drive business outcomes, this is the role for you!

By diving deep to understand how our ad convert, this Data Analyst will play a key role in shaping our marketing and growth strategy to help u understand how to connect with the right consumer, at the right time, and with the right value proposition.
Your impact, six month into the role:
Navigating the complexity of multiple campaign with different ad content, geographical, and user grouping to identify and realize optimization opportunity within our digital marketing channel
Understand our marketing funnel and identify where in the customer journey value is created so that we can double down on what is working and cut back on activity that aren’t adding value
Navigating through our marketing data to distill key insights, inform rapid and iterative experimentation, and drive critical business decision for our Sales and Marketing team
Using  segmentation and attribution model to improve decision making, understand where value is created, and unlocking major growth in new and existing channel
Your impact, one year into the role:
Building the playbook for patient acquisition, scaling these effort across North American markets, and establishing yourself a the subject matter expert on data-driven growth
Supporting the launch and development of new markets, focusing on how to effectively balance paid and engagement channel in different size of market
Deepening our understanding of our user by partnering with Product, Engineering, Marketing and other team to capture more nuanced data about our customer
Advising our C-Suite leadership on strategic area for growth, informed by deep dive analysis and a strong understanding of our business
What skill will you bring to the team from day one?
Strong experience with business intelligence tools, ideally Looker (both LookML and data visualizations)
A drive to proactively solve business problems, push back on established playbooks, and an impact-forward approach to data science
A deep understanding of SQL in order to effectively build model to understand consumer behaviour
Experience supporting a marketing, growth, product, or demand team, with the ability to understand and analyze data from complex marketing campaign with many variable
Familiarity working with Facebook, Salesforce, and Google Adwords a a data source

The ability to effectively communicate the business impact of data analysis, and translate insight into actionable recommendation for key stakeholder at all level through data visualization (e.g. Looker)
Prior experience working with git and dbt is preferred - Whether or not you’ve read them, you probably agree with a lot of dbt’s best practice and coding convention
What skill will you have the opportunity to develop?
Deepen your understanding of consumer advertising working across multiple paid channel
Working with an experienced sale team and building targeted campaign for our B2B & B2C acquisition effort
Diving deep on how to communicate data and provide coaching to both technical and non-technical audience
Develop an extensive understanding of how to optimize in market of different size and at different stage of growth a we continue to launch new market across the US
Grow your technical in data analytics, data engineering and data science by working with Opencare’s Data team
Flexibility to explore a leadership or technical role a the team grows, with the ability to explore new method and implement your own idea along the way

Early stage investment is at the core of our business model. We also give entrepreneur access to world-class incubation facilities, expert advice, and other support to help accelerate their companies.

Working under the leadership of the manager of IT service and risk management, the data analyst help provide business insight and enable better decision for client service by overseeing the organizational data in our customer relationship management (CRM) system.

Research and develop plan to implement risk-based planning within the AESO, and prototype innovative solution to advance methodology and tool
You have:
A degree or equivalent education, training or experience in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering or a closely related field
5 + years’ experience in performing statistical analysis and employing optimization technique with Python required
Expert-level knowledge with data querying, maintenance and use of database (SQL server, Oracle)
Solid knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques, advanced statistical technique and experience with application
Experience working with Big Data mining and visualization
These aren’t required, you’ll stand out if you also have:
Previous power system education or experience
Previous market simulation modelling experience (Aurora, Uplan, or Plexos)

About the job
Description

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that accomplishes operational excellence. Bringing together individual with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 22,000 team member in over 350 location worldwide are vital to making our company stronger.
Your Opportunity

The Innovation Office’s Digital Technology & Innovation team ha a job opening for an individual to serve a the Data Analytics Leader. This position involves leading the Data Analytics group a part of the DTI team, and will lead the firm in Business Intelligence and data service by providing architectural guidance, technological vision, and solution development. This group specifically utilizes advanced analytics, data science, and machine learning to give our business and our product a competitive advantage. It includes understanding and managing the data, how it interconnects, and architecting data for self-serve BI and BA opportunities. This position is for a person who ha demonstrated leadership capabilities, is business savvy, experienced in data analytics/data science, and enjoys framing a problem, shaping & creating solutions, and helping to champion implementation. As a member of the Innovation Office, the Data Analytics group within the Digital Technology & Innovation Team also engages in research & development and provides guidance and oversight a a center of excellence for the business. This group engages in new product research and testing and the incubation of data analytics idea that arise from around the company.

In the Innovation Office, the Digital Technology & Innovation team is composed of digital expert who conduct research and development to keep our teams—and our client’s projects—ahead of the technological curve. They implement established technology and find emerging solution for all business line (Buildings, Energy & Resources, Environmental Services, Infrastructure, and Water), bridging existing knowledge domain and facilitating the integration of powerful tool and methods. The team’s goal is to make project more efficient and help provide higher-quality result to our clients.

The ideal candidate will have a proven record a a team leader and expert in the field of data analytics and will serve the entire company a a member of the Innovation Office’s Digital Technology & Innovation team.
Your Key Responsibilities

Lead, monitor, and supervise the Data Analytics group. This includes aligning the group to the Digital Technology and Innovation team’s goal and objectives.
