About the job
A Bit About Us

Here at Relay, our mission is to increase the success rate of small businesses. Traditional banking ha been a growth limiter rather than a growth enabler for business owners, and we’re changing that. With Relay, business owner can open a bank account in minutes, issue corporate card in second and automate their bookkeeping – giving them better cashflow visibility.

Joining Relay, mean an opportunity to make a huge impact building solution with the potential to reach 29 million small business across North America. If you thrive on growth and playing to win, we want to hear from you!
The Opportunity

With the announcement of our latest funding round, Relay is entering an exciting new chapter. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to help u scale our analytics engine. This is a unique opportunity to build learnings, improve reporting and inform how we scale Relay.
How you can make an impact in your first six months:
We have a rich trove of data, you are someone who will unlock these insight and craft a narrative to further unlock our cross-functional teams’ potential
You will help u identify and track core KPIs, build dashboard and reports, and ensure our team have the data they need to function effectively
You will have an understanding of what key element will ensure success, and build learning about how data story are told
Analyze result and trend in order to assist in making appropriate recommendation and present result / finding to stakeholder
You are deeply familiar with using reporting tool and database concept
You can provide planning team with key research and insight that help steer quality digital strategy
You are technical but creative, you can thrive in ambiguity and produce customized insight when needed
How You Can Make An Impact Right Away
You have 3+ year in a Data Analyst or similar role
You have a quantitative background with a degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or similar discipline
A strong SQL skill set for data analytics and business intelligence use case
You have an understanding of applied statistics, are able to create quantitative models, and can clearly communicate finding to a technical and non-technical audience
Familiarity with data modeling and warehousing concept
Knowledge of data visualization tool like Looker, Periscope, Metabase, Mode, Chartio, QlikView, or similar
You have some software development fundamental and have proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Javascript, Typescript
Nice To Have
Experience working with database like Postgres, Redshift, Snowflake, etc.
Experience with data modeling tool like DBT
Domain knowledge of Banking or SaaS analytics, and are familiar with concept like LTV, churn, retention, etc.
If you join us, you will have:
The opportunity to help shape Relay’s analytics function from the ground up
Personal and professional growth. We care about getting better everyday and leveling up. Our goal is to make Relay a step-change career opportunity
An outstanding work environment that is passionate about getting stuff done, collaboration, learning and having fun
Comprehensive benefit and a health spending account (HSA)
A competitive salary and meaningful equity
Considerable vacation
End of year holiday shutdown
Hybrid working environment
*Please be advised that candidate will be required to complete a Background Check in order to work at Relay Financial.*
What’s Important To Us

At Relay, we believe that diversity is key to building high-performing teams, and creating an inclusive work environment is our priority. We are an equal opportunity employer and we welcome people of diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We will work with applicant to provide accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.
We look forward to hearing from you!
About the job
Company Information

Canaccede Financial Group Ltd. and it subsidiary (collectively “Canaccede”) are Canadian industry leader in specialized investment and financial service products. Through our acquisition entity and our managing and servicing entity, Canaccede International Management Ltd., we have been working with a broad cross-section of lender and financial institution in the acquisition and service of insolvent and distressed receivables since 2008, and we are the largest multi-asset acquirer in the Canadian market.

We operate with an analytically driven philosophy that is always responsive to our client’s individual need and circumstances. Our business proposition is to maximize value from acquired receivables in a cost-effective manner and provide integrated consumer finance solutions.

The entire team at Canaccede is forward-looking and ha an open growth-oriented corporate culture that offer motivated employee the opportunity to learn and grow with it. We have office in Toronto and London, Ontario.

The successful candidate will initially work from home and there is potential for the position to be a permanent work from home opportunity. Our ideal candidate is located in Ontario, with ability to travel to either of our location to work in office, if and when necessary.
Position
Senior Data Analyst
Reports To
Director, Risk Management & Analytics
Summary

The Data Analyst will take a lead role in development and implementation of key reporting and analytics project for the company’s continued data-driven decisioning requirements. Reporting to the Director, Risk Management & Analytics, the successful candidate will be quantitatively driven and have an entrenched motivation to ensure all reporting and analytics request are completed in an accurate and timely manner. The successful candidate will have specific demonstrated expertise in extracting, cleansing, and analyzing large amount of data for the purpose of completing advanced analytics and creating executive-level reports. They will operate with minimal supervision to drive project forward and independently identify opportunity for continuous improvement. Canaccede is looking for a candidate with strong potential to grow into a leadership position within the data analytics team.
Job Duties
Reporting
Extract, aggregate, and cleanse large amount of data from various disparate source for the purpose of analysis, reporting, and review.
Work with the team to drive delivery of standard reporting package at regular interval (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly etc.) a needed for department leaders.
Prepare accurate, timely, and organized report to the executive team highlighting key performance observation of the business.
Prepare presentation to managers, executives, and financial partner outlining key consideration and conclusion in a clear and effective manner.
Develop complex financial and non-financial model in accordance with business requirement to be utilized in the effective measurement of business performance.
Assist in implementation and migration of standard reporting to more automated processes.
Portfolio Analytics

Provide recommendation to Executive Team regarding proposal within the business including, but not limited to, prediction improvement, data management, reporting advances, and asset profitability enhancement.
Proactively identify and recommend key risk management and/or business growth initiatives.
Prepare and manage project plan and report to management on the status and recommendation and analysis.
Requirements
A university degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline, and/or 2+ year of related work experience within the finance industry
Strong business acumen with a good understanding of business environment to provide meaningful analysis
Experience and understanding of database structure and querying, including the ability to design report from blended data source
Advanced working knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint
Advanced working knowledge of SQL and Tableau
Experience in building statistical model to generate projection
Highly adept at identifying and implementing process improvement initiative
Independent and proactive with proven experience in taking on new project with little supervision
Effective written and verbal communication skills, with proven relationship building skill and ability to work with various level of management
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage internal relationship by collaborating within the department and across business unit
Ability to influence and mentor team member where no direct reporting line exist
Ability to effectively manage internal and external expectation in a dynamic, fast paced, and demanding environment
Preferred
Working knowledge of Salesforce reporting
Working knowledge of SAS modelling and analytics
Working knowledge of programming language such a Python, R, and VBA and/or experience with Machine Learning model with a focus on analytics and data analysis using these tool
Experience within one or more of the following domains: financial services, banking, debt sale and/or service, credit risk management and/or fraud risk management
Working Conditions
Physical demand typical to an office environment
Movement from one spot to another is expected, a is standard within any office setting
Sitting for long period of time
Standing for at least one hour is anticipated
Limited Light physical effort (bending, reaching, carrying light items, walking, standing), defined a more than 5 hours/week
Constant manual dexterity (eye/hand movement requiring precision, accuracy and/or fine motor control), defined a more than 30 hours/week
Constant Visual effort (concentrated reading of documentation or close monitoring of computer terminal and display patters), defined a more than 30 hours/week
Tight deadline
Regular simultaneous multiple demand which must be attended to ‘on the spot’
Regular accelerated work pace, based on a fluctuating volume of customer contact
Constant attention to detail, subject to frequent interruption that require immediate attention
Overtime a required
What’s great about working for Canaccede Financial Group?

Competitive total compensation structure, which includes competitive base salary, annual bonus program, deferred profit-sharing plan, group RRSP, 3 weeks’ paid vacation, paid sick days, company paid health, dental, vision, paramedical, life and travel insurance benefits, employee assistance program, and tuition reimbursement program.

While working from home we are sure to provide our employee with the system necessary for long term success, which includes your performance and communication tools. We have also modified our onboarding process to help integrate you into the company even before your first day, and we will help connect you with all our current employees. Our Social Committee host virtual monthly activities, and we continue to find unique and fun way to celebrate our success while remote.

When it is safe for all employee to return to our office you will get to enjoy our open concept work environment, which is ideal for collaboration and team building. Enjoy your lunch with your colleague in our expansive lunchroom filled with windows, booths, and social tables. Our Social Committee coordinate fun event on a regular basis – both inside and outside of the office. These include holiday lunches, pub nights, contests, and a weekly lottery, just to name a few. We happily spend time celebrating our employees’ personal and work-related accomplishment with awards, company-wide recognition, and of course, cake.

We care about giving back to the community. Each employee is provided with 1 paid day per year to volunteer at any registered charity of their choice. We also provide monthly donation to charity that are meaningful to our staff. To date, we have donated over $34,000 to local and national charity combined, all of which were selected by our employees.
Sound like a perfect fit for you? We think so too.

We invite and encourage application from women, Aboriginal people and person of all races, ethnic origins, religions, abilities, sexual orientations, and gender identity and expressions. Canaccede will provide accommodation during all part of the hiring process, upon request, to applicant with disabilities. If contacted to proceed to the selection process, please advise u if you require any accommodation. About the job

At EA, we inspire the world to play by developing, publishing, and distributing the world's best games. Our EA Vancouver studio is looking for a Data Analyst to support our FIFA franchise. Reporting to the lead analyst on FIFA's live services, you'll work with the live product & content team along with colleague in analytics around the world. We're looking for someone with a passion for diving into data to uncover insights. You'll not only be a data explorer and modeler, but also a data storyteller who will help guide the company to create extraordinary gaming experience for our players.
Examples of project you may work on include: assessing campaign content impact, reporting on content performance, projecting engagement patterns, and tuning mode feature and player rewards.
What You'll Do On Our Team
Receive question from our partners, determine the best way that our data can help answer them, and provide insight through dashboards, reports, or presentations.
Develop insight to help our partner make informed decision about in-game campaign planning.
Work with game producer to understand their need and translate analysis into realistic recommendations.

Who are you?

You feel passionate about changing the world and creating a better future for the next generations. You believe that climate change need to be a bigger focus in order to protect our planet. You want to have a career with a high level of purpose that give you opportunity to bring in innovation, work in collaborative team and develop your knowledge. When faced with an issue you enjoy the problem-solving journey and looking for the most effective solution. Your colleague can rely on you for support and to deliver on your promises. You multiply your value by developing those around you by leading and coaching through the company vision, mission, and values. Currently, we are looking for an R&D Process Data Analyst who will monitor and analyze different process data from Svante’s R&D lab testing station for process and operational improvement, KPIs calculation, material degradation, and novel sorbent performance in new cycles. In this role you will be involved in-process testing and analysis of experimental data for the following test activities:
Structured adsorbent breakthrough and pressure drop testing
Laminate and bed durability testing
Process cycle testing (VTS) for novel sorbent and cycle optimization
Other test station on material and process characterization
Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities:
As our new Process Data Analyst, you will:
Monitor and collect operational data from various test station in charge;
Analyze test data with pre-developed template and generate operating performance curves;
Be involved in developing template for data interpretation and analysis
Develop and execute test plan in close cooperation with other team members;
Prepare report and update regularly on test station KPIs and communicate with shareholders;
Work closely with R&D and other department and communicate analyzed test result
Participate and contribute to new sorbent characterization, cycle testing, and process development
Carry out other related task and project a required.
Competencies required:
Experience:
At least 2 year of experience in gas separation related process development and data analysis;
Experience in Python, Matlab, and/or SEEQ script programming is a plus.
Working knowledge of computer-aided design equipment and computerized process such a Aspen Hysys is an asset.
Education:
Bachelor in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science
Skills and abilities:
Ability to develop and deliver presentations;
Ability to work well with cross-functional team and diverse group of stakeholders;
Demonstrated interpersonal skill in establishing cooperative working relationship both internally and externally;
Demonstrated written and oral communication skills;
Critical thinking skill and good judgment;
Adaptable to change;
High level of initiative;
Good time management, with the ability to organize, prioritize and meet deadlines;
Strong attention to detail.

About the job
DEPARTMENT: Environmental Services Department
BRANCH: Commissioner's Office
LOCATION: 17250 Yonge Street, Newmarket
STATUS: Permanent Full-Time

Council Approved: March 25, 2021
Union position - CUPE Local 905 (York Region Unit)
POSITION PURPOSE

This position is responsible for providing support and analytic advice to management, including supporting and leading project that will enhance the use of data, and involve complex analysis and research. The position will support efficient and effective analysis of current projects, program and policy with specific focus on data related initiatives. The position interprets data into critical information and knowledge to be utilized in conducting sound organizational, tactical and strategic business decisions.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Acts a a lead and subject matter expert to identify, collect, and analyze data source to develop and advance initiative and programs.
Contributes a a subject matter expert on joint data analytics project and participates in collaborative effort where applicable.
Identifies and document analytics needs, record requirements, provides data insight to support narrative, and develops project plan that incorporate agile delivery practices.
Measures the effectiveness of initiative and programs, identifies trends, emerging issue and implications, and build baseline against which future metric can be measured.
Monitors, measures, and report on project conducted by the Region and in partnership with local municipalities, business and/or community partners.

Conducts data research and analysis and provides support in developing and implementing work plan for projects, program policy and development strategies, in collaboration with Department staff, local municipality and other stakeholders.
Provides research support and compiles data for management on emerging trends, best practices, current events, and municipal and provincial program and policy that may have Regional implications.
Applies statistical method and analytic model to data to identify insight of business value.
Applies a user-centred development approach to build report and dashboard employing best-practices.

Contributes to project planning and control including estimating and planning specific tasks; provides guidance and technical support to staff; and ensures that all project and task timetable are kept up-to-date and provides status reports.
QUALIFICATIONS
Successful completion of a University Degree in Mathematics, Applied Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related applied program or approved equivalent combination of education and experience.

Minimum five (5) years' experience in data analysis, statistical and predictive modelling, applying a wide range of analytical techniques, including analyzing and modeling large data sets, exploratory data analysis or data mining processes.

Experience in compiling and managing large datasets, the use of relevant data statistical package and demonstrated understanding of advanced data analytical technique such a data preparation and analysis, data cleaning, extraction and interpretation.
Strong knowledge of data and statistical methods, tools, and operationalizing analytic models.
Demonstrated experience presenting data in a clear and compelling way, using graphical representation and data visualizations.
Demonstrated knowledge of contemporary research and evaluation methods, including writing detailed report and proposals.
Knowledge and demonstrated ability in corporate core competency including customer focus, communication, collaboration and personal ownership.
Please apply online by September 15, 2021. We thank all candidate for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted via email.
About the job
Description

Listening to Albertans. Going deeper to understand who they are and where they’re going. Translating the complex world of banking and investing into brilliantly simple solutions. Through all this, we believe we can create happiness. This is the ATB way.
Job Number: REQ2511
Location: Calgary, Edmonton, or Fully Remote in Canada
Apply by: 4 October 2021
Paygrade: K-OTH
# Positions available: 1
Leader Name: Shriya Sabharwal

As ATB’s next Senior Data Analyst, you will contribute to the overall success of the Performance, Strategy and Enablement (PS&E) team within the Technology, Innovation & Engineering (TIE) Group. The PS&E team is responsible for enabling Technology leader to make evidence-based decisions, which thereby support the creation and execution of People and Business strategies. This role is responsible for synthesizing complex data using advanced analytics, data visualizations, and storytelling to evaluate and communicate progress in support of maturing our tech talent practices.
Responsibilities
Data Analysis
As a key player in projects, gather and breakdown complex requirements, understand the root cause, and translate it into question that can be approached through analytics
Generate and test hypothesis by completing ETL processes, running SQL query and writing SQL scripts, building models, and creating dashboard view (Tableau reports)
Perform in-depth analysis and use relevant domain knowledge to identify trend and/or causal relationship to provide relevant, credible, and actionable recommendation
Provide reporting support, including the generation of accurate and timely standard and ad-hoc report for senior leadership in TIE
Define KPIs and set up data source for team and group performance scorecard
Use descriptive and predictive analytics to understand and forecast talent demand and supply to support strategic workforce decision
Storytelling and Dashboard Design
Synthesize data using data visualization and dashboard tailored to the audience and use
Tell the story behind the analysis in a clear and compelling way by helping a variety of audience understand the “so what” from their perspective
Requirements
Education And Experience
A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Math, Data Science or related field or equivalent experience
3+ year of practical progressive data analytics experience in building and supporting complex system using latest technology is essential
Must be able to understand, modify and develop SQL/database query for data analysis and building of business requirement
Strong working knowledge of BI tool like Tableau and PowerBI is a must
Comfort working with large set of data with ability to merge and analyze data from disparate source
Strong understanding of Information design and storytelling concept is a must
Must be a self-starting, results-oriented and highly motivated individual with ability to work in a fast paced, agile environment
Must be able to navigate ambiguity while being highly adaptable and flexible to changing demand

Must have excellent written and oral communication, strong analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skill to identify/document critical issues, prioritize and apply technology and industry practice in the most beneficial ways.
Progressive business/IT experience with minimum of 3 year of exposure to latest technologies/platform (e.g., GCP Big Query, SQL programming, Tableau, Python, concept of cloud platform)
Knowledge of the Human Capital domain, especially the technology talent space, will be considered a strong asset.
Nice to have working experience in agile methodology ( JIRA, Confluence).
At ATB, we know that highly talented people can readily transfer their skills. If you believe your skill and experience are transferable, please consider putting your name in the running.
Benefits
Online application are preferred.
Purpose. Growth. Advancement. Fun. Rewards… learn about our perk and benefits.
A Little About ATB

We are Alberta’s largest, home grown financial institution and for the last 80+ years, we’ve transformed people’s understanding of what banking can–and should–make possible. Today, 5,500+ ATB team member embrace a growth mindset in order to help bring ATB’s story to life, delivering happiness to our customer and team member alike. It’s why we’re also a highly sought after, award-winning employer. The best part is, we’re just getting started. Join us, and create happiness.
What happens next?

If you make the shortlist for this role, you will hear from u within 10 business day of the posting close date. We will also keep your application on file for future role that you may wish to consider.
We are also an equal opportunity employer. Find out more about what to expect when applying.
If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview.
Stay in touch!
ATB is happy to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow u on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.
About the job
Description

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that accomplishes operational excellence. Bringing together individual with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 22,000 team member in over 350 location worldwide are vital to making our company stronger.
Your Opportunity

The Innovation Office’s Digital Technology & Innovation team ha a job opening for an individual to serve a the Data Analytics Leader. This position involves leading the Data Analytics group a part of the DTI team, and will lead the firm in Business Intelligence and data service by providing architectural guidance, technological vision, and solution development. This group specifically utilizes advanced analytics, data science, and machine learning to give our business and our product a competitive advantage. It includes understanding and managing the data, how it interconnects, and architecting data for self-serve BI and BA opportunities. This position is for a person who ha demonstrated leadership capabilities, is business savvy, experienced in data analytics/data science, and enjoys framing a problem, shaping & creating solutions, and helping to champion implementation. As a member of the Innovation Office, the Data Analytics group within the Digital Technology & Innovation Team also engages in research & development and provides guidance and oversight a a center of excellence for the business. This group engages in new product research and testing and the incubation of data analytics idea that arise from around the company.

The team’s goal is to make project more efficient and help provide higher-quality result to our clients.

The ideal candidate will have a proven record a a team leader and expert in the field of data analytics and will serve the entire company a a member of the Innovation Office’s Digital Technology & Innovation team.

Lead, monitor, and supervise the Data Analytics group. This includes aligning the group to the Digital Technology and Innovation team’s goal and objectives. Be seen by the business line stakeholder a an extension of their team
Consult and lead on data analytics solution
Be able to tell the story of how data and analytics is positively impacting stakeholders.
Work closely with the business to achieve real value through informed decision and improved action
Give direction and insight on data analytics initiatives/areas of focus
Build end to end advanced analytics and AI/ML solution
Collect and prepare data. Help identify the business data needed to produce the most useful insight and future analytics. This would include business line and possibly outside source of data

Validate business implication

Synthesize analytics-derived insight into easy-to-understand, actionable recommendation that business user can easily understand. Ensure that the insight generated through sophisticated analytics translate to help drive better/faster/smarter design delivery and various type of a/e consulting activity
Stay abreast of the latest development and advancement – and how they could impact Stantec
Assist with the development of documentation, standards, best practices, and workflow for hardware/software in use across the business
Assist with providing oversight and guidance on centralized data management, governance, support, etc.
Present periodic TechTalk/Spotlight (internal company) webinars throughout the year on the topic of data analytics
Present to external audience a needed
Assist with marketing and business development description and activity a needed
Assist with internal and external website description a needed
Incubate data analytics idea
Apply critical thinking skill to develop innovative solution
Other miscellaneous task associated with being a member of the Digital Technology & Innovation team and task that may include those typical to a data analyst, data scientist, and data engineer
Qualifications
Capabilities and Credentials
Ability to execute highly complex or specialized project
Attention to detail
Communication and interpersonal skill applied to a variety of interaction with coworkers, client and one’s supervisor, exchanging information and receiving work direction effectively
Ability to anticipate and identify business line stakeholder’s need and synthesize them into concept and solution
Ability to apply project management principle
Ability to effectively organize, plan, prioritize, and manage time and competing priority
Thorough knowledge of data science including mathematics, statistical analysis and collection and storage of data
Ability to take data science project from end to end, store large amount of data, create predictive modeling process and present the finding
Behavioral Attributes
Passionate about helping business line drive their success utilizing data
Skilled storyteller with a passion for data and the aptitude to analyze and evaluate data, creating innovative advanced analytics that provide the business with a competitive edge
Inquisitive, with a desire to ask question and get a deeper understanding of business and data issue
Innovative and able to imagine new analytical solution to any problem
Confident in challenging perception and bias of individual diplomatically at every level of the organization to enact improvement
Ability to communicate well with people from both technical and non-technical backgrounds. Passionate about creating clarity by using accessible language
Business-oriented with a solid understanding of business requirement and vernacular
Highly detailed or le detailed a appropriate
Curious. Stays abreast of current and upcoming technology and tool
Education And Experience

A Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in business, IT, mathematics, statistics, or other relevant subject area and 15 to 20 year of data science, analysis, and engineering experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duty of the job including those listed above.
THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION AND CAN BE LOCATED ANYWHERE WITHIN CANADA.
Typical office environment working with computer and remaining sedentary for long period of time. This role may work from a dedicated home office.

About the job
Role Summary

The successful candidate will thrive in an agile environment where onboarding and modeling new data quickly and accurately for use countering threat is the only measure of success that matters. You will gain hands-on experience working with a wide variety of security technology and develop system and model for our data to allow analyst and researcher to rapidly access information they need. You will also have opportunity to contribute to various data science, detection, and threat research project that make use of the data you gather to solve real world problem in the security space.

The successful candidate will be someone who ha some experience in defining parsing logic to extract data of interest for security use cases, with a demonstrated ability to perform self-directed research in determining the meaning of various data point in an unfamiliar security technology or logging source.
The ability to communicate clear definition and documentation to support and test your reasoning is a must, a your interpretation of the data will be relied on and used extensively.
In this role, you will gain exposure to a multitude of different security solution and practical experience in developing and adapting conceptual framework for security operation to new tooling.
Job Responsibilities
Assist in the development of standard data model to power various security processes.
Explore new datasets and security technology to extract and test data point of relevance to various models, validating your assumption about the data.
Work closely with data engineer and security practitioner to help identify and source data for project in machine learning, threat intelligence, and other applied security use cases.

Act a a subject matter expert on the data you work with for other security analyst and/or software engineer a needed, communicating about your data deliverable clearly in both technical documentation and in person.
To be successful in this role, you will
Have a degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Security or equivalent, plus 3-5 year of industry experience in cybersecurity
Have a security mindset and general familiarity with how data might be used in an investigation.
Have a strong attention to detail.
Have some experience interpreting and parsing logs, through a SIEM or logging analytics platform.
Experience in cleaning data, exploratory data analysis, regex, data science, or aggregations.
Have some experience in data documentation and/or designing security use case from raw data.

Have strong communication skills; you will be working closely with security practitioner in different area and it is important that you can communicate clearly and learn to identify/recognize when there are nomenclature collision in terminology between the people you are speaking with, and adjust accordingly.
Nice to have
Have a relevant Master’s degree, or working towards Master’s degree
Experience in cleaning data or exploratory data analysis.
A strong working knowledge of Regex and/or SQL
Familiarity with Linux data manipulation tools, such a bash, jq, etc.
You have a self-starter attitude and love "getting your hand dirty
Why a Career with eSentire?

Our Culture: At eSentire we work in a collaborative and innovative work environment. We work with brilliant and passionate people who strive and encourage others to do their best. eSentire’s idea-rich environment welcome creative and sometimes unconventional perspectives!

Growth Opportunities: At eSentire you will have the opportunity to grow and make an impact from your work. We encourage innovation in all who become a part of our team. With growing operation internationally, there is lot of lateral and upward advancement opportunity for rewarding and developing career with eSentire. We’re strong believer in continuing education and provide the resource that you need to continue learning.

The Jr. Data Strategist is a critical member of the Publicis Data & Insights team. As consumer spend more time online, they leave behind “breadcrumbs” of their action and purchase intent. This rich data is incredibly valuable in helping to identify insight that lead to breakthrough communication strategy for our clients.

With a holistic background of digital experience, the Jr. Data Strategist will ingest data from analytics, search, social, and other first and third-party source to formulate compelling finding that present new way to approach problems. Partnering with account and strategy teams, they will use their knowledge of digital platform to apply finding into channel-specific recommendations.
This individual will be accountable to key stakeholder for delivering a clear opinion on how to win that drive a more succinct and thought-provoking creative product.
Responsibilities
Leading and participating in research development for digital & mass initiative for client
Working with agency team to understand client business in detail and be “the voice of the consumer” for client
Be able to source, digest and interpret business information and consumer / market data / cultural and social trend from a variety of sources, establishing fact and drawing smart conclusion to:
solve day-to-day client problem
support the creation of communication strategy
articulate trends/changes to consumer behaviour and the impact on motivation and pain point
develop clear and impactful client decks/presentations & POV document
Be intimately familiar with data metric & terminology
Show interest around the latest thinking and inspiration on human psychology and behavioral science
Working closely with agency partner to create integrated approach to campaigns, requiring working understanding of multiple marketing discipline
You are an ideal candidate if you:
Are curious by nature: interested how thing work and why they work that way
Think critically in everything you do
Have the spiciest take in the room
Are able to weed through any ask and identify the root problem/opportunity
Can tackle anything thrown your way and find a way to approach it from a different perspective
Can get along with everyone
Do what it take to deliver on your commitment
Set high quality standard of work for yourself and aim to get every detail right
Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback
Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging and rewarding environment
Are able to maintain constant and effective communication with multidisciplinary project team
Qualifications
Undergraduate Degree (Marketing, Business, Public Relations/Communications, Psychology) or other related degree considered an asset
1+ year of research or strategy experience, with clear evidence of strategic thinking and experience in digital platform (web, email, OLA, OLV & social; app experience is a plus)
Strong written and presentation skill
Ability to manage multiple project simultaneously and effectively
Self-starter who take ownership and responsibility
Client facing experience in an advertising environment is an asset
Basic understanding of Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Facebook Business/Ads manager
What we offer:
Opportunity to build something new and different
Platform to learn through action
Competitive salary vs. industry benchmark for experience level
Medical/dental benefit
Phone subsidy

About the job
The Role
Job Description:

Rakuten Kobo Inc. are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Big Data team. Reporting to the Manager of Business Analytics, you will play a key role in building reports, tools, and providing analysis against our collected data in order to allow company leadership to better serve our customers. Rakuten Kobo sell million of product in both retail and subscription models, in hundred of countries, and support both app & e-ink device reading. If you are looking to flex your analytical skill and have a desire to make reading life better - this is the role for you!
The Responsibilities
Work with business owner to define and refine KPIs for their area of responsibility.
Using your understanding of ecommerce and analytic tool & principles, mine our datasets to find meaningful insight and present to stakeholders.
Build, maintain, and update reporting & KPI dashboards.
Work with R&D, architecture, and data engineering team in order to build accurate & robust data-pipelines to feed our reports.
Maintain, update, and create documentation & lineage information in our tooling to ensure we promote Data Democracy and ensure best-in-class compliance with all data collection laws.
Required Skills
The Skillset:
Extensive SQL knowledge and experience: comfortable working with complex joins, stored procedures, and structured/unstructured data.
Extensive experience working with Tableau and/or other data visualization platforms: you have a passion for finding the best way to visualize multidimensional and time-series data.
Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to share, discuss, and analyze result with stakeholder who come with varying level of technical backgrounds.
Familiarity with language such a Python/pandas and/or statistical platform such a R: the more data-manipulation tool you have in your belt, the better!
B.Sc. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience.
Nice To Haves
An understanding of data engineering principle (fault tolerance, SLAs & monitoring, dependency management, ...)
Working experience with data engineering orchestration tool (Airflow, Luigi, ...)
Knowledge of ecommerce and marketing paradigm (Conversion, attribution, CPAs, ROI, retention, …)
Knowledge of industry standard app & device KPIs (Engagement, feature usage, MAUs, funnels, …)
Experience with, or a desire to learn, BigData tooling & parallel processing (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, …)
A passion for reading!
The Perks
Flexible and remote working environment
Full benefit starting from your first day
Paid Volunteer days, unlimited sick days, and 3% RRSP matching
Monthly commuting allowance
Flexible health spending account
Talent and development training budget
Free Kobo device + free weekly e-book or audiobook
Frequent Lunch and Learns Author series
Weekly Kobo Tech University session
Weekly trivia happy hour (Thirsty Thursdays, a we like to call it)
Maternity/paternity leave top up

Here at Rakuten Kobo Inc. we offer a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employee rank u highly in term of commitment to work/life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to have healthy mind and bodies. We believe in rewarding all our employee with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock option and training opportunities.
If you’re looking for a company that inspires passion, personal, and professional growth– join Kobo and come help u make reading life better.
About Rakuten Kobo Inc.

Owned by Tokyo-based Rakuten and headquartered in Toronto, Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the most advanced global ecommerce companies, with the world’s most innovative eReading service offering more than 6 million eBooks and audiobooks to 30 million + customer in 190 countries. Kobo delivers the best digital reading experience through creative innovation, award-winning eReaders, and top-ranking mobile apps. Kobo is a part of the Rakuten group of companies.

Rakuten Kobo Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodation for candidate with disability participating in the selection process are available on request. Any information received related to accommodation need of applicant will be addressed confidentially.
Rakuten Kobo would like to thank all applicant for their interest in this role however only qualified candidate will be shortlisted

About the job
About Ipsos

Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 market and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analyst and scientist have built unique multi-specialist capability that provide true understanding and powerful insight into the actions, opinion and motivation of citizens, consumers, patients, customer or employees. We serve more than 5000 client across the world with 75 business solutions.

Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD).
ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com

At Ipsos, we make market research work. We know numbers. We understand people. And we succeed in delivering results. That’s why so many of the world’s leading brand and organization look to u for their research needs.

Operating in over 80 countries, we are a global leader in survey-based market research and one of the fastest-growing and most successful firm in the business. Our research focus on five area of specialty – advertising, marketing, public opinion, loyalty, and medium – and our work focus on our people and our clients.
Sound like the right place for your career? Share our passion. Share our success. And join u in being proud to be Ipsos.
Senior Research Data Analyst, Toronto
(May be open to considering other major US and Canadian city for the right candidate)
Position Summary

As a Senior Research Data Analyst you will be responsible to support the Client Service team by providing in-depth data/statistical analysis to help client evaluate their advertising and brand performance relative to competition. The Senior Research Analyst will be expected to independently process and deliver analytic deliverables, advise Client Service in study design and interpretation of results, and be able to communicate analytic result with clarity.
Ideal Candidate ha the following Skills and Experience
2-3 year experience in an analytics role
MS degree in math/stats/research/social science preferred (advanced degree completion may be considered for job experience).
Experience with multivariate statistic (e.g. regression, factor analysis, correspondent analysis, discriminant analysis, driver analysis) is required.
Experience with SPSS, SAS and/or R;
Experience with Text analysis, working with different data sources/types (e.g. social data, qual survey data) is desirable.
Would be a plus
Programming experience in Python, VB,
Data visualization
Experience with SPSS Modeler.

Additionally, you have a reputation for creativity, attention to detail, excellent communication skill both oral and written and strategic insight in the delivery of research services. Above all, you are self-motivated with high energy, can work on multiple project simultaneously and thrive in a fast paced, and deadline driven environment.

We offer a team environment that recognizes and reward individual achievements. A full-service team of professional including leading-edge methodological consultant and sector and industry expert will support your work.

Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicant will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

About the job
Role Summary

The successful candidate will thrive in an agile environment where onboarding and modeling new data quickly and accurately for use countering threat is the only measure of success that matters. You will gain hands-on experience working with a wide variety of security technology and develop system and model for our data to allow analyst and researcher to rapidly access information they need. You will also have opportunity to contribute to various data science, detection, and threat research project that make use of the data you gather to solve real world problem in the security space.

The successful candidate will be someone who ha some experience in defining parsing logic to extract data of interest for security use cases, with a demonstrated ability to perform self-directed research in determining the meaning of various data point in an unfamiliar security technology or logging source.
The ability to communicate clear definition and documentation to support and test your reasoning is a must, a your interpretation of the data will be relied on and used extensively.
In this role, you will gain exposure to a multitude of different security solution and practical experience in developing and adapting conceptual framework for security operation to new tooling.
Job Responsibilities
Assist in the development of standard data model to power various security processes.
Explore new datasets and security technology to extract and test data point of relevance to various models, validating your assumption about the data.
Work closely with data engineer and security practitioner to help identify and source data for project in machine learning, threat intelligence, and other applied security use cases.

Act a a subject matter expert on the data you work with for other security analyst and/or software engineer a needed, communicating about your data deliverable clearly in both technical documentation and in person.
To be successful in this role, you will
Have a degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Security or equivalent, plus 3-5 year of industry experience in cybersecurity
Have a security mindset and general familiarity with how data might be used in an investigation.
Have a strong attention to detail.
Have some experience interpreting and parsing logs, through a SIEM or logging analytics platform.
Experience in cleaning data, exploratory data analysis, regex, data science, or aggregations.
Have some experience in data documentation and/or designing security use case from raw data.

Have strong communication skills; you will be working closely with security practitioner in different area and it is important that you can communicate clearly and learn to identify/recognize when there are nomenclature collision in terminology between the people you are speaking with, and adjust accordingly.
Nice to have
Have a relevant Master’s degree, or working towards Master’s degree
Experience in cleaning data or exploratory data analysis.
A strong working knowledge of Regex and/or SQL
Familiarity with Linux data manipulation tools, such a bash, jq, etc.
You have a self-starter attitude and love "getting your hand dirty

Division
I.T. Solutions
About Us

Serving a diverse urban and rural population of more than 430,000, Niagara Region is focused on building a strong and prosperous Niagara. Working collaboratively with 12 local area municipality and numerous community partners, the Region delivers a range of high quality program and service to support and advance the well-being of individuals, family and community within it boundaries. Nestled between the great lake of Erie and Ontario, the Niagara peninsula feature some of Canada’s most fertile agricultural land, the majesty of Niagara Falls and community that are rich in both history and recreational and cultural opportunities. Niagara boast dynamic modern cities, Canada’s most developed wine industry, a temperate climate, extraordinary theatre, and some of Ontario’s most breathtaking countryside. An international destination with easy access to it binational U.S. neighbour New York State, Niagara attracts over 14 million visitor annually, a well a a steady stream of new resident and businesses.

Job Summary
Job Description

Reporting to the Manager, GIS Services, the GIS Data Analyst provides technical and administrative support in the maintenance, dissemination and ongoing enhancement of data asset (spatial/non-spatial) to support the Corporation, 9-1-1 and Emergency Response Operations in Niagara.
Education
Post-secondary degree or College diploma in Computer Science/Engineering, Geomatics, Geographic Information Systems, or related field of study.
Knowledge
Minimum of 3 year creating, editing and maintaining data in an SQL and/or ESRI environment
Knowledge and experience working with data source such a Municipal Property Assessment Corporation, Teranet, Statistics Canada, Land Information Ontario, etc.
Experience with addressing and street-naming process and standard
Foundation in data quality assessment, maintenance and on-going program implementation
Responsibilities
Creates and/or maintains data asset (spatial/non-spatial) to support the Corporation, 9-1-1 and Emergency Response Operations in Niagara. (40% of time)

Undertakes analysis and adjustment of GIS layers, including (but not limited to) single-line road network, addressing points/ranges, routing network and emergency service zone to facilitate the implementation and sustainability in accordance with applicable 9-1-1 standard and regulations.
Responsible for updates, corrections, testing and quality of corporate data asset
Provide support for the acquisition/capture, maintenance and dissemination of data ensuring adherence to Regional standards, strategy and governance
Establishes and undertakes processes/procedures for ensuring the quality and accuracy of data assets.(20% of time)
Works with internal and/or external team to implement and monitor quality control project for data asset
Investigates road and address data discrepancy with appropriate jurisdiction on behalf of 9-1-1stakeholder agencies, communicating back any finding and updating relevant datasets accordingly.
Investigates data discrepancy with client-based data asset and ensures necessary adjustment are made to maintain a high quality
Provides technical guidance and support to internal and external staff a required to ensure compliance with current and future data standards.
Provides service to customer requesting aerial photography, mapping and other data assets. (15% of time)
Provides base mapping and data update to 9-1-1 stakeholder agency including Bel Canada, Niagara Regional Police Services, Niagara Emergency Medical Services and Municipal Fire Dispatch centres.
Undertakes required data conversion and packaging for delivery to 9-1-1 stakeholder agencies.
Prepares necessary data license agreements, process payment for data request and provides report to manager on product sales.

Responsible for completing, maintaining, updating all record associated with the dissemination of data to both internal and external customer and ensures delivery are conducted in accordance with established standards, policies, procedure and service level agreements.
Identifies and evaluates new technology and automation related to data maintenance and dissemination, 9-1-1 and dispatch operations. (15% of time)
Identifies opportunity to optimize process around maintenance, delivery, reconciliation and quality assurance/quality control of core and 9-1-1 data assets.
Researches and develops standard for data asset (spatial, non-spatial, 9-1-1 related)
Provides recommendation to external agency regarding their standard for 9-1-1 spatial data, civic addressing and road-naming conventions.

Participates in and provides technical/analytical support to working group and committee related to data, 9-1-1 and emergency response a required (e.g. Corporate Data Group, 9-1-1 Advisory Committee, 9-1-1 Data and Process Improvement Working Group, etc.). (10% of time)
Assist in developing material for information session and displays, training, team intranet site, outreach, and marketing in partnership with Corporate Communications.
Special Requirements
In accordance with the Corporate Criminal Record Check Policy, the position requires the incumbent to undergo a Criminal Records Check and submit a Canadian Police Clearance Certificate

Regional staff strive to enable the strategic priority of council and the organization through the completion of their work. Staff carry out their work by demonstrating the corporate value of service, honesty, choice, partnership and respect.
Shift Information
This position is currently subject to working overtime and weekends.

About the job
Job Description

Client is smart team communication software that unifies all messages, data, and documentation to help you focus on the work that matters. By aligning team through action-based communication, Client drastically reduces email volume and creates more efficient, productive, and collaborative workflow across organizations.
With Client , any team—no matter the size or location—can work a one to achieve empowered alignment and maximum productivity.

So what doe that mean ? Story mode: Remember when the Ever Given got stuck in the Suez Canal? Imagine what it take to move a ship like that, that ha thousand of containers; There are hundred of stakeholder around the cargo, and dozen more around the ship. The ship ha an owner, it is often rented and operated by another company, it is crewed, fueled, cleaned and docked; cargo is loaded, unloaded, and need to comply with country specific and cargo specific regulations. There may be tax or tariff and fee to be paid etc. etc. All of this and more is done through emails, thousand of them, per journey. (Hey, at least it isn’t fax and telex like it wa in memory more recent than you’d imagine.) These thousand of email are handled by a team of dozen of people, in a company of hundreds. Now, because most email carry some information, request, or report in them, many email might traditionally trigger a flurry of other email (“Hey Jody, can you attach the filled custom forms”, “Hey Mike, did you see this?” , “Alex, is this the price we agreed upon” )

Client attack all of these problems, email no longer engender other emails, the internal “chat” can take care of that, it also allows everyone to keep track of who ha the ball on any action item. Client also make sure that the right people see the right emails, and minimizes the number of people who see an email (and therefore of email seen by each person). Auxiliary data such a file relevant to the project can be attached with a single click, and integration with external system allows for further automation and tie-ins.

We work hard and strive for results. We also value people’s life outside of work. The people of Client are world travellers, devoted parents, ultra marathon runners, knitting enthusiasts, animal lovers, ski adventurers, hip hop dancers, Canada Games athletes, emergency response volunteers, and so much more. We’re told that one of the best thing about working at Client is that everyone is empowered to solve large problem and that everyone’s opinion is valued.
What You Will Do
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be
Responsible for using ML/AI to help Client and it client extract intelligence from email
Building production ready component that will be used by the product / integrations.
Leading the definition and development of “Intelligent” product
Working a part of a cross functional team of developers, designer and Product Managers.
Requirements
Must-have
Coding: Text processing ML in a production environment, (Python)
NLP pipelines, with specific experience in NER & Text Classification.
Experience fine-tuning model on domain specific corpus
Experience productionalizing / deploying ML model
Model Evaluation and Monitoring, (e.g. Alerting on model drift)
Advanced knowledge in SQL, including optimization of query and schemas.
Nice-to-have
Experience leading Data Science / ML teams.
Familiarity with Jupyter Notebooks like Jupyterhub/lab and Databricks.
Experience deploying model on EC2 / Lambda
Experience with NLP in non-English text
Experience with Python data visualization library like dash, plotly express.
Benefits
What we offer in return:
Share option - you’ll own part of the Client journey.
Collaborative and creative environment.
Being part of the journey of a fast growing SaaS Company.
Private Medical Insurance.
Flexible work environment.
Maternity and Paternity benefits.
We help you grow - both professionally and personally.
Unfortunately, we cannot sponsor visa for this role.

We attract global talent. Our development team are based out of Canada and the UK. This opportunity is based out of Vancouver. We are also open for remote employee in Canada a long a you are able to work in EST / PST timezone.
At Client
We accept who you are.
We celebrate our success together.
We value your time and life outside of work.
We value diversity in every shape and form.
We operate globally, with office in London, Vancouver, and Singapore.
About the job

My Intelligent Machines (MIMs) is looking for a talented ML Developer to join a dynamic team building a world class augmented intelligence R&D platform for life scientist working in BioPharma and agriculture companies.

MIMs is a fast-growing software company, with a dynamic and gender balanced team building a world class R&D augmented intelligence platform for life scientist working in BioPharma and agriculture companies, helping them to stratify patient populations, to identify drug target and biomarkers and to develop more efficient and personalized treatment and Agro-Products.

You will work closely with life scientists, bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, data scientists, AI and software engineers. This full time position will focus on designing data integration and multi-omic modeling strategy and to support their implementation within MIMs solutions. Ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, system biology, statistical modeling, and data analysis, particularly a applied to large-scale, high-dimensional data sets. In particular, we are interested in candidate who have experience on spatio-temporal  and time series data analysis to support the development of anomaly detection algorithm and pattern detection in time series. In particular, we are interested in candidate who have experience with dynamic pattern recognition,  multi-omic data modality to support the inference of gene functionality and co-functionality, functional interaction, system modeling applied to system stratification, biomarkers and drug target identification.
Main Responsibilities
Provide scientific leadership in the goals, architecture, and implementation of multi-omic data integration and modeling aspect of solution developed at MIMs;
Work with scientist and software developer of the solution team to identify, adapt or develop pipeline and methods;
Enhance and improve MIMs ML model
Enhance and improve MIMs ML Ops Pipeline
Research and POC for state-of-the-art technology
Qualifications
Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering,bioinformatics, or related field
3+ year of postdoc or post-graduate experience
strong experience in time series analysis and spatio-temporal analysis
Strong experience working with Python, Numpy and Pandas
A solid understanding of Machine Learning fundamental
Asset: Experience with TextCNN, LSTM, seq2seq, Attention, GAN model
Experience with one of the following libraries: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Skills in Linux environment, shell script, git, and docker.
Asset: Having deployed a M-L system on a production environment
Ideal candidate will have a strong background in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data analysis, particularly a applied to large-scale, high-dimensional multi-omic data sets;
Proven experience in life science data modeling
Excellent verbal and written communication skill (English/French).
Who you are

A flexible attitude to job role a well a a willingness to contribute wherever needed. The ideal candidate will take full ownership of their core responsibilities, and will be comfortable with those responsibility evolving with the changing need of the company;
Ability to contribute in a multidisciplinary team a a strong team player, focused on delivering result against multiple deadline in a fast-paced growing environment.
A team player who is highly proactive, self-motivated, and detail-oriented.
About MIMs

My Intelligent Machines (MIMs), based in Montreal, is a leader in artificial intelligence applied to life sciences. We provide Biopharma and Agtech company with augmented intelligence system enabling life scientist working in this space to model patients, cells, tissue or farm animal to develop more efficient and personalized treatment and agro-products. The company is growing at a fast pace and ha a strong and active research and development team.

About the job
HomeX is an end-to-end technology and service platform for both homeowner and service providers, radically improving the historically complex and fragmented home service industry.

Our technology team includes a dedicated Applied Science group, where world-leading natural language and knowledge engineers, use these skill to solve customer problem and build the HomeX consumer experience.

As an intern in the HomeX Applied Science group, you’ll have the opportunity to work on an independent project. You’ll have assistance from our group at every turn, but you will be able to apply your research and engineering knowledge to solve a complex real-world problem. You’ll create data-driven solution that allow homeowner and technician to solve problem in the home quickly and efficiently. You’ll write code to train, test, deploy and evaluate ML models, using Python (numpy, pandas, Tensorflow) in one of the following areas: NLU, machine perception, machine reasoning, knowledge engineering, and ontology.

About the job
Company Description
RailVision Analytics is building the “Waze” for the rail industry by providing direction to operator in real-time for driving train in the most efficient, timely, and safe manner possible.
Our company is a venture-backed start-up at a seed stage, with numerous early customer in the passenger and freight markets, and a continuously growing customer base.

We aim to be a leader in rail software within 3 year and are looking to grow our operation globally in the coming year. Join our dynamic team with ambitious goal and a flexible remote work policy with destination quarterly meetings!
Why Work With Us?
Awesome work-from-home policy with quarterly in-person meeting around the world
Competitive salary for quick-learners and fast-paced individual
You will have the ability to gain career experience beyond strict job requirements, with decision-making power to be the master of your own project
Resources for self-improvement including courses, software, workshops, and conference
We are committed to hiring great people from diverse backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it make our company stronger
Job Description Overview

As a member of the Engineering Team, you will be responsible for implementing machine-learning solution to determine the optimal operation of train in dynamic, real-world environments. This challenge will require you to bridge the gap between current rail operation and train dynamics, but also future Autonomous Train Operations (ATO). We are looking for a driven, intellectual, and passionate individual with industry experience that is ready to play a significant role in the growth of the company.
Technical Responsibilities
Develop Reinforcement Learning algorithm to provide safe and efficient train operation
Design and build environment to simulate realistic rail operation that perform with high accuracy to live environment
Productize machine learning algorithm to operate in a production environment
Communicate with a team of front-end and back-end developer to integrate solution via APIs
Determine methodology for using current software in an ATO setting
Drive continuous product development and contribute to direction of technological development
Other Responsibilities
Maintain a high-level of communication between manager and development team
Conduct formal presentation to other team members, managers, and in public
Contribute to various aspect of a growing company
Be an ambassador of technological advancement and revolutionized transportation
Grow personal connection to the industry to understand trend and opportunity
Technical Qualifications
Proven experience delivering machine learning algorithm in an operational setting
At least 3 year of relevant work experience
(Preferred) Master’s degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Engineering or related
(Bonus) Experience in the rail industry
(Double Bonus) Experience in Autonomous Train Operations
Strong working knowledge of statistical technique (distributions, regressions, error bounds, etc.)
Experience with Python, ML library such a Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch, pandas, and more…
Experience with git version control, agile methodology, MS 365, and other common software tool
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and common CS algorithm
Professional communication ability in English
Who We Look For
Driven, self-motivated, and detail-focused individual
Clear and concise communicator
Passion for career growth and continuous learning
Organized in work habits, schedules, timelines, documentation and correspondence
Other Details
Remote work with quarterly in-person meeting (location is voted on every quarter)
Incentives offered such a Employee Stock Options and yearly bonus

Department Overview

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning system that have the power to uplift large population while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capability have been publicly recognized through a number of win in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google’s Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 - Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).
Job Description

We are looking for world-class engineer to tackle cutting-edge problem of applying Machine Learning in the real world. Join this team to develop a framework for machine learning model that have real world impact. The goal of the framework is to help our ML Scientists build robust and high performing model through providing a solid foundation and allowing for fast iteration.

As Machine Learning Engineer at Layer 6, you will work with ML Scientists to learn their modelling workflow, so that you can design abstraction and build component that can be combined to build high quality models. You will work with ML Platform team to make sure these model can be trained and deployed on our computing infrastructure, taking advantage of cloud technology like Kubernetes.
Job Requirements
- Experience with building and scaling data-intensive software in Java
- You value good software design and sweat over detail in code and API design
- Knowledge of machine learning modelling workflow
- You enjoy learning new technology and also educating others
- You strive to communicate clearly and with empathy
- You take great personal pride in building robust and scalable software

Nice to have
- Experience building a library or a framework
- Knowledge of machine learning algorithm
- Experience with Kubernetes
- Data analytics
- Comfortable with math or statistic

About Huawei

Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communication technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solution across four key domain – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud service – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

At Huawei, innovation focus on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthrough that drive the world forward. We have more than 180,000 employees, and we operate in more than 170 country and regions. Founded in 1987, Huawei is a private company fully owned by it employees.
About Huawei Canada

Huawei Canada help connect Canadians to world-leading high-speed wireless Internet – and supply them with cutting-edge smart devices. In partnership with Canadian telecommunication providers, we work to bring the benefit of a reliable and secure digital experience to every person, home and organization, including those in rural and remote area of the country. Huawei first came to Canada in 2008. Today, the company employ more than 1,100 Canadians in research and development, IT, sale and other fields. Huawei Canada is an active supporter of many charitable and community initiative from coast to coast.

Take into consideration of the mobile computing constraint for the optimization of algorithm and machine learning model

About the job

DarkVision’s ultrasound imaging system collect huge datasets on the order of hundred of gigabyte that are several kilometer long where a defect may be on the order of a few mm. It is essential that we develop algorithm for automated processing, measuring, classification and visualization of this data since manual processing is both time consuming and inconsistent.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be involved in researching, designing and implementing deep learning architecture that learn efficient generalizable representation for several task including: classification, regression, segmentation and object detection. You will be developing machine learning pipeline for continuous training, evaluation and deployment of deep learning models.

Our management process is light and generally milestone driven, using pseudo-agile sprint derived from our quarterly and yearly goals. All goal are internally generated with plenty of room for feedback.
Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
Research Algorithms: Implement and train candidate deep learning architecture such a CNNs, Autoencoders and attention-based models.
Develop Machine Learning Pipelines: Develop cloud-based iterative pipeline for image pre-processing, data-augmentation, training, post-processing and inference.
Deploy and monitor ML models: Deploy ML algorithm in conjunction with other member of the Software Team for our Data Team to use and implement tool to monitor the performance.
Create Data collection Tools: Plan and develop tool for aiding in the collection and labelling training data while working closely with our Data team.
Expectations:
Smart, keen, quick, and strong desire to learn new things.
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
Strong analytical skill in linear algebra, geometry, and statistics.
Experience developing Image Processing and conventional Computer Vision algorithm (OpenCV).
Experience developing Deep Learning Models for Computer Vision tasks.
Good working knowledge of one or more Machine Learning Frameworks (TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch etc.)
Experience with Python beyond basic Machine Learning scripting (i.e., Numpy and Pandas).

AWS service like Sagemaker, Batch, Lambda.
Experience training model with imbalanced datasets.
Experience training semantic and/or instance segmentation models.
Previous research experience and familiarity with latest advancement in Computer Vision.
Experience developing with C++.

Competitive salary or higher (Top $ for top talent)
Fulltime role
Full benefit
Competitive vacation allotment

About the job

The Health ML engineering team is responsible for building scalable detection system that keep spam, manipulation, and abuse at bay. We use ML and relevance technique to make Twitter safer and to limit the spread of misinformation on the platform. Our team work across the product to detect abusive and spammy user and content, increase action on bad actors, drive change in user behavior, and detect and remediate account that are violating the term of service on Twitter.
We develop, maintain, and contribute to several machine learning model and systems, including
Models that detect unwanted interaction
Models to prioritize human review of account violating Twitter's policy to more quickly take action and limit their damage
Detection of bot that misuse the platform or spread misinformation
Detection of repeat abusive offender who create new account after being suspended
Real-time rule engine and clustering system to identify and action on cluster of bad actor at scale
Teams Who Are Hiring
Platform Manipulation Aiming to stop adversarial effort to manipulate our platform & mitigate attempt to artificially amplify or suppress information or manipulate people’s experience on Twitter.
Civic Integrity Protect and promote the health of public conversation on Twitter, a it relates to a specific civic event or broader civic engagement.
Abusive Interactions Ensuring Twitter is a safe space for public conversation (safe from severe abusive interactions) to enable users’ healthy participation.
Misinformation Reducing creation and remediate consumption of misleading information in order to eliminate it potential harm to Twitter users.
What You’ll Do

Although you will work on cutting-edge problems, this position is not a pure research position. You will participate in the engineering life-cycle at Twitter, including designing distributed systems, writing production code and data pipelines, conducting code review and working alongside our infrastructure and reliability teams. You’ll apply data science, machine learning, and/or graph analysis technique to a variety of modeling and relevance problem involving users, their social graph, their tweets, and their behavior.
Qualifications
Who You Are

You’re a relevance engineer, applied data scientist, or machine-learning engineer who want to work on exciting algorithmic and deep infrastructure issue to improve the health of the public conversation on Twitter. You’re experienced at solving large scale relevance problem and comfortable doing incremental quality work while building brand new system to enable future improvements.
You are experienced in one or more of the following machine learning (including deep learning), information retrieval, recommendation systems, social network analysis.
You are a strong technical advocate with a background in Java, C++, or Scala, and Python.
Experience with a number of ML technique and frameworks, e.g. data discretization, normalization, sampling, linear regression, decision trees, deep neural networks, etc
3+ year experience with one or more DL software framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch, Theano
You strive to find the right balance between moving fast to deliver quality improvement to user and accumulating technical debt that drag down productivity.
You have a collaborative working style with a strong focus on disciplined execution and results.
You like to ground decision in data and reasoning and solve root cause of problem rather than surface issues.
You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
You look ahead to identify opportunity and thrive in a culture of innovation.

M.S. or PhD in Computer Science or Machine Learning related degree; or equivalent work experience in the field
5+ year experience leading and delivering effective ML solution for large scale production use cases.
