About the job
Company Description
At Twitter, we would like to connect people with the conversations, topic and content that are most relevant to them, in real-time.

We are a community of Machine Learning Researchers and Engineers, working to drive Twitter’s research in recommender systems. We tackle local and global technical challenge amongst product team through a range of system - e.g. timeline ranking, push notifications, email notification and ad predictions. We operate at scale whilst ensuring fair and ethical use of our model and data.
Job Description

Apply your research expertise to improve our ML-driven recommender system products, help u develop new solution and unlock new directions, a well a analyse and optimise the system we already have. You’ll work closely with product team and mentor them on best practice for modern ML, and keep the wider team informed on the state-of-the-art. In addition, you will be in a strategic position to influence future roadmaps for Twitter’s recommender system products.
Who You Are

You have a depth of knowledge in a ML-driven field - e.g. Probabilistic modeling, Reinforcement learning, Deep learning etc and you are interested in applying your knowledge and skill set to one or more challenge of our product area - e.g. medium / content understanding, new item/user modeling, temporal modeling, model performance optimisation. You are passionate about the way we develop state-of-the-art technology and are excited by the application of theory to real-world problems. You keep up to date with the latest development in the field and look for way to apply them to your current work/role.
Qualifications

Master, Post-graduate or PhD in computer science, machine learning, information retrieval, recommendation systems, natural language processing, statistics, math, engineering, operation research, or other quantitative discipline; or equivalent work experience
Good theoretical grounding in core machine learning concept and technique
Ability to perform comprehensive literature review and provide critical feedback on state-of-the-art solution and how they may fit to different operating constraints.

Experience with a number of ML technique and frameworks, e.g. data discretization, normalization, sampling, linear regression, decision trees, SVMs, deep neural networks, bandits, reinforcement learning etc
Familiarity with one or more DL software framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch
Nice to have
Experience with large-scale system and data, e.g. Hadoop, distributed system
Publications in top conference such a ICLR, NIPS, ICML, RECSYS, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, etc
Experience with one or more of the following
Recommender Systems
Model optimisation
Deep Learning
Prediction / Inference (e.g. Bayesian)
Online Learning
Reinforcement Learning
About the job
Company Description

Twitter is what’s happening and what people are talking about right now. For us, life's not about a job, it's about purpose. We believe real change start with conversation. Here, your voice matters. Come a you are and together we'll do what's right (not what's easy) to serve the public conversation.
Job Description

Who We Are The Topic Signals team is part of Cortex, the central machine learning organization at Twitter. Cortex’s mission is to empower internal team to efficiently leverage machine learning by providing platform, modeling, and research expertise while advancing the ML technology within Twitter.

We tackle Twitter-specific challenge in building topical model for our content. These include tweets, spaces, and other form of user generated content on our platform. We apply and advance state of the art machine learning technique to invent new model and system that can be used to help u understand the semantics of these content, and ultimately improve various Twitter experience for our customers.
We operate at scale whilst ensuring fair and ethical use of our model and data.

What you will do Apply your NLP expertise to propose and develop model and solution that improve the topical understanding of tweet and text. Devise model and algorithm and guide engineering to develop scalable solution that can work in real-time with large amount of data. Help u develop novel solutions, and unlock new direction in both the method we use and the application of our team's work.

You will collaborate with product team to help them apply NLP and our topic model in the best possible way for their application and use cases. As the authority on topic modeling and content understanding, you will be able to influence the team’s roadmap and help product team seek out new opportunity to leverage our model and solutions.

You will also be engaging with the research community via publication and conferences. Twitter, and our team, are suitably positioned to be thought leader in the space of topic modeling and social medium content understanding.

Who you are You have sound knowledge of state-of-the-art NLP model (in particular deep learning models) and are capable of applying them to real-world problems. You are comfortable with building production-grade software systems, and are up-to-date with software engineering best practices. You are able to provide tech guidance and help to your junior peers.
Qualifications
Masters degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science or Machine Learning related degree; or equivalent work experience in the field
2+ year NLP applied research experience, preferably experience applying NLP research to real-world problem in the industry
2+ year of experience building production NLP models, and deploying them to solve inference challenge at scale
Good theoretical grounding in core machine learning concept and technique
Ability to perform comprehensive literature review and provide critical feedback on state-of-the-art solution and how they may fit different operating constraint
Experience with a number of ML technique and frameworks, e.g., data discretization, normalization, sampling, linear regression, decision trees, SVMs, deep neural networks, etc.
Experience With Large-scale Systems And Data, E.g. Hadoop
Experience driving and leading a team to deliver problem in the NLP space
Familiarity with one or more deep learning software framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch
Preferably publication in top conferences/journals including ACL, EMNLP, and NAACL

Data that matter and that is shaping the impact of billion dollar brands.

While this position can be remote, Numerator is only able to hire in many, but not all, state and provinces. In certain cases, if you are not located in a specific area where Numerator is able to hire, you may not be eligible for employment.

About the job

The Health ML engineering team is responsible for building scalable detection system that keep spam, manipulation, and abuse at bay. We use ML and relevance technique to make Twitter safer and to limit the spread of misinformation on the platform. Our team work across the product to detect abusive and spammy user and content, increase action on bad actors, drive change in user behavior, and detect and remediate account that are violating the term of service on Twitter.
We develop, maintain, and contribute to several machine learning model and systems, including
Models that detect unwanted interaction
Models to prioritize human review of account violating Twitter's policy to more quickly take action and limit their damage
Detection of bot that misuse the platform or spread misinformation
Detection of repeat abusive offender who create new account after being suspended
Real-time rule engine and clustering system to identify and action on cluster of bad actor at scale
Teams Who Are Hiring
Platform Manipulation Aiming to stop adversarial effort to manipulate our platform & mitigate attempt to artificially amplify or suppress information or manipulate people’s experience on Twitter.
Civic Integrity Protect and promote the health of public conversation on Twitter, a it relates to a specific civic event or broader civic engagement.
Abusive Interactions Ensuring Twitter is a safe space for public conversation (safe from severe abusive interactions) to enable users’ healthy participation.
Misinformation Reducing creation and remediate consumption of misleading information in order to eliminate it potential harm to Twitter users.
What You’ll Do

Although you will work on cutting-edge problems, this position is not a pure research position. You will participate in the engineering life-cycle at Twitter, including designing distributed systems, writing production code and data pipelines, conducting code review and working alongside our infrastructure and reliability teams. You’ll apply data science, machine learning, and/or graph analysis technique to a variety of modeling and relevance problem involving users, their social graph, their tweets, and their behavior.
Qualifications
Who You Are

You’re a relevance engineer, applied data scientist, or machine-learning engineer who want to work on exciting algorithmic and deep infrastructure issue to improve the health of the public conversation on Twitter. You’re experienced at solving large scale relevance problem and comfortable doing incremental quality work while building brand new system to enable future improvements.
You are experienced in one or more of the following machine learning (including deep learning), information retrieval, recommendation systems, social network analysis.
You are a strong technical advocate with a background in Java, C++, or Scala, and Python.
Experience with a number of ML technique and frameworks, e.g. data discretization, normalization, sampling, linear regression, decision trees, deep neural networks, etc
3+ year experience with one or more DL software framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch, Theano
You strive to find the right balance between moving fast to deliver quality improvement to user and accumulating technical debt that drag down productivity.
You have a collaborative working style with a strong focus on disciplined execution and results.
You like to ground decision in data and reasoning and solve root cause of problem rather than surface issues.
You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
You look ahead to identify opportunity and thrive in a culture of innovation.
Requirements
M.S. or PhD in Computer Science or Machine Learning related degree; or equivalent work experience in the field
5+ year experience leading and delivering effective ML solution for large scale production use cases.

At Slalom Build we co-create modern technology and software product with client who are ready to accelerate their digital transformation. We choose to imagine thing made better, and then set out on a journey to realize what’s possible. By blending design, product engineering, analytics, and automation, we build the custom-built software and data product of tomorrow. Stay abreast of new tools, packages, and Machine Learning technique and consistently push the limit of what is possible to deliver the best solution
Collaborate with Product Owners to apply Slalom’s agile process and be responsible to lead the initiation, delivery, and transition of project for your team in a client-facing role
Explains model result to technical and non-technical audience including leading highly technical presentation
Lead and mentor engineer and machine learning practitioners. Lead smaller project (3 to 5 people) a the technical lead from project initiation to delivery
Share project finding with the wider Machine Learning group
Build and maintain relationship with customer
Collaborate with a variety of stakeholder across the Slalom organization

Willingness to travel up to 50%, at peak time
What You’ll Bring

Experience on any of these cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Excellent verbal and written communication skill
Proficiency with both Linux and Windows

About Us

Slalom Build is a highly-scalable, high-velocity Build a a Service firm. We work with client in a flexible, collaborative, and repeatable methodology to create custom technology solution for their most impactful initiative and to accelerate their digital transformation journey. Over 1000 Builders strong, distributed across eleven dynamic cities, our innovation hub attract the type of people who contribute to thriving teams. By placing builder in close proximity to client – a well a their cultural and technology cohort – we can assure the quality, versatility, and speed that product delivery demands, along with the elasticity and scale to tailor to individual client needs.

Slalom Build leverage a foundation of innovation inherited from Slalom, a Seattle-based firm that set out in 2001 to disrupt and redefine management consulting. Now 8,000+ professional strong around the globe, Slalom is deeply engaged with some of the world’s most influential, change-making enterprises. Learn more at slalom.com.

About the job

TradeRev ha changed the automotive industry with it revolutionary product. Built a a multi-platform live auction app, TradeRev’s online automotive remarketing system ha made a huge impact in the industry and ha acquired quick user adoption with a fast-growing client base. As a subsidiary of KAR Auction Services, Inc. and partnering with our sister company ADESA, we are continuing to expand TradeRev’s footprint in the dealer-to-dealer online space in the US and Canadian markets.

Experience designing and implementing machine learning model that are production-ready

About the job
Company Description

Twitter is what’s happening and what people are talking about right now. For us, life's not about a job, it's about purpose. We believe real change start with conversation. Here, your voice matters. Job Description

Who We Are Twitter is serving the public conversation, and conversation are happening on Twitter every day about every subject and any event. The Search and Recommendations team job is to connect our user to the conversation and people that are relevant to them.

Search and Recommendations build infrastructure and model to support this mission across multiple product areas. We are responsible for the recommendation you see under Search, Explore, Trends, Topics, the Home Timeline. The unrivaled challenge that we face at Twitter are both the data scale and the real-time nature of the product. How do you find the most meaningful content among hundred of million of new tweet for hundred of million of user every day at Twitter? Description

Amazon Freight (AF) is disrupting the multi-billion dollar trucking industry by building technical solution that allow external customer to tap into the scale of Amazon's logistical network for their transportation needs.
The AF Pricing Team owns the system and ML algorithm for generating optimal price for each customer's transportation request.

In this team you will work closely with research scientist and engineer to apply state-of-the-art ML algorithm that learn from vast amount of data on network topology, transportation costs, routing/transit times, industry benchmarks, and many more. You will play a key role in developing service to run these prediction on distributed system at incredible scale and speed, generating price that both delight our customer and is profitable to our business. You will also work closely with product manager to build application and tool to support managing and configuring our pricing systems.

Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Does the challenge of designing large scale system that apply state-of-the-art computer science to solve real-world problem interest you? To meet these challenges, the AF Pricing team is looking for passionate, talented, and inventive software engineer with a blend of technical, analytical, and design skill who will collaborate with other engineers, project managers, product managers, research scientist across different country and cross-functional team to help build out the next generation pricing solution for Amazon Freight.

2+ year of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one modern language such a Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
1+ year of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Experience or interest in Machine Learning
Experience working with extremely large data-sets
Experience building and operating highly scalable web application
Experience building and operating distributed system
Excellent verbal and written communication skill

Description

Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultant bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. Our business value and leadership ha been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner.

We are also market leader in AI & Analytics consulting in the CPG & retail industry with over 40% of our revenue coming from the sector. This is our fastest growing sector and we are beefing up our talent in the space.

Work on the latest application of data science to solve business problem in the Revenue Growth Management space of CPG
Work directly with client stakeholder to translate business problem into high level analytics solution design
Present analytic solution to business audience highlighting robustness of the solution and how it could help generate business value
Responsible for managing analytics projects, collaborating with client stakeholder and Tiger’s team situated globally
Participate in discussion with team member to select and apply relevant analytic technique and create actionable business insight
Responsible for making presentation to senior management, communicating result to business teams, and develop plan to help operationalize analytic solution
Supporting pursuit in the RGM space and leading pitch with the client
Support development of IP in the RGM space

6-10 year of professional work experience with at least 5 year in data analytics
Ability to engage with executive/VP level stakeholder from client’s team to translate business problem to high level analytics solution approach
Deep knowledge and understanding of the RGM space
Strong project management and team management skill and ability to work with global team
Solid understanding of statistical and machine learning algorithm is a plus
Strong SQL skill and hands-on experience with analytic tool like R & Python; & visualization tool like Qlik or Tableau is a plus
Exposure to cloud platform and big data system such a Hadoop HDFS, Hive is a plus
Ability to work with IT and Data Engineering team to help embed analytic output in business process
Graduate in Business Analytics or MBA or equivalent work experience

About the job

What make Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you? When you join the world’s leading Research & Advisory company, you’ll be part of a team that value curiosity, expert insights, bold idea and intellectual courage, while driving partnership with global organization to make the right decision on their key initiatives. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration, you’ll not only help client accomplish their mission-critical priorities, but also grow your career and the scope of your impact across industries. Our culture demand dedication— and reward it with opportunity. If you’re always looking for what’s next in business and technology, Gartner is looking for you.
ABOUT THE TEAM

The machine learning team at Gartner TalentNeuron work on exciting challenges: those of extracting structured information from unstructured data. Our data are billion of online job posting in text and HTML format in more than 15 different languages. Among our recent projects, there are salary extraction from a job posting, prediction of an occupation category and industry, normalization of job titles, extraction and categorization of skills, and many more.

By joining the ML team at Gartner TalentNeuron you join a team of expert and AI-enthusiasts who keep track of what’s the most modern and effective in the field. We use state-of-the-art tool such a Tensorflow/PyTorch, deep neural architectures, industrial-grade pretrained models; we have access to modern GPUs and near TB-RAM servers.
Our motivation (and day-to-day “routine”) is to solve challenging problem that only AI can solve.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Apply knowledge of programming, math, statistics, and machine learning to build solution for recognizing pattern in the real-world data, organizing information, extracting entity and discovering relation between them, leading to prototype development and product improvement
Use an analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive model and advanced algorithm that lead to optimal value extraction from the data
Work with engineer to translate prototype into new products, services, and feature and provide guideline for large-scale implementation
Extend, develop, program, and implement new algorithm
QUALIFICATIONS
One of the following:
University Degree in Computer Science
University Degree in Computational Linguistics, Computational Biology, Statistics, or Applied Math, and 2+ year of industrial experience a Software Engineer/Developer
One of the following:
PhD in AI or another quantitative field and 1+ year of hands-on experience programming machine learning based solution to real-world problem
MSc in AI or another quantitative field and 4+ year of hands-on experience programming machine learning based solution to real-world problem
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ year of total programming experience in industry or research
Ability to write production-quality object-oriented code in at least one of the modern OOP programming language (e.g. Python, JavaScript, Java, C++, Scala, C#)
Basic knowledge of SQL, ability to write selects with join
Deep understanding of machine learning theory and practice (feature engineering, regularization, hyperparameter tuning, ensemble methods, neural network architectures)
Expertise in data analysis (experiment design, classification, regression, unsupervised methods)
Knowledge of core computer science concept such a data structure and algorithms, OOP, code profiling/optimization
Detailed knowledge of at least one popular deep learning library, proven ability to implement in practice neural network architecture described in literature
Proficiency with regular expression and other deterministic method for processing text a well a experience in practical NLP is a plus
Ease with Linux
Good English; a level of French sufficient for work-related discussion
“Hacker” attitude: hunger for resolving enigmas, finding solution to riddle and facing uncommon challenge
Readiness to work in uncertainty regarding the resolution of a problem, the existence of mean to resolve it and, sometimes, in the absence of precise objective
Autonomous and responsible; organized and structured in initiative and work
Detail-oriented and able to keep a global vision of the issue and their solution

Build cooperative, productive relationship with client and vendor by utilizing excellent communication skills, while also interacting effectively internally and externally.

What Will Make You Stand Out

Joins u and share your story.
Job Summary:

Working with the Brand Group publishing team the Manager, Data Science will use their skill in statistical data analysis to deliver valuable insight and strategy for marketing, customer behavior, distribution and publishing activity in a brand driven environment.

In this role, you will be driven to find solution and opportunity across the business. You are passionate about the customer experience and delivering highly effective marketing programs, you have experience in finding and applying data-driven insight to lead business strategy and identify trend and opportunities. You will be a strong and confident communicator, can tell story through data visualization, who is adaptable to many different level of data availability, analytics maturity and technology platforms/toolsets and juggling multiple priorities. You will have an opportunity to work with a brand driven, industry leading publisher to grow your skill across the full spectrum of data science in the field of analytics.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Marketing (60%)

·    Lead and support analytics on project of varying size and complexity to build brand awareness, generate demand and support our strategic partnerships: including creating automated report and dashboards, post campaign analysis/reports, ad hoc diagnostic analysis, developing profiling/scoring model and segmentation strategies, web analytics implementation.

·    Support direct-to-consumer driven business through interpretation of online behaviour including assisting in driving strategy for customer acquisition, loyalty and conversion by developing models, personas, forecasts, scores/indices to meet short/long term objectives/goals.
·    Measure ROI of online and offline advertising campaigns. Report on marketing KPIs such a leads, conversion rates, website traffic and social medium engagement
·    Use advanced analytics technique on large data set for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analysis and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solution in the digital advertising landscape.
·    Creation of reports/presentations that are engaging, client-friendly, insightful, incorporating best practice in data visualization and storytelling.
·    Work collaboratively with Editorial, Marketing, and Sales group on cross functional project and initiative
Publishing Insights (20%):
·    Utilize internal and external sale data to identify editorial trend within publishing program including themes, author and linked series to drive product innovation
·    Develop ongoing analysis framework to determine effectiveness of deployed keywords and metadata and consistent analysis of competitive usage
·    Support ongoing consumer research project with data driven insight
·    With editorial and marketing teams, utilize data set to develop further insight into seasonality and effective scheduling of branded series publishing program
Sales & Distribution (20%):
·    Utilize available data to provide insight into regional and account specific distribution opportunity to provide insight into incremental revenue and margin opportunity
·    Develop reporting to understand profitability of book distribution decision by region and account
·    With sale and marketing teams, utilize data set to develop further insight into distribution efficiency and opportunity
·    With pricing team, evaluate role of product distribution and sale with pricing decision and recommend opportunity to increase margin
Qualifications:
Specific training or job experience required includes:
Undergraduate degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, business analytics or marketing science

3-5 year of data driven analytics experience that range across data wrangling, data blending, data enrichment, descriptive and diagnostic data mining techniques, insight generation, and client presentations.
At least 2 year working experience on SQL Server, or other structured relational database platforms; and intermediate level of SQL skills.
Experience working with email marketing platform such a Adobe Campaign, Exact target (Salesforce Marketing Cloud), Silver pop etc.
Experience with web analytics platform such a Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics (Omniture), and a sound understanding of email/web metric and experience with tag management platform (DTM, GTM).
Strong data visualization skill including experience with data visualization platform such a Tableau (preferred), Power BI or MicroStrategy.

Experience working with digital channel that include email, web, experiential, social or other channel that specifically involved customer level targeted experiences, product marketing experience is preferred.
Competencies/Skills:
Competencies and skill required to perform this job include:
·    Strong customer advocate, with demonstrated ability to drive improvement across all touchpoints.
·    An active listener, with superb interpersonal skills, including the ability to build positive and productive relationship with diverse group of people and the ability to influence others.
·    Innovative, collaborative and able to maintain a high degree of urgency.
·    Proven creative ability and resourcefulness in generating new idea and solving problems.
What's in It For You?
·       The opportunity to be part of a company on the leading edge of publishing, working with a very talented team and exceptional book
·       Summer Hours from late May to early September
·       Remote work, flexible start/stop time
·       Paid time off day and vacation allotment, starting at three week
·       Flexible benefit plan to fit your need and pension matching
·       Various virtual social activity to keep you connected – we love trivia!
·       Virtual author event and access to discounted book
·       Working with passionate people!
About HarperCollins Canada and Harlequin

Harlequin is a leading publisher of commercial fiction and narrative nonfiction. We publish more than 100 title a month that reach audience globally. Encompassing highly recognizable imprint that span a broad number of genres, we are home to many award-winning New York Times and USA TODAY bestselling authors. Harlequin is a division of HarperCollins Publishers, the second-largest consumer book publisher in the world. Through HarperCollins’s global publishing program, Harlequin title are published in 17 country and 16 languages.

Known worldwide for the quality of it list, HarperCollins Canada is the proud home of many bestselling and award-winning authors, including Esi Edugyan, Heather O’Neill, and Lawrence Hill. About the job

Pour accompagner son développement, Sia Partners recrute de conseiller(ère)s en Data Science pour son équipe de Montréal. Cette équipe desservira le marché Nord-Américain en plus de collaborer avec l’équipe Data Science déjà existante aux bureau de Paris et qui compte une soixantaine de professionnels.

Ils auront pour vocation de prendre en charge, en synergie avec no différents service et secteurs, le travaux et mission nécessitant la mise en œuvre de modèles complex pour accompagner no client dans leurs problématiques :

Machine learning et statistiques : élaboration de modèles explicatifs et prédictifs d'aide à la décision (algorithmes d'apprentissage supervisé et non supervisé, économétrie, prévision, diagnostic quantitatif) ;
Recherche opérationnelle : assistance à la conception et à la mise en oeuvre de solution d'optimisation sou contraintes et de modèles de simulation ;
Big Data : connaissances algorithmiques pour le traitement de grand volume de données et non structurées.
De plus, dans le cadre de activités interne du cabinet, votre participation s’articule autour de ax suivants :
Le développement ou le renforcement de no offres au travers de formations, de groupes de travail, de diffusion de support interne et externes ;
La politique de publication (blogs sectoriels, études, parution presse) ;
Le développement commercial en contribuant à la définition de besoins et en participant aux action commerciales.
Qualifications

Diplômé(e) en génie, actuariat, gestion ou d'une formation de haut niveau dans le domaine du traitement de l'information, de l'ingénierie statistique et de l'économétrie (M.Sc., MBA, MMA, Ph.D.), vous possédez idéalement une première expérience en Big Data ou Data Science.
Vous avez un excellent niveau en statistiques et analyse quantitative (connaissances théoriques et pratiques, intuition, facilité à comprendre de modèles et le appliquer).

Vous maîtrisez la programmation en R (ou équivalent : SAS, Matlab, etc.) et possédez de base solides dans de langages de script (Python, Perl, JS, bash) ou compilés (C++, Java) et/ou avez une expérience dans le environnements UNIX/LINUX.
Vous souhaitez vous impliquer et prendre rapidement de responsabilités sur de mission à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d’une structure dynamique.
Français, anglais professionnel courant indispensable, une troisième langue est appréciée.

Poste basé à Montréal (Vieux-Port). Station de métro Square-Victoria.

About the job
Who We Are

Wayfair’s Data Science team build the algorithmic system that drive our business, enhance customer experience, and improve customer loyalty. The Data Science Catalog team at Wayfair develops machine learning model to: (1) improve customer experience by accurately tagging product using multimodal data source (image, text, categorical, numeric, etc.), (2) drive catalog and pricing strategy by powering comparison between large number of products, and (3) solve the product cold-start problem to enable customer to find the best new products.

We partner closely with our Merchandising, Engineering, and other Data Science team in order to build scalable algorithmic system responsible for predictive modeling that drive business strategy for various merchandising and supplier side teams.

We are looking for a technical lead to join the Data Science Catalog team with an emphasis on information retrieval from imagery leveraging state-of-the art computer vision techniques. You will be working together with other data scientists, product managers, analysts, and a well a engineering team to solve the high impact and challenging computer vision problem at Wayfair.
What You’ll Do
Develop advanced computer vision and deep learning model to solve object detection, imagery segmentation and imagery classification.
Architect and build a highly scalable and fully automated deep learning model training and deployment pipeline.
Create and own a 6-18 month technical roadmap, coordinate and execute the roadmap with your immediate team.
Work with partner engineering team to build real-time model & service for company-wide consumption
Uncover deep insight hidden in our vast repository of raw data, and provide tactical guidance on how to act on finding
Deliver presentation to high level business stakeholder that tell cohesive, logical story using data.
What You’ll Need

PhD (preferred) in quantitative field (statistics, mathematics, economics, operation research, physics, neuroscience etc) and 3-4+ year of experience with a computer vision focus or Master’s degree in quantitative field and 4-6+ year of experience OR Thorough command of general data science especially computer vision techniques, good understanding of parallel computing and data engineering practices.
3+ year of experience with Python, PySpark, SQL, deep learning platform (i.e. tensorflow, pytorch, openCV), Google Cloud (or AWS/Azure),and (nice to have) containerization (Docker).
A bias towards solving problem from a customer-centric lens and an intuitive sense for how the work aligns closely with business objectives.
A knack for finding the right degree of pragmatism and delivering solution in an iterative manner, adding only a much complexity a needed in each step along the way.
Ability to effectively work with business leads: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusion for non-experts and desire to influence business decisions.
A curious mind open to continuous learning and motivated to autonomously drive project and thrive in a dynamic environment where there can be ambiguity.
About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destination for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouse or office throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunity are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazer who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspective make u stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voice of our employees, customers, community, and supplier to help guide u a we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. About the job

At realtor.com, we process terabyte of data everyday and transform that data into information that power decision for million of home buyers, renters, dreamers, and real estate professionals. We aim to radically simplify home buying/selling and help more people achieve the American dream on our realtor.com website and mobile apps.

We are looking for a seasoned Data Analyst, Senior to join our Data Science team and help take Orchestration to the next level. In this role, you will analyze data and develop self-learning framework to bring the optimal product and marketing experience to consumers. In your analysis, you will need to go beyond reporting on what user are doing on the site, to searching for why they are doing what they are doing and how that is different between groups. You will develop hypothesis and design way to test those hypotheses. Through all of that, you will be constantly interfacing with other departments, particularly the product managers, engineers, and developer in our e-commerce department, and you must be able to effectively communicate your analyses, insights, and framework to them.
Responsibilities
Deep-Dive Analysis: Use advanced technique (statistical modeling, experimentation, causal inference) to analyze user behavioral data to identify pattern and uncover opportunities.
Create a rich understanding of how people are interacting with the platform and content and use these insight to then make recommendations.
Optimization Framework Development: Develop and perfect an optimization framework that brings automation to data driven decision making.

This framework will be responsible for prioritizing product and marketing experience based on the optimal outcome for the consumer. Both to set goal and help evaluate potential opportunities, this analyst will be tasked with forecasting and opportunity sizing.

This will help business stakeholder evaluate trade-off in different approaches, and create target for driving business performance. Orchestration Reporting, Visualization: Be the primary partner for cross-functional stakeholder to understand performance of the platform.
When a metric is ahead or behind expectations, dig in to drive meaningful, actionable insight that help the business performance improve or double-down on success.

Partnership and communication: Partner closely with business stakeholder to identify and unlock opportunities, and with other data team to improve platform capability around data modeling, testing platforms, data visualization, and data architecture.
Requirements
4+ years’ education/work experience in advanced analytics Experience with Python and SQL programming language

About the job

Pour accompagner son développement, Sia Partners recrute de Conseiller(ère)s Senior en Data Science pour son équipe de Montréal. Ils auront pour vocation de prendre en charge, en synergie avec no différents service et secteurs, le travaux et mission nécessitant la mise en œuvre de modèles complex pour accompagner no client dans leurs problématiques :

Machine learning et statistiques : élaboration de modèles explicatifs et prédictifs d'aide à la décision (algorithmes d'apprentissage supervisé et non supervisé, économétrie, prévision, diagnostic quantitatif) ;
Recherche opérationnelle : assistance à la conception et à la mise en oeuvre de solution d'optimisation sou contraintes et de modèles de simulation ;
Big Data : connaissances algorithmiques pour le traitement de grand volume de données et non structurées.
De plus, dans le cadre de activités interne du cabinet, votre participation s’articule autour de ax suivants :
Le développement ou le renforcement de no offres au travers de formations, de groupes de travail, de diffusion de support interne et externes ;
La politique de publication (blogs sectoriels, études, parution presse) ;
Le développement commercial en contribuant à la définition de besoins et en participant aux action commerciales.

Vous avez un excellent niveau en statistiques et analyse quantitative (connaissances théoriques et pratiques, intuition, facilité à comprendre de modèles et le appliquer).

Vous maîtrisez la programmation en R (ou équivalent : SAS, Matlab, etc.) et possédez de base solides dans de langages de script (Python, Perl, JS, bash) ou compilés (C++, Java) et/ou avez une expérience dans le environnements UNIX/LINUX.
Vous souhaitez vous impliquer et prendre rapidement de responsabilités sur de mission à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d’une structure dynamique.
Français, anglais professionnel courant indispensable, une troisième langue est appréciée.

About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects traveler with more than 2.5 million accommodation globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employee representing 90+ nationality foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customer to experience the world.
Get to Know our Team:

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approach and the implementation of powerful resource such a operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest mind from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tool that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team play at Agoda is critical a business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on u to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customer by improving their search experience with faster result and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drive up the challenge a part of the Data department, but also the reward.
The Opportunity:

We think of Data Science in Agoda differently. For us, a data scientist is a fusion of core production skill with analytic and business skills. We’ve brought top talent from (literally) all over the world who focus relentlessly on building product which utilize ML and AI a their main edge. We know that when you infuse ML and technology, you move from good to great and that is our mission. Our Data Science manager are action driven leader that can form vivid vision and successfully direct their people to execute it while being strongly rooted in the detail and practice.
As a Data Science Manager, you will:

Drive the growth of your team and build a diverse, entrepreneurial team. You are a developer of people. You love leading diverse team of professional with both qualitative and quantitative background using data-driven and insights-led approach to respond quickly in a dynamic, competitive, and fast changing industry.

Get your hand dirty. Tackle complex problem in the online travel and ecommerce space using a range of ML and data analysis methods. Use our huge data repository to push our business metric to their bounds, directly and indirectly. Foster a culture that constantly raise the bar for u and others and support the freedom to explore and innovate.

Work on tough problems. Can we detect causation between metric and bookings? How can automatically answer our users’ questions? How do we tune our AB testing platform to ensure we aren’t optimizing noise? How do we measure experiment success to properly trade off type I and II errors? What is the ideal caching strategy for price and how do build an ML model to implement it? How can you detect anomaly within more than one million time-series that we track daily? Can you separate between bot and human traffic? Can you make our across-data-centers replication into smart replication using ML models? These are just a few of the diverse question we tackle and some which you will lead your team to crack. You will be impacting every aspect of the business and it will require various techniques, from diving deep into data with SQL and Big Data tools, all the way to deploying modern machine learning models.

Deliver results. Work directly with the head of the business department and the product management team. Influence them with compelling product idea based on data insight that can move the dial on our business.

Work in one of Asia’s most vibrant cities. Bangkok provides a setting like no other: edgy, luxurious, impossibly sensorial, endlessly layered. The perfect junction of a globally minded career and the heart of Asian travel.
In this Role, you’ll get to:
Balance quantitative data analysis with qualitative user insight to uncover how our user book travel to drive new and existing product impact
Build, validate, test, and deploy machine learning or other data science model to predict and influence the behavior of consumer with the goal of optimizing product & process
Test and validate insight via rapid experimentation and deployment
Interface with business/operation team and key stakeholder at all level to formulate solution & product change informed by your finding

Leverage data to help the business answer question around further expansion, products, process optimization, cost optimization, customer acquisition/retention/churn and any other business goal that can be addressed through data insight
Form strong, cross-functional relationship with designers, product managers, software developers, and marketer who build, design, and optimize our technology and tool
What you’ll Need to Succeed:
Vast analytical problem-solving capability & experience
Experience in leading a team of both researcher and analyst preferably in an ecommerce, tech, banking, advertising or management consulting environment
Statistical knowledge and extreme proficiency in SQL. Comfortable with R, Python and Tableau. Experience with big data technology (Hadoop/Vertica) is a plus

Strong understanding and implementation experience of predictive modeling algorithm such a regressions, time series, neural networks, clustering, decision tree and heuristic models, with familiarity dealing with tradeoff between model performance and business need
Experience combining user research and data science methodology across multiple product and team
Experience with research application pertaining to user experience, marketing, and market insight
Fantastic communication skill that enable you to work cross-functionally with product managers, tech geek and design gurus, building solid relationship with a diverse set of stakeholder
The ability to convey complex solution to a le technical person
Bias for action
Advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Physics or Mathematics/Statistics preferred

Machine Learning / Data Science Engineer

About the job
What is the Opportunity?

Fraud Management employ deep subject matter expertise to identify, mitigate and control Enterprise fraud risk. Within Fraud Management, the Data Science & Analytics (DSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies, to maximize operational efficiency and minimize client impact. As Manager, Fraud Data Science on the Analytics Partnerships team, you will develop analytics to support planning and decision management, contributing meaningful insight and informing sound business decisions. You will collaborate with internal and external analytic CoEs and develop fraud risk model and feature that contribute to optimizing performance across the pillar of fraud loss, operating cost, client experience and risk framework.
What will you do?
Represent Fraud Management and DSA on analytic partnership with internal and external partners, work to develop risk scoring model and ass their feasibility and benefit to the fraud pillar
Validate result of model created through internal and external partnership to ensure they will deliver real world benefit and periodically re-optimize to ensure they continue to add value
Design and build automated reporting with appropriate metric for all risk scoring model used by DSA and establish appropriate threshold for automated alert on model performance
Prepare documentation on vendor risk model for Model Governance and Risk Management purpose
Identify, research and escalate performance issues, ensuring management awareness and appropriate action to fix model performance issue
Represent Fraud Management and DSA when meeting with internal and external partners, and liaise with Fraud Strategy and vendor to complete health check on DSA’s risk scoring model
Execute testing (UAT/PIV) on solution tuning to ensure the model performs effectively, and engage with analytic partner to leverage change in data technology
Maintain a deep understanding of Fraud Management’s inventory of risk scoring model and recommend how to best leverage them to deliver benefit across the fraud pillar
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
3+ year of data science or analytics experience
Experienced in building machine learning model
Strong practical knowledge and proven experience in analytical software package and programming languages, Python and R
Strong knowledge of Big Data platforms, architecture and data tool such a Hadoop and Spark.
Effectively manages relationship with partner
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendation to both technical and non-technical audience
Excellent time management skill and proven ability to prioritize workload
Nice-to-have
Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry, payment and digital transaction data and financial fraud

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our client thrive and community prosper. Ingram Micro help business fully realize the promise of technology.TM  No other company delivers the full spectrum of global technology and supply chain service to business around the world.  Ingram Micro’s global infrastructure and deep expertise in technology solutions, supply chain, cloud and mobility enable it business partner to operate efficiently and successfully in the market they serve.  Combined with distinct market insight and the trust and dependability generated from decade of strong partner relationships, Ingram Micro stand apart a the global technology service provider for the future.
Data Science Director – Business Intelligence Solutions
Ingram Micro, one of the world’s largest distributor of IT equipment and service is seeking a Director of Data Science located in Toronto for the Global Business Intelligence (GBI) Organization.
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Ingram Micro, a portfolio company of Platinum Equity, delivers a full spectrum of global technology and commerce and fulfillment services. With a global base of more than 170K Customers and over 1.8K Vendors, including the world’s best-known technology company (e.g., Acer, Amazon, Apple, Dell, Cisco, Citrix, Google, HPE, HPI, HTC, IBM, Lenovo, LG, Microsoft, Samsung, VMware, Zebra and many others), Ingram generates nearly $50B in annual revenue. Given a global reach and focus on IT solution and services, cloud, mobility, and technology lifecycle, Ingram enables partner to find new opportunity and operate more profitably in their IT area of focus.
INGRAM MICRO GLOBAL BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ORG

Ingram Micro's GBI organization is a profit-generating strategic service that provides IT, channel stakeholders, with the insight and industry intelligence to generate more business, expand reach, and achieve pinpoint accuracy in their sale and marketing efforts. Through the GBI org, the Data Science team develops high margin science offering for Ingram’s Global Partners and internal Business Units across the company including Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Finance.

Featuring the largest transactional, product, and inventory database in the IT Distribution Channel, the Data Science team offer Ingram’s global IT Vendor and Solution providers, Reseller Partners, and internal stakeholder customizable programs, services, and insights: including lead analytics, recommendation engines, propensity models, strategic analytic consulting, industry performance, customer health analysis, product lifecycle analysis, forecast and growth targets, a well a supply chain optimization, logistics and operation analytics.
THE POSITION

The Director of Data Science will have responsibility for Ingram’s Business Intelligence Data Science bench, including Machine Learning and AI model development, and innovative science-based offering for Sales, Marketing, and Operations/Logistics. The science organization leverage the company’s unrivalled data asset to deliver value-added service to internal stakeholder and external clients. The Director’s team will focus on building scalable analytic tools, algorithms, professional services, with an eye toward profit-generating product offerings.

The individual will be a subject matter expert for Ingram’s data science practice. The Director will lead a growing team of 10+ M.Sc. and Ph.D. level direct report responsible for developing a full-funnel machine learning (and predictive) analytics platform focused on propensity models, recommendation engines, forecasts, and operation research/industrial organization topics; driving profit-generating science innovation.

The role requires the individual to be hands-on, acquire a deep understanding of a complex B2B multi-tiered supply chain; being able to develop data-driven insight to drive strategic initiative across various business unit in all region served by the company. The position will be responsible for developing and executing innovative science initiative with a quantifiable benefit to the bottom line.

The combination of quantitative expertise and the ability to translate to a market offering is essential. The role will partner with the Executive Director, Data Science and Analytics, to create and implement the GBI organization’s larger analytic vision, develop next-gen offering and lead an organizational entity prepared to deliver long-run value creation over the foreseeable future.

About the job
Company Description

Shopify is the leading omni-channel commerce platform. Merchants use Shopify to design, set up, and manage their store across multiple sale channels, including mobile, web, social media, marketplaces, brick-and-mortar locations, and pop-up shops. The platform also provides merchant with a powerful back-office and a single view of their business, from payment to shipping. The Shopify platform wa engineered for reliability and scale, making enterprise-level technology available to business of all sizes. Headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, Shopify currently power over 1,000,000 business in approximately 175 country and is trusted by brand such a Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.
Job Description

Data Science & Engineering is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabyte of data to provide solution for our merchant and stakeholder across the organization. From pipeline and schema design to machine learning product and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunity to positively impact our success. The Data Science & Engineering team act a the impact multiplier for Shopify’s product teams, putting over 11 petabyte of data to work to make our merchant more successful. From delivering merchandising insight to optimizing shipping and processing rates, to reducing credit card fraud, to ad campaign recommendation - our Data Scientists deliver solution from pipeline to the platform via an array of open source tools.

We are looking for a Senior Data Science Manager to lead the team that partner with our Operate data team (part of Core). The Shopify Core is what’s “in the box” when merchant sign up for Shopify: the world’s best Online Store, Checkout, and the Admin to set up and run their business. The Operate’s Mission is to help merchant start and run their business on Shopify’s platform by building the most powerful Admin. Operate Data Science and Engineering team contributes to this mission by building best-in-class insight and data product to enable every merchant’s success.
What Your Role Will Look Like

Working closely with an interdisciplinary team, you and your team will be responsible for the evolution of all admin tool (such a admin home, navigation, search, etc.) across mobile and web and tackle the evolution of how our most sophisticated merchant are utilizing our platform (large organization with multiple business and staff). Your team will focus on developing strong data foundations, data-informed products, and reporting and experimentation framework to empower the Operate organization to make great decision quickly.
Qualifications
You will need to have:

Team development: You’ll need a demonstrated track record of attracting top data/analytics talent, developing those people (both ICs and managers) to make them even better, and managing the growth of teams. You have several year of experience managing and scaling multiple teams.

Data Experience at scale: You’ve been a leader in multiple company where analytics on top of massive data set drive product/business decision and result in powerful data products. You have extensive experience with technology like SQL, Spark, and Python.

Analytics expertise: You’ll need to be amazing at coming up with new, meaningful metric to measure the success of our products; you'll be equally strong at making sure the data needed to support those metric are available. You have multiple year of experience managing decision at scale, including causal inference and experimentation.

Well-balanced skills: People have trouble pinning you down. Business, product, and technical team claim you a their own. You are equal part technical and functional (and both are exceptionally strong), and you are equally comfortable and effective at presenting to technical or business leaders.
Passionate about business strategy: You’ve experienced and thrived in similar channel-related environment and have a knack for working with business user that are responsible for top-line growth.
Key Technology Stack And Tools We Work With
Python
SQL
Spark
Google Cloud Platform
Mode/Tableau
Additional Information

We know that applying to a new role take a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application. Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employee feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables u to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage application from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse community and/or people with intersectional identities.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Data Science & Engineering is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabyte of data to provide solution for our merchant and stakeholder across the organization. From pipeline and schema design to machine learning product and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunity to positively impact our success. The Data Science & Engineering team act a the impact multiplier for Shopify’s product teams, putting over 11 petabyte of data to work to make our merchant more successful. From delivering merchandising insight to optimizing shipping and processing rates, to reducing credit card fraud, to ad campaign recommendation - our Data Scientists deliver solution from pipeline to the platform via an array of open source tools.

We are looking for a Senior Data Science Manager to lead the team that partner with our Commercial Data Science team. The Commercial team is a rapidly growing area within Shopify that play a vital role in delivering on this vision by reaching entrepreneur around the world and helping them succeed on Shopify. The Commercial team’s mission is to empower the most entrepreneur to succeed. Commercial Data Science and Engineering build data-informed growth strategy and data product that enable merchant to come, stay and grow on Shopify.
What Your Role Will Look Like

Working closely with an interdisciplinary team, you and your team will tackle challenging marketing, commercial and growth-related problems. We build strong data foundations, anomaly detection tools, and reporting framework to empower the growth organization to make great decision quickly.
Some of the Data Science & Engineering team member you’ll work with:
Ella Hilal, Director of Data Science, Growth and Revenue
Kiran Jain, Director of Data Science, Growth
Shopify Team Members You’ll Work Closely With
Morgan Brown, VP Growth
Qualifications
You will need to have:

Data Experience at scale: You’ve been a leader in multiple tech company where analytics on top of massive data set drive product/business decision and result in powerful data products. You have a strong background in machine learning including experience implementing model and productionizing innovative end-to-end machine learning systems.

Analytics expertise: You’ll need to be amazing at coming up with new, meaningful metric to measure success of our products; you'll be equally strong at making sure the data needed to support those metric are available.

Well-balanced skills: People have trouble pinning you down. Business, product and technical team claim you a their own. You are equal part technical and functional (and both are exceptionally strong), and you are equally comfortable and effective at presenting to technical or business leaders.
Passionate about business strategy: You’ve experienced and thrived in similar channel-related environment and have a knack for working with business user that are responsible for top-line growth.

Team development: You’ll need a demonstrated track record of attracting top data/analytics talent, developing those people (both ICs and managers) to make them even better, and managing the growth of teams.
Key Technology Stack And Tools We Work With
Python
SQL
Spark
Google Cloud Platform
Additional Information

We know that applying to a new role take a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application. Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employee feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables u to truly make commerce better for everyone. Join a leadership team of actuaries, data scientist and engineer at the forefront of using data to drive decision at every level of our organization. The insurance industry is undergoing a data-driven, technology revolution and you will be in the driver’s seat.

Insurance pricing, underwriting, claim and other core insurance segment are all looking for meaningful insight that can be coaxed out of our data. You and your team will collaborate with these business area to realize this value & further embed data science in our operations.

Customer focused. You prioritize building relationship with business partner to identify their need and develop innovative solutions.

About the job

This lead to a more creative, engaging, and fun way of working together, all in a welcoming, simple-to-use online space.

YOUR MISSION

As a Director of Product Analytics and Data Science, you will have a critical role in the success of MURAL by helping u measure the success of the product strategy, and leading a group of Product Analysts and Data Scientists that work embedded in the different product teams. Some of your key responsibility will include:
Define, plan and execute the vision, strategy, and roadmap for product analytics and data science.
Work cross-functionally within the Product organization to build out Product analytics and Data Science capabilities.

About the job

AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune system to find antibody that it partner can develop into drug to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Scientist, with expertise in integrated analysis and mining of complex biological data from a multitude of source to join our multidisciplinary team. Our ideal candidate is a highly motivated and self-directed scientist, a team-player who thrives in a fast-paced work environment with multiple competing priorities, and above all, someone who can learn and grow with us. This is an exciting opportunity to join one of Canada’s most innovative biotech company and to contribute to our cutting-edge research, driving the discovery of novel monoclonal antibody for therapeutic use.
How you might spend your days:

Using your understanding of bioinformatics and biochemistry to analyze and interpret large multifactorial data set for the purpose of driving drug discovery, especially with regard to lead candidate selection and predictive analysis
Organizing, supporting, and collaborating with team member to meet project deliverable and timeline

Building automated analysis pipelines, including streamlining of data output and curation, for a variety of data type derived from high-throughput analytical and biophysical experiment (e.g. SPR, mass spectrometry, HPLC, light scattering, etc)
Developing tool to collate, organize and process data input for our in-house data visualization platform, Celium.
Leading initiative to standardize data output and data analysis for integration into laboratory information management system (LIMS) or electronic notebook (ELN)
Collaborating with other data scientist on projects, finding solutions, and sharing code
We'd love to hear from you if:
You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy bringing out the best in your teammate
You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment and coordinating with your team to juggle multiple competing priority
You take pride in being a self-motivated person, fast learner, team player, and creative problem solver
You are passionate about analysis of complex data and communication to interdisciplinary project team
Required qualification and experience:
A graduate degree (PhD or MSc) in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Immunology, Immunogenetics, or a related field
Experience in the Life Sciences; Biochemistry, Biophysics, Cell Biology, or Molecular Biology preferred
Proficiency in at least one common coding language: Python or R (Python preferred)
Demonstrated ability to create flexible, reproducible data analysis pipeline intended for use by others
Experience working with and creating databases, data provenance, or data architecture
Excellent skill in data visualization and presentation of key finding
Drive to learn and master new technique
Excellent documentation and organizational skills, with impeccable attention to detail
A solid foundation in statistical analysis
An understanding of basic machine learning would be desired
Offers & benefits:
The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problem that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefit
A minimum of 3 weeks’ vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development
About AbCellera:

At AbCellera, we’re solving tough problem and creating innovative solution from the ground up - custom immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We’re revolutionizing how our scientist can explore antibody and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.

You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientist and physicist - all working together to bring better therapy to patients. We’re a growing company with a high-throughput pipeline and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn’t just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of visionary and innovators. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We’re looking for someone like you to help u get there.

The Institutional Equity Division (IED) is a global leader in the origination, distribution and trading of cash and derivative products. The Firm’s Automated Market Making (AMM) group provides liquidity for option in automated market worldwide. The AMM Team consists of quantitative traders, strategists, analysts, software developers, hardware developers, infrastructure and networking specialists, and data architect all collaborating to build and expand a cutting-edge system that trade over 1,000,000 security on 2,500 underliers across 16 option exchanges. The desk operates at the intersection of finance and technology, and many of the model and system design used to drive the engine sit on the forefront of innovation.
Position Description
We are looking for truly exceptional talent to join the Automated Market Making team (AMM). AMM is one of the industry leading on-screen market maker for equity option globally.

AMM is made up of software and hardware developers, traders, data scientist and quantitative strategist. Together we train a system to make market across 14 exchange in the US and 2 in Europe. The system automatically prices, quotes, hedges, and risk manages the position.
The Data Scientist Will
Create innovative solution to model various aspect of the electronic option market making, such a risk management, volatility fitting, microstructure analysis, and algorithmic trading
Analyze terabyte of equity and option market data to derive actionable intelligence to improve trading performance
Develop reporting, analytics, and visualization tool
Work together with other strategists, traders, and technology

Excellent communication skill and ability to interact with trader and technology

Knowledge of C++

From our headquarters in San Francisco to eight dedicated Studios and a worldwide team of employee who choose where they work best, our Virtual First approach is leading the way into the future of work.
Team Description

Our Engineering team is working to simplify the way people work together. They’re building a family of product that handle over a billion file a day for people around the world. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunity to make an impact.
Role Description

Dropbox is the home for your most important stuff—now we're bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, there’s plenty of space for you to grow alongside u and simplify life for million of people around the world.

The Data Science team is focused on using data to help make better decision about our products. Data is a critical part of our product development process, and Product Analysts are their chief advocates. We are responsible for ensuring that data is trustworthy and correct, finding insight from the data, and making an impact through data-informed decisions. We work across the entire product development timeline, from early data exploration about user behavior to multivariate experiment and optimization on mature products.

We are looking for multiple Data Scientists at all level who can jump in and make an impact quickly. You’ll be expected to set up and analyze A/B test for new experimental features, generate and size opportunity to prioritize features, and define key performance metric for the team, come up with deep quantitative  insight and framework that shape roadmaps for future quarter and drive user satisfaction.  As this team continues to grow there's also an opportunity to help shape and guide it expansion through mentorship and advocacy across the company. We hope you'll join us!
Responsibilities
Working with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging and metric
Creating simple, trustworthy data pipeline and automated reporting to surface key metric
Identifying, translating, prioritizing, and informing important product question with data
Exploring data to find actionable insight and make product recommendation through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, ML models, and more
Connecting product engagement with growth and business result
Synthesizing and communicating insight during all stage of the  product development process
Empowering and teaching others to work effectively and efficiently with data.
Building and evangelizing  data-driven and data-inspired culture at Dropbox
Requirements
Degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
2+ year experience doing causal inference, quantitative analysis  and modeling for a technology company (Experience in product data science is a bonus)
Fluency in SQL and statistical programming (e.g., R or python)
A solid understanding of statistical analysis, experimentation, and the common pitfall of data analysis
Good understanding of basic ML technique just a regressions, tree based models, clustering technique and SVMs
Self-starter: You recognize gap and drive project with minimal guidance and focus on making a large impact
Strong communicator: You effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your idea to others
Critical thinker: You are thoughtful, self-aware, and use available evidence to make decision
Collaborative: You work effectively with others and win credibility quickly

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for member and ally of internal group like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).
