About the job
At Conexus, it’s not what we do, it’s how we do it.

Are you ready to make a move and work for a company who put the financial well-being of it member first? It’s not just something we say at Conexus. It’s a promise delivered by our 900 employee each day. We are passionate about our members’ financial health, and our employee reflect that passion. At Conexus it’s about more than conducting a banking transaction, it’s about creating a personalized experience for each member. We do this by keeping it simple and lending an ear to each member’s individual need throughout Saskatchewan.

Our employee are authentic, bold, creative, and responsible. They are the reason we consistently deliver outstanding member experiences. They’re more than just individual who come to work each day, each employee is a vital part of Conexus.
The bigger picture

We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our Conexus Analytics Studio team who can glean insight and build advance analytic model from the data we collect every day, while helping u role out new technology that support and enhance our member experience.
How you’ll be spending your time
Using your math, statistical, and programming expertise to build robust predictive, prescriptive, artificial intelligence, machine learning and cognitive model
Creating multifaceted algorithm and data model that outline the strength and drawback of organizational strategy
Using complex datasets and structure to ensure organizational decision are made with high confidence and are well-supported
Formulating and testing hypotheses, while creating new insight from data found to maximize the predictive power of model and algorithm
The way people describe you

A tech-savvy individual who ha experience using Python, and/or R coupled with SQL to prepare data, construct data model using various algorithm to solve real business problems, in a on-premise and/or cloud environment
An individual with strong visualization skill who understands how to build and evaluate advanced data science model
A knowledge seeker who present the team to new technology and tools, while finding way to pilot smaller proof of concept to prove desired outcome before larger rollouts.
The experience you bring
A bachelor’s level education in Data Science, Big Data, Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science

A data expert with 3 to 5 years’ experience or equivalent combination of graduate education and experience in data science, advanced analytics, stress testing/sensitivity analysis, predictive modelling, or any other analytics-oriented expertise

Experience constructing supervised and unsupervised model using various algorithm and a strong understanding of the principle of the algorithm (such a algorithm for classification, regression, clustering, anomaly detection, forecasting, simulation problems)
Experience applying proper data preprocessing, data transformation, feature selection, dimensionality reduction, hyper-parameter tuning, cross validation, model selection, and model evaluation
Experience constructing, implementing model and building end-to-end pipeline in production on cloud platform such a AWS and/or Azure would be considered an asset
Experience working with relational database (SQL server, Oracle), big data framework (Hadoop, Spark), or cloud data platform (Snowflake, Google) would be considered an asset
Experience working in financial services, insurance, or retail industry would be considered an asset
What you get in return

Our team work tirelessly to ensure the financial success of each of our members. We think such dedication deserves recognition. That’s why we’re proud to offer some of the most competitive job perk of any employer around. Come, join our crew, and find out just how sweet the reward can be:
Competitive compensation and benefit package
Industry leading work-life balance and reward
Formal and informal employee development
Meaningful work that make a real difference in our members’ life

So, what do you think - doe this sound like you? Do you think you’re the right fit for Conexus and can rock this role? If you do, and you have the qualification outlined above, then we encourage you to apply now. If you have question about this position, please contact Carmen at Carmen.Gray@conexus.ca. But act fast, the opportunity close on Thursday, September 30.

Overview

Ethoca a Mastercard company is seeking a Lead Data Scientist to join our Enterprise Information Management team who is a self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment. Overview

Responsible for developing data-driven innovative analytical solution and identifying opportunity to support business and client need in a quantitative manner and facilitate informed recommendation / decision

Responsibilities

Identify rich data source and monitor the melding and cleaning of datasets to ensure consistency

Support in building model and algorithms.
Experiences
Demonstrated success when contributing accurate, technically innovative component for analytics/ product development project
Experience managing day-to-day cross-functional communication and collaboration to meet project deadline
Demonstrated success collaborating with client and effectively communicating project outcomes, methodology and consideration to key stakeholder
Successful track record in independently conducting complex analysis and guiding junior team member through complex/ ambiguous issue
Served a an expert resource or go-to person for a specific consulting tool(s), system(s), and/or application(s)
Skills
Python, R Programming
ML Frameworks (Scikit learn) and Deep Learning Framework (TensorFlow, PyTorch)
SQL, SAP HANA, Hadoop, Snowflake database
Linux, Azure environment, Azure Machine Learning, Databricks, Apache Spark (PySpark/Scala)
Master’s degree is required (PhD is preferrable)

We are seeking a Data Science Intern for our PCL Industrial Management Inc. district office in Edmonton, AB, that is available for 6 month starting immediately. This position will be under the direct supervision of the Manager, Data Science.
Here's how a Data Science Intern contributes to our team:
Gaining proficiency in exploratory data analysis, performing it, and presenting insights.
Preparing data set for visualization and machine learning modeling.
Training machine learning system using data annotation and benchmarking techniques; helping ass AI/ML model performance and developing path for improvement.
Preparing data visualization using industry-leading tool to summarize result for stakeholders.
Documenting your result - tell the story of the work, the successes, and the lessons-learned for posterity.
Keeping an open mind, in order to utilize your unique skill and your determination when other opportunity arise.
You'll Be Supported While You

Develop a proposal
Prepare and analyze the dataset
Engage with the right people to guide your work
Build your model and visualization
Assess and present the result

Through your capstone, you'll gain valuable experience in the end-to-end cycle, and the resulting addition to your portfolio is intended to be valuable for your future professional and educational endeavours.
What You Will Bring To The Role

You will have recently completed an undergrad or grad program in a quantitative field: mathematical sciences, computing science, or another. If your field of study differs, apply: we’d like to hear why you'll be a good fit regardless.
In Addition, You’ll Make Use Of
Analytical skill – ability to quickly analyze data to identify and visualize key insight – a evidenced by coursework, projects, or research requiring the analysis of large datasets.
Coursework in statistics: Applied statistic and probability are a focus of the position: if you can converse about regression models, and clustering approaches, you'll be fine.

Prior exposure to a statistical or scientific programming environment is helpful. If you don't have it, you'll become familiar while you're with us. We have a bias for open source tech, and work with the Python scientific stack, R, PowerBI, and various data pipeline tools.

Excellent oral and written communication skill will help. You'll work with both expert in the field and business staff, so you’ll find it important to be able to communicate appropriately with both a needed.

Dropbox is the home for your most important stuff—now we're bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, there’s plenty of space for you to grow alongside u and simplify life for million of people around the world.

The Data Science team is focused on using data to help make better decision about our products. We work across the entire product development timeline, from early data exploration about user behavior to multivariate experiment and optimization on mature products.

Connecting product engagement with growth and business result
Synthesizing and communicating insight during all stage of the  product development process
Empowering and teaching others to work effectively and efficiently with data.
Building and evangelizing  data-driven and data-inspired culture at Dropbox

The Data Scientist, Acquisition Strategy will develop acquisition strategy using advanced analytics and modeling/machine learning with rich customer and prospect data to optimize acquisition channel and profitability.
What You'll Do

Develop and monitor acquisition strategy for prospect from face to face and digital channels. Use advanced analytics and modeling/machine learning to understand how the behavior of customer and prospects, their interaction and touchpoints contribute to their overall customer experience to inform the overall acquisition strategy.
Collaborate with product and sale team to develop a thorough understanding of business objective to deliver customer-focused insights, analytics solution and customer acquisition strategies.

Through statistical analysis (e.g. Linear and Logistic regression, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, etc.), understand and measure the changing need of the target customer to influence the customer experience.
Conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of strategy and refine them a needed.

Translate customer data into cross-channel customer insights, and competitive intelligence reports, which will form a strategy to meet customer need and improve customer acquisition, growth and retention.

Using structured and unstructured rich data sources, (including but not limited to internal customer data, competitive intelligence, industry benchmarks, voice of the customer, and web analytics), produce customer/prospect experience metric and insights, including awareness, engagement and customer loyalty, across all channels.
Measure the effectiveness of the customer journey, by using path analysis, channel attribution and medium mix modeling, providing specific recommendation to increase revenue or reduce costs.
Present business analysis result and recommendation to key stakeholders.
What You Will Need
Post-Secondary education or equivalent experience in a quantitative field preferred (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering/Science, or Operations Research)
Minimum of 3 year progressive experience analyzing structured and unstructured data, developing and executing on strategy and making strategic recommendation to management.
Experience in working with statistical software application (e.g. SAS, R, or Python)
Experience with SQL, Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics is an asset.
Strong MS Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint) skills.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to distill and communicate complex analytic recommendation to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in written presentations.
Results oriented. Demonstrated ability to be part of multiple projects/initiatives of varying size and complexity, while prioritizing and balancing multiple task within a fast-paced work environment.

About the job

At Mozilla, we want to make product that keep the Internet open and secure for all. We collect terabyte of data a day from million of user to guide our decision-making processes. We could use your help.

As a Product Data Scientist, you will work closely with the product and marketing organization. You are an inquisitive thinker who is keen to practice full-stack data science, with experience ranging from designing and engineering data extraction process to finding pattern and anomaly in data through analytical techniques. You have strong interest in honing your technical skill further on real-world data. You believe that data science can lead to insight that can guide the future of Mozilla. You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization to see beyond the number and understand how our worldwide community experience our products.
We Have Multiple Openings For The Following
The Role
As a Data Scientist At Mozilla
You help design and analyze experiment to understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trend
You build key data set to empower operational and exploratory analysis
You advocate for standard methodology across the organization
You own the definition, evaluation and reporting of key product metric
You communicate narrative with data to many audiences, ranging from product manager to technical lead
You sit at the intersection between product, marketing, engineering, and leadership to inform, influence, and help execute our product strategy
Your Professional Profile

You lead with empathy. You value teamwork and teammates. You are invested in knowledge sharing and learning from others. You contribute positively and meaningfully to cultivate an inclusive and equitable team culture.

Ideally, you have prior experience with Internet data or any large, high-dimensional data set. Experience come in all form and personal project count. We’ll be especially excited if you have worked end-to-end on a data-intensive project on a level that you’d see in a graduate degree program in a quantitative or analytical discipline.

You have practice with extracting data from a variety of source using SQL or SQL-like tool a well a have performed statistical modeling using Python or R. You also desire to gain further technical experience on the job.
You have experience concisely presenting result (e.g. through report-writing or presentations) and are comfortable explaining technical concept to non-experts.
You have a keen interest in telling story with data visualization and building impactful, insight-driven narratives.
You consider contributing to a collaborative and open team culture an important responsibility.
About Mozilla

Mozilla exists to build the Internet a a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. Join u to work on the Web a the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

About the job
The Platform Manipulation team defends Twitter against effort by spammer and other bad actor to affect the experience of user with spam content, unwanted interactions, deceptive activity and more.
We are a cross-functional team with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Experts and Policy Specialists and we collaborate closely with Back-end engineer and supporting infrastructure teams.

You will study, identify and understand the manner in which antagonist attempt to manipulate the platform. You will also design automated detection and interventions, ranging from simple rule-based model to sophisticated, state-of-the-art machine learning models. In doing so you will collaborate with experienced Machine Learning engineer and with data scientist and analysts.

Previously experience in spam detection or related field

About the job

Recursion is a clinical-stage biotechnology company decoding biology by integrating technological innovation across biology, chemistry, automation, data science and engineering to radically improve the life of patient and industrialize drug discovery. Our team is working to solve some of the hardest, most meaningful problem facing human health today. Come join u in our mission to decode biology to radically improve lives, while doing the most impactful work of your life.

As an intern, you’ll have access to our data, and you’ll have the resource and independence to delve into problem that you find interesting in addition to assigned projects. Thanks to our robust engineering infrastructure, you’ll get to spend le time data munging and more time science-ing.
THE ROLE

As a data science intern, you will be collaborating with cross-functional team of biologists, chemists, software engineers, and data scientist to help improve our understanding of the biology present in our imaging data. We will give you real-world data to work with, and expect you to come up with creative approach to solve the problem you’re presented with. You will work closely with both your intern mentor and the rest of the data science team.
Our Intern program run 3-6 month and can start any time, depending on your availability.
Requirements
Passion for the company mission and comfort with answering open-ended question
Ability to brainstorm and communicate with cross-functional team
Strong foundation of statistics, probability, and machine learning
Strong programming experience, preferably in Python
Experience working with large, high-dimensional datasets (preferred)
Knowledge of biology/life science (preferred)
THE DATA YOU’LL WORK WITH
Fully automated experimental protocol
Images and extracted feature from > 10 billion cell
>9 petabyte
Hundreds of thousand of biological and chemical perturbation
Clean and easily loaded
More info and a small (for us) public release can be found here
PERKS YOU’LL ENJOY
3-6 month of full-time, paid internship
Ongoing mentoring and training from our Data Science team
The Benefits/Perks You’ll Enjoy As a Full-Time Recursionaut
100% Coverage of health, vision, and dental insurance premium
401(k) with generous matching (immediate vesting)
Stock option, restricted stock unit (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) programs**
Two one-week paid company closure (summer and winter)
Flexible vacation/sick leave
Generous paid parental leave (including adoptive)
Onsite daycare facility ** (Salt Lake City)
Commuter benefit and vehicle parking to ease your commute**
Complimentary chef-prepared lunch and well-stocked snack bars** (Salt Lake City)
Monthly fitness/wellness stipend
One-of-a-kind 100,000 square foot headquarters complete with a 70-foot climbing wall, showers, lockers, and bike parking** (Salt Lake City)
United States based employee
More About Us

Central to our mission is the Recursion Operating System, or Recursion OS, that combine an advanced infrastructure layer to generate what we believe is one of the world’s largest and fastest-growing proprietary biological and chemical datasets and the Recursion Map, a suite of custom software, algorithms, and machine learning tool that we use to explore foundational biology unconstrained by human bias and navigate to new biological insight which may accelerate our programs. We are a biotechnology company scaling more like a technology company. Recursion is proudly headquartered in Salt Lake City.

Position Description:

Data & Analytics is a function in the Legal and Compliance Division responsible for designing and optimizing surveillance models, approach and tool using advanced analytical technique like supervised and unsupervised machine learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and evolving technique like reinforcement and deep learning a well a graph analytics. The surveillance and other tool help identify suspicious and/or illegal behavior like money laundering, market manipulation, insider trading, unfair sale or trading practice and other financial crimes.
Primary Responsibilities
Development of Risk model leveraging Machine learning and related quantitative technique to improve surveillance and compliance monitoring activity
Working with member of the Financial Crimes, Compliance, Legal and IT department to identify, ass and manage risk by evaluating large data set using various statistical tools.

Making recommendation to improve surveillance and compliance monitoring and testing activity through statistical analysis of model thresholds, back testing and other sensitivity and productivity analyses, in addition to the development of risk models.
Developing and enhancing statistical methodology and quantitative model to drive efficiency.
Required Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Engineering or other highly quantitative field
3 + year of hands-on industry experience in building supervised and unsupervised machine learning based solution and applied statistical analysis to solve complex business problem
Knowledge of software design principle and excellent skill in one or more programming language including Python, R, Java, Scala
Ability to work in a team environment, balance participation on multiple project and resolve conflicting priority
Strong problem solving and project management skill
Ability to work with global, cross-functional team
Qualifications
Desired Skills
Familiarity with Financial Markets, with an emphasis on Financial Crimes, Compliance or Fraud analytics is a plus.
Exposure to deep learning framework including PyTorch or Tensorflow
Demonstrated Experience with big data tool such a Hadoop & cloud computing, such a PySpark and cloud machine learning tools.
Knowledge of Graph Databases and Semantic Modelling.

Job Description

Data Analytics Engineering team is looking to bring a new Data Scientist on board. You will help build end-to-end application and process for the business community leveraging AI, ML, Big Data and Cloud Infrastructure, and provide support to the Sun Life Data Science community. Our project feature innovative yet practical approach to deliver the best service in Advanced Analytics support across Sun Life.
What will you do?
Develop data science analytic approach such a machine learning, deep learning, and natural language programming
Assist with the development of compelling and effective data visualization
Develop interactive dashboards, report and data visualization allowing the end-user to explore data and discover insight independently
Lead the design, development and implementation of prototype and proof of concept for data, analytic and predictive models, research product and analysis platform
Apply Software Engineering and application development skill to build robust, scalable and cost -effective Data Science application
Work directly with a wide array of audience to structure analytical problem and approach
Communicate complex result to a business audience not familiar with complex Data and Analytics solution
What You Will Need To Succeed
Graduate/Postgraduate degree in quantitative science (such a Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Bioinformatics, Data Science
+2 year experience in Programming language such a R, Python
+2 year experience in Linux and scripting language (Bash, PowerShell)

+2 year experience in Statistical analysis, deep understanding of it concept and applications, such a hypothesis generation and testing, various kind of statistical distributions, power analysis, probability theory, dimensional reduction, cluster analysis
+2 year experience in Building and deploying predictive models, such a GLM, Decision Tree, XGBoost, Support Vector Machine, Bayesian inference
+2 year experience in Working with deep machine learning framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch and their application in anomaly detection, image recognition, natural language processing
+2 year experience with SQL database
+2 year experience in High competency in version control tool such a Git in a collaborative coding environment
+1 year experience with SageMaker and it features: training, processing, hyper parameter tuning, model monitoring
+1 year Working experience in container technology such a Docker, Kubernetes
+1 year Experience and/or training in Cloud platform like AWS
+1 year experience with optimising code in execution speed and memory consumption
+1 year experience with Machine learning framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch
Nice To Have
Common statistical package such a Numpy, Pandas, Scipy, Data.Table, Matplotlib, ggplot, Dyprb
GLM, Decision Tree, XGBoost, Support Vector Machine, Bayesian inference
Data Visualization tool like Tableau, Python Dash, Seaborn, Matplotlib, R Shiny (desirable)
Experience or training in delivering IT or Analytics project in an iterative agile like team structure
Experience with noSQL database DynamoDB, MongoDB, etc
Experience in Life Insurance, Wealth Management, or other financial service industry
Experience in large scale MLOps
Experience in language such a SAS, Java, JavaScript, VBA
Experience in big data technology such a Hadoop, Spark, Glue, Kafka
Special Requirements
Must be able to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprint to the RCMP, a minimum of 5 year history checks).

Certain sale focused role have sale incentive plan based on individual or group sale results.

VELOCITY – Data Scientist – Summer 2022
WORK TERM: 4 Months - Summer 2022 (May - August)
What Can I Expect from the Velocity Program?

This is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focus on providing you with the development and tool you need to grow your career. In Velocity you will gain exposure to both business and technology by having a customized plan for your next internship or co-op. Yes, you read that correctly. After successfully completing your first co-op or internship, we will work with you to establish a learning and mentorship plan which also outline your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow and experiment within different area of both Scotiabank and Tangerine.
You will…
Collaborate with business line and other stakeholder and identify opportunity to drive business value by leveraging data science solution
Leverage distributed computing tool (e.g., Spark, Cloud) for analysis, data mining, and modeling
Collaborate with data engineering, software developer, and other analytics team to build analytical dataset and model
Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategy to measure, conduct testing to measure the effectiveness of models, and make ongoing change
Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models, and algorithm used and developed
Present result to business line stakeholder and help implement real data-driven change
Work on challenging and research-based initiative using advanced machine learning method focusing on data-driven outcome
Experiment & learn!
You Are?

You are an undergraduate student that get excited by continuous integration and deployment. You have a passion for innovation and spend your free time problem solving and tinkering with new technologies. You thrive in a fast paced ever changing environment and need to be a part of something BIG. You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.

Throughout your undergrad, you have acquired basic knowledge in the software development life cycle, object-oriented programming, and database programming. You consider yourself an influencer that can translate business objective into technical priorities. You are logical, and familiar with various development tools. You love being involved in extracurricular activity such a hackathons or tech conferences. You are not afraid to roll up your sleeve and get thing done!
You have basic knowledge in…
Computer Science, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering, or Mathematics
Cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data set working with various data format (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files)
Big Data/Cloud ecosystem (e.g. GCP)
Experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning
Python programming
Common machine learning library in Python, PySpark (scikit-learn, xgboost)
UNIX tool and shell scripting
SQL skill for querying relational database (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
Visualization tool like PowerBI
Kubernetes
Git Workflows (Pull Request, Code Review, Branching)

The Data Scientist, Acquisition Strategy will develop acquisition strategy using advanced analytics and modeling/machine learning with rich customer and prospect data to optimize acquisition channel and profitability.
What You'll Do

Develop and monitor acquisition strategy for prospect from face to face and digital channels. Use advanced analytics and modeling/machine learning to understand how the behavior of customer and prospects, their interaction and touchpoints contribute to their overall customer experience to inform the overall acquisition strategy.
Collaborate with product and sale team to develop a thorough understanding of business objective to deliver customer-focused insights, analytics solution and customer acquisition strategies.

Through statistical analysis (e.g. Linear and Logistic regression, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, etc.), understand and measure the changing need of the target customer to influence the customer experience.
Conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of strategy and refine them a needed.

Translate customer data into cross-channel customer insights, and competitive intelligence reports, which will form a strategy to meet customer need and improve customer acquisition, growth and retention.

Using structured and unstructured rich data sources, (including but not limited to internal customer data, competitive intelligence, industry benchmarks, voice of the customer, and web analytics), produce customer/prospect experience metric and insights, including awareness, engagement and customer loyalty, across all channels.
Measure the effectiveness of the customer journey, by using path analysis, channel attribution and medium mix modeling, providing specific recommendation to increase revenue or reduce costs.
Present business analysis result and recommendation to key stakeholders.
What You Will Need
Post-Secondary education or equivalent experience in a quantitative field preferred (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering/Science, or Operations Research)
Minimum of 3 year progressive experience analyzing structured and unstructured data, developing and executing on strategy and making strategic recommendation to management.
Experience in working with statistical software application (e.g. SAS, R, or Python)
Experience with SQL, Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics is an asset.
Strong MS Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint) skills.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to distill and communicate complex analytic recommendation to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in written presentations.
Results oriented. Demonstrated ability to be part of multiple projects/initiatives of varying size and complexity, while prioritizing and balancing multiple task within a fast-paced work environment.

About the job

We are currently seeking a Data Scientist to join our team! If you’re looking to grow your career and your impact with a leading healthcare tech company, then we have the role for you at Swift Medical.

This role provides an opportunity to partner closely with product managers, subject domain expert and strategic partner to identify key area where machine learning can help optimize wound care. In addition, the candidate will collaborate with our multidisciplinary team of Data Scientists, Computer Vision Specialists, DevOps, Data and Fullstack Engineers to develop and deploy innovative ML solutions. The candidate will be able to apply a breadth of analytical, machine learning and engineering principle to answer a wide range of high-impact clinical question and present insight in an effective manner to the stakeholders.
The Data Scientist, Level II will report to the Data Science Lead.
Responsibilities
Work closely with clinical, research and product team to deliver groundbreaking, clinically relevant prognostic capability
Collaborate closely with data, infrastructure and fullstack engineering team to train, deploy, monitor and maintain various machine learning product
Employ structured approach to disentangle complex high dimensional healthcare data to extract actionable insight to improve wound care
Devising, conducting, and documenting experiment plan to determine best approach to solving problem
Work with Swift’s unparalleled and rapidly growing clinical image and metadata dataset to drive precision clinical guidance to the bedside for patient and clinician
Contribute in knowledge sharing through internal and external technical paper and presentation
Skills and Experience
2+ year of experience working a a Data Scientist
Experience working with a numerical programming language such as: Python, Julia or R
Comfortable with manipulating and analyzing complex, high dimensional datasets using SQL/Python(Pandas, Dask)
Ability to select and train appropriate machine learning model for predictive modeling
Familiarity with one or more of the following areas: time-series forecasting, survival analysis, causal inference, or reinforcement learning
Experience in building, deploying and maintaining machine learning model in production
Familiarity with AWS services, Docker, Kubernetes, Web Frameworks (such as, Flask or Django)
Experience working with complex, real-world healthcare data is a plus
Working @ Swift Medical:

Other than the impact we’re making in the healthcare industry, the very best thing about Swift Medical is our people. Certified a a Great Place to Work®, what we do is not only inspiring, it creates a close-knit team working in an energetic, collaborative, and positive atmosphere. A few popular offering include:
An attractive Unlimited Vacation Program
Participation in our Educational Reimbursement Program
Competitive compensation with Employee Stock Options available
Benefit Allowance Available From Start Date
Mentoring and development opportunity
Extensive training from seasoned, engaged professional
Flexible, remote working option
Fun company event for the whole family
The opportunity to make a difference in the life of our patients!

About the job

We are witnessing a massive shift of consumer presence from offline to online. With it, there is a need for technology that enable online business to thrive. Bolt is at the center of this universe leading the next generation of ecommerce, having created a best-in-class buying experience from checkout to fraud detection, payment and more. With our help, retailer can successfully compete with the online retail giant that have the mean to invest in technology.
The Data Platform team work closely with all team and cross-functional partner (including product, engineering, and data analysts) to build a foundational data stack powering business analytics.

We are looking for someone to play a mission-critical role in designing and building the data mining algorithms, and data analytics pipeline at Bolt. We’re looking for someone with the experience, creativity, and passion for producing world-class technology who can support our product, leadership and marketing team with insight gained from analyzing our data. Other team at Bolt, other companies, and consumer alike will rely heavily on what you build, and you’ll have a ton of trust and responsibility. If challenge excite you, and you’re ready for a large one, let u know.
Check out our Engineering Blog !
You Will
Build production ready data mining and big data analytics algorithm and pipelines; your model will be the engine that power all online commerce through Bolt
Conduct data analysis to determine which policy we adopt and help inform strategic growth
Build statistical models, data pipelines, data mining, data analytics, and production ready service to serve offline and live traffic
Work with other team at Bolt to engineer data model and extract data insight that help improve Bolt business
About You
Passion to improve e-commerce business
Strong communication skill in a cross-functional team
Unrelenting focus on impact
Master's degree in relevant technical discipline
Knowledge of data mining, and big data analytics technique
Knowledge of statistical concept and technique
Mastery in one or more of Python, Java, Scala, SQL
Our Stack
AWS Lambda for data ingestion and Kinesis Firehose to transport them into S3
Step function and Lambdas to coordinate workflow
AWS Redshift a the data warehouse + Spark on EMR for doing ETL
Terraform for maintaining infra
Jenkins & CircleCI for build pipeline
Postgres RDS is our application database
Our code base is primarily in Golang & Typescript. However, our data bit are mostly in Python.
Benefits
Competitive Pay
Flexible PTO
Retirement plan
Cell phone reimbursement
Wifi reimbursement
Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental and vision
Monthly wellness stipend
Paid parental leave
Monthly (virtual) team event

Have strong analytical and problem-solving skill
Are an effective communicator
Are well organized, with good time management skill
Are able to work independently
Are creative
Are comfortable working a part of a team
What You’ll Do Here
Transform complex data set into meaningful conclusion and recommendation
Participate in developing completely new and innovative solutions, using machine learning and statistical approach

Here are a few reason why others have joined our team:
Experience first-hand what it’s like to work a a Data Scientist and learn more about how advance in technology are shaping the way the insurance business work
Explore new idea and learn best practice in a fun, inclusive environment
Put your creative mind to work while you help the team solve problem and contribute to challenging, meaningful project
Be a part social event with the team, where you will meet new people and celebrate success
Earn a competitive salary varying from $23.43 to $35.19 per hour, depending on the number of credit acquired at the time of your internship

Bachelor's, Master's or PhD in progress, in artificial intelligence, data science, computer science, mathematics, statistic or a related field

Practical experience with Python or R programming language

About the job

There is no doubt that banking and financial service represent the most complex data & domain environment in existence today. Due to a lost decade brought on by the financial crisis in 2008, today’s bank are only now beginning their data journey. Over the coming decade, the sector will change inexorably. The challenge of helping achieve this change will be led by an elite group of data expert who start their career over this period.

Prospect 33’s Global Data Lab will give you the opportunity to take a deep dive into the full project life cycle and work in this complex domain & data environment to gain real-world experience and gain critical domain knowledge. This is not your typical training course; this is a real-world project training environment designed to overcome the critical challenge of preparing a group of junior data expert to become the leader of tomorrow.

Our program combine our deep domain knowledge with real-world data science solution in an immersive three-month program. You will still have instructional session and mentor to lean on, however, the primary focus will be on a project that is a piece of a larger whole and defined at the time of the cohort’s start.

You will be working on something that ha not yet been done in the industry. We have an overall goal related to fighting financial crime, but the project themselves are fluid and largely determined by the rest of the project going on in the Lab at that time. You won’t have to work on those canned, boring project like customer churn predictions; this is uncharted territory where you won’t be working on anything that you’d be able to find in another program.

Apply now to take part in our Introductory Bootcamp Day and continue to a full 3-month project. Successful graduate will become full member of our exclusive Global Data Lab, acknowledged across the world a being the best career accelerator in the industry of financial services, where you can continue to pursue project or leverage connection to help in your future roles.
HOW WILL BOOTCAMP 33 ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER?
ENHANCE YOUR DATA KNOWLEDGE
Gain insider knowledge into a complex industry with intricate data
Use the foundational data science skillset, such a SQL, python, and pandas, to solve problem around AML & KYC
Experience common tool for ETL, data warehousing, and data governance
Practice using different model and feature engineering method to solve real-world problem
GET REAL PROJECT EXPERIENCE
Plan, lead, and execute large change initiative in our simulated environment
Strategically implement end-to-end data management solution
Experience real-world agile software development
Take a deep dive into the full project life cycle
ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER
Become a data expert in the most complex data environment
Mentored by industry leader and subject matter expert

Boost your resume with valuable project experience and an AI software solution to Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Anti-Financial Crime (AFC), Know Your Client (KYC), and the complex matter of Client Lifecycle Management (CLM)
Prospect 33 is the leading project consultancy in the Capital Markets and Investment Banking sector today.
HOW DOES THE PROGRAM WORK?

After the introductory Bootcamp day, the program will continue for an additional 13 week during which you will have learning session alongside project work. The project work will be done in an agile manner, specifically leveraging scrum. You will explore the financial service industry a a whole and learn about the ongoing data initiative in major financial institutions. You will research and present on multiple topic a well a gain insider knowledge into this complex industry and it intricate data environment. You will plan, lead, and execute a large change program. You will also work with your peer and mentor to build a viable proof of concept (POC) for machine learning software to solve Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Client (KYC) issue that financial institution are facing right now.
REQUIREMENTS:

A master's degree in Data Science, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or other related field OR an equivalent combination of education and experience or other credible Data Science Bootcamps
If not in a program that is specifically related to data science then you must have significant data science project experience and/or 2 year of relevant work experience
Must be strongly capable with SQL & Python (and relevant libraries)
Time to dedicate to a 1-day Bootcamp from 0830-1400 EST
Time to dedicate to the program (roughly 10-15 hour per week)

Job Description

Data Analytics Engineering team is looking to bring a new Data Scientist on board. You will help build end-to-end application and process for the business community leveraging AI, ML, Big Data and Cloud Infrastructure, and provide support to the Sun Life Data Science community. Our project feature innovative yet practical approach to deliver the best service in Advanced Analytics support across Sun Life.
What will you do?
Develop data science analytic approach such a machine learning, deep learning, and natural language programming
Assist with the development of compelling and effective data visualization
Develop interactive dashboards, report and data visualization allowing the end-user to explore data and discover insight independently
Lead the design, development and implementation of prototype and proof of concept for data, analytic and predictive models, research product and analysis platform
Apply Software Engineering and application development skill to build robust, scalable and cost -effective Data Science application
Work directly with a wide array of audience to structure analytical problem and approach
Communicate complex result to a business audience not familiar with complex Data and Analytics solution
What You Will Need To Succeed
Graduate/Postgraduate degree in quantitative science (such a Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Bioinformatics, Data Science
+2 year experience in Programming language such a R, Python
+2 year experience in Linux and scripting language (Bash, PowerShell)

+2 year experience in Statistical analysis, deep understanding of it concept and applications, such a hypothesis generation and testing, various kind of statistical distributions, power analysis, probability theory, dimensional reduction, cluster analysis
+2 year experience in Building and deploying predictive models, such a GLM, Decision Tree, XGBoost, Support Vector Machine, Bayesian inference
+2 year experience in Working with deep machine learning framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch and their application in anomaly detection, image recognition, natural language processing
+2 year experience with SQL database
+2 year experience in High competency in version control tool such a Git in a collaborative coding environment
+1 year experience with SageMaker and it features: training, processing, hyper parameter tuning, model monitoring
+1 year Working experience in container technology such a Docker, Kubernetes
+1 year Experience and/or training in Cloud platform like AWS
+1 year experience with optimising code in execution speed and memory consumption
+1 year experience with Machine learning framework such a Tensorflow, PyTorch

Common statistical package such a Numpy, Pandas, Scipy, Data.Table, Matplotlib, ggplot, Dyprb
GLM, Decision Tree, XGBoost, Support Vector Machine, Bayesian inference
Data Visualization tool like Tableau, Python Dash, Seaborn, Matplotlib, R Shiny (desirable)
Experience or training in delivering IT or Analytics project in an iterative agile like team structure
Experience with noSQL database DynamoDB, MongoDB, etc
Experience in Life Insurance, Wealth Management, or other financial service industry
Experience in large scale MLOps
Experience in language such a SAS, Java, JavaScript, VBA
Experience in big data technology such a Hadoop, Spark, Glue, Kafka
Special Requirements
Must be able to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprint to the RCMP, a minimum of 5 year history checks).

About the job

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sport entertainment brand in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experience that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sport video games, including Madden NFL football, FIFA Soccer , NHL® hockey, NBA LIVE basketball, and EA SPORTS UFC .

Millions of EA SPORTS player generate billion of event every day. We use high-volume data stream to quickly detect and address game security threats. The Game Security Data Scientist us big data, machine learning, and visualization technique to explore and implement improvement to the security of the EA SPORTS player experience.

You will be at the crossroad of several hot areas: Data Science and Engineering, Security, and Software Development. You don't need to have experience in all the four area but we are looking for someone who can demonstrate a solid background and grow in other areas. You adopt a security mindset to predict the adversaries' moves. You can use multiple statistical and machine learning method to detect anomaly and fraudulent behavior.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with team member across multiple discipline to understand the data behind game features, user behaviors, the security landscape, and business goals.
Analyze data from several large sources, then automate solution using scheduled processes, models, and alerts.
Work with partner to design and improve metric that guide our decision by summarizing the state of game security.
Detect pattern associated with fraudulent account and anomalous behavior.
Solve scientific problem and create new method independently.
Translate requirement and security question into data insights.
Set up monitoring and alerting mechanism so our leadership is always aware of the security posture.
Qualifications

Post Graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Electrical Engineering with specialization in machine learning, information security, artificial intelligence, decision support/making or other related fields.
Experience with SQL and no-SQL databases.
2+ year of applied machine learning and analytics experience and familiarity with standard techniques, relevant tool and libraries.
Familiarity with programming language such a Python, R, Java, or C/C++.
Use Bayesian model and Social network analysis (SNA) tool to develop entity behavior analytics that demonstrate a holistic view of the bad activities.
About the job
What is the opportunity?

Who wouldn't want to be a part of a fantastic team of Data Scientists? At RBC, our Data Science team offer the opportunity to leverage RBC’s data asset to develop innovative solution in support of RBCs big data strategy. This position is an essential part to the bank a you develop next-generation application to meet our customers’ needs. By joining the RBC team a a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solution to assist all business customers.
Please only apply if you are available for 8 months.
What will you do?
Utilize the latest technology available, designing and building data solution to meet business need
Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
Constantly seek out better way to do things, new tools, new technologies, new process
Work on transformational project delivering new value
Work a part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business need
Deploy production-scale solution using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning model from single node architecture to parallel processing grid technology
Use business domain knowledge to independently lead the analytics process to identify valuable and innovative insight
Promote analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Programming skill in one or more of the following languages: Python or R
Experience utilizing SQL scripts/querying

Proficient in building statistical and algorithmic model with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing, recommendation systems, times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization, deep learning
Ability to data extract, transform, and load process with a variety of data type
Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volume of data and present finding to stakeholder
Nice To Have
Experience with big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistic function
Exposure to Apache Spark, Hadoop and Public Cloud technologies, data serialization (JSON, Avro, Parquet, ORC)
Experience with big data processing tool like Spark and Hive, GitHub functionality and workflow experience/exposure
Experience with messaging (Kafka, Solace, RabbitMQ) & working on Agile project

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our client succeed. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our community and achieving success that is mutual. Visit people.rbc.com

Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership example
A world-class training program in financial service
Opportunities to be a valuable member of a close-knit, collaborative team that encourages networking
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonus and flexible benefit
Competitive compensation

About the job
Synopsis of the role

As a Data scientist, in this role, you will work closely with business stakeholder to understand their goal and determine how data can be used to achieve those goals. You will be tasked with designing data modeling processes, create algorithm and predictive model to extract the data the business needs, help analyze the data and share insight with peers.
Who is Equifax?

At Equifax, we believe knowledge drive progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institution and government agency make critical decision with greater confidence.

We work to help create seamless and positive experience during life’s pivotal moments: applying for job or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goal we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employee make a difference and we are looking for talented team player to join u a we help people live their financial best.
The Perks of being an Equifax Employee?

We offer excellent compensation package with market competitive pay, comprehensive healthcare packages, schedule flexibility, work from home opportunities, paid time off, and organizational growth potential.
Grow at your own pace through online course at Learning @ Equifax.
What You’ll Do

As a Data Scientist at Equifax, you will work directly with both internal stakeholder and external client to deliver innovative decision science model & attribute that leverage Equifax’s vast data assets. These include decision area covering the credit lifecycle, geodemographic & marketing attributes, rating & fraud models, a well a any new area where data driven decision making can be informed by predictive modelling including advanced modeling technique and machine learning when applicable.
Build and create advanced machine learning algorithm such a  regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision tree and neural network
Develop new tools, advanced analytical technique and product a part of the innovation team
Project management including defining business and technical requirements, resource planning and analytic solution design

Working alongside key client a part of co-innovation project  and effectively communicate analytical result to key stakeholder using strong data visualizations, superior presentation skill and business language to emphasize the so what of the analysis
Creation of recommendations, market insight and dashboard following completed analysis and Quality control of all analytical output
Qualifications
Bachelor’s or advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such a Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Physics
3+ years’ Data Science experience with expert knowledge of R, Python, SAS or SQL in a large data environment
3+ years’ experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithm and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural network
Proven hands-on experience designing and building analytical solution to solve real world problems, with limited direct supervision required
Creativity & idea generation and the ability to extract business insight from analysis & transform this into an easy to understand story
Extra Points for any of the Following
Master’s level degree in a business-related field/MBA
Experience working in a cloud environment such a GCP an asset
Experience in working with Credit Data
Background in financial services, telecommunication or utility favorable

Accountability
Curiosity
Collaboration
Think and act differently
Trust

Now more than ever, the Internet is a utility that facilitates modern life. We collect terabyte of data every day from million of user to guide our decision-making processes. We need your help to enable the future of Mozilla in a way that make u proud!
As a Data Scientist within the Data Org, you will work a part of a cross-functional team that is responsible for understanding and empowering the future of Mozilla.
The Role
The Data Science team sits at the intersection of finance, business, operations, product, engineering, and leadership. We collaborate closely with these partner to provide meaningful insights.
As a Data Scientist At Mozilla You Will
Apply a variety of statistical method including causal inference to understand the intricate ecosystem of our users, products, partners, revenue

You have owned complex project from inception to completion and your work ha influenced entire organizations. You’ve contributed to and executed against data science roadmaps in collaboration with others.

You take stakeholder need into account, bridging methodology and data into meaningful strategy from your analyses. You are a communicator who craft impactful data narrative that inform company decision around product, business, and finance.

About the job

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billion of people around the world, give them way to share what matter most to them, and help bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new product or helping a small business expand it reach, people at Facebook are builder at heart. Our global team are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger community - we're just getting started.

As a Data Scientist at Facebook, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing product we build across our entire family of application (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data set in the world, you will help define the experience we build for billion of people and hundred of million of business around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problem with a diverse set of cross-functional partner across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development’s biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decision with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Facebook, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.About the roleProduct leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the product we build bring value to people, businesses, and Facebook. You will help your partner team prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product’s ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide team using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypothesis and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approach to test them.Communication and influence: You won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partner using clear insight and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.-------En tant que scientifique de données chez Facebook, vous façonnerez l'avenir de produits destinés aux personnes et aux entreprises que nous construisons dans toute notre famille d'applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). En appliquant vos compétences techniques, votre esprit d'analyse et votre intuition en matière de produits à l'un de ensemble de données le plus rich au monde, vous contribuerez à définir le expériences que nous construisons pour de milliard de personnes et de centaines de million d'entreprises dans le monde entier. Vous collaborerez sur un large éventail de problèmes de produits et d'affaires avec un ensemble diversifié de partenaires interfonctionnels à travers le produit, l'ingénierie, la recherche, l'ingénierie de données, le marketing, le ventes, le finance et autres. Vous utiliserez de données et de analysis pour identifier et résoudre le plus grand défis du développement de produits. Vous influencerez la stratégie du produit et le décisions d'investissement à l'aide de données, serez concentré sur l'impact et collaborerez avec d'autres équipes. En rejoignant Facebook, vous ferez partie d'une communauté analytique de classe mondiale qui se consacre au développement de compétences et à l'évolution de la carrière dans le domaine de l'analyse et au-delà.À propos du rôleLeadership en matière de produits : Vous utiliserez le données pour façonner le développement de produits, quantifier le nouvelles opportunités, identifier le défis à venir et vous assurer que le produits que nous construisons apportent de la valeur aux personnes, aux entreprises et à Facebook. Vous aiderez le équipes de vos partenaires à établir de priorités, à fixer de objectifs et à comprendre l'écosystème de leurs produits.Analytique : Vous guiderez le équipes à l'aide de données et d'informations. Vous vous concentrerez sur le développement d'hypothèses et utiliserez une boîte à outils diversifiée d'approches analytiques rigoureuses, de différentes méthodologies, de cadre et d'approches technique pour le tester.Communication et influence : Vous ne vous contenterez pa de présenter de données, mais vous relaterez de récits fondés sur le données. Work with large and complex data set to solve a wide array of challenging problem using different analytical and statistical approaches. | Travailler avec de ensemble de données vastes et complex pour résoudre un large éventail de problèmes difficiles en utilisant différentes approches analytiques et statistiques.

Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategy for our product that serve billion of people and hundred of million of businesses. | Appliquer une expertise technique en matière d'analyse quantitative, d'expérimentation, d'exploration de données et de présentation de données afin de développer de stratégies pour no produits qui servent de milliard de personnes et de centaines de million d'entreprises.

About the job
Who We Are

Geotab is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work.” We are a company of diverse and talented individual who work together to help business grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicle to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customer better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Marketplace, offering hundred of third-party solution options, allows both small and large business to automate operation by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billion of data point a day, Geotab leverage data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleet through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new task and activity - one that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join u for a fulfilling career with opportunity to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow u @InsideGeotab on Instagram , Twitter or Facebook .
Who You Are

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Data Scientist, Privacy Engineering work very closely with Geotab’s Data Privacy Specialist, data science team, data product teams, and data operation team.
If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader — we would love to hear from you!
What You'll Do

Our Data Scientist, Privacy Engineering role comprises conducting motivated intruder attack on aggregate datasets and further developing Geotab’s innovative anonymization technique for geo-spatial data. This role work hand-in-hand with Geotab’s data operation team to operationalize model and transformations. This role also work collaboratively with data product team to ensure a balance of innovation while following privacy by design principles.
How You’ll Make An Impact
Regularly conduct motivated intruder attack on Geotab’s aggregate data (a strong understanding of geo-spatial data and GIS function is an asset).
Work collaboratively with with third party on motivated intruder attack

About the job
Job Description
Company Description

You will work closely with our partner in Product, Engineering, Design, and Research to understand customer behavior, inform product decisions, and increase healthy participation on Twitter. You will support the entire product development lifecycle from product ideation to opportunity sizing, from measurement design to experimentation, from causal analysis to post-launch learning, and iteration into the next development cycle. You will analyze how change to the platform affect customer behavior and business outcomes. You will also communicate finding to cross-functional partner and use data to improve the team’s strategy.
What You’ll Be Doing
As a staff data scientist on the Data Science team you will
Design, implement, and analyze experiment to determine how change to the platform affect user behavior and refine our theoretical understanding of users’ interest and the community they form.
Conduct analysis to derive strategic insight from vast datasets across different product areas.
Create accurate and statistically sound summary metric to evaluate the performance of features/products and motivate teams’ targets/Key Results (KRs).
Apply sophisticated statistical technique to model user behavior, identify causal impact and attribution, build and benchmark metrics, and forecast future performance.
Communicate finding to executive and cross-functional product team by translating statistically rigorous analysis towards business impact.
Improve the reproductivity and efficiency of analysis work through code review and other established processes.
Help drive the team roadmap, encourage technical excellence, and train and mentor junior team members.
Qualifications
What it take
PhD in a quantitative field and 4+ year of experience (or 7+ year of total post-graduate experience).

Experience with one or more of the following in an applied business setting advanced statistical technique for A/B testing, method for experimental design, observational causal inference, or time series forecasting.
Track record of executing independent project and leading complex, multi-functional project with several dependencies.
Strong proficiency with Python / R and SQL.
Solid written and verbal communication skills, especially for executive audiences.
Experience mentoring junior data scientist and enthusiasm for building out a new data science community.
About the job

Veeva [NYSE: VEEV] is the leader in cloud-based software for the global life science industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, our customer range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical company to emerging biotechs. Veeva’s software help our customer bring medicine and therapy to patient faster.

We are the first public company to become a Public Benefit Corporation . As a PBC, we are committed to making the industry we serve more productive, and we are committed to creating high-quality employment opportunities.

Veeva is a Work Anywhere company which mean that you can choose to work in the environment that work best for you - on any given day. Whether you choose to work remotely from home or work in an office - it’s up to you.
The Role
As a Data Scientist for the Commercial Analytics team, you will work with Veeva Engineers, Consultants, and fellow Data Scientists to support analysis and analytical data deliverables.

Your role will be to generate and own the mathematical and behavioral model that will help drive the generation of impactful insight and suggestion for our clients. Our ideal candidate is multi-talented, with the capability to develop statistical, machine learning, and optimization model but they are also able to be client-facing, to understand the business need of our client (both within and outside of Veeva), and present complex statistical and machine learning model to the stakeholders.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is excited about using their deep Data Science expertise to help shape the ML offering of the Veeva business. This role is based in the Veeva Toronto Office - 20 Toronto St, Toronto, ON
What You’ll Do
Develop advanced algorithm that solve problem of large dimensionality in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner
Design, develop and ass highly innovative model for clustering, anomaly detection, and more
Build and run analysis of model and algorithm in order to ass performance and identify the best algorithm to present to customer
Ensure model and algorithm support our customer and help them drive towards more intelligent and effective engagement with their customer
Execute statistical and data mining technique (e.g. hypothesis testing, machine learning, and retrieval processes) on large data set to identify trend

Work closely with the data warehouse product team to ensure the architecture is effectively developed to support algorithm that are reproducible for many client while being able to tailor said model for individual client
Build model to help our Business Consulting and Strategy team work with customer on how to better understand healthcare behavior to improve patient outcome
Provide subject matter expertise and advice on model design, data collection, and/or model evaluation to technical and non-technical audience
Contribute to developing and executing the team’s research agenda, including writing white paper and presenting at conference
Collaborate with data engineer to access data and explain data requirement
Collaborate with analytics consultant to communicate finding to senior leader and business partner
Communicate analysis and results, along with implications, to technical and non-technical audience
Demonstrate impeccable ethic and judgment when dealing with confidential data
Share research insight both inside and outside the organization to become a thought leader in this space
Requirements

Ph.D. in Economics, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or other quantitative discipline with at least 1+ year of relevant industry experience, or an equivalent M.S. with 4 year of relevant demonstrable research experience

Advanced in-depth specialization and experience in data analysis technique such as: classification, pattern recognition, clustering, feature analysis, NLP, fuzzy matching, sentiment analysis, A/B testing, active/adaptive learning
Proficient in R or Python
Ability to manipulate large data set and develop statistical models, and accurately determine cause and effect relationship
Excellent SQL/Spark skill

Intellectual curiosity, along with excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions, even in situation with non-standard problem
Excellent oral and written communication skill with the ability to effectively explain complex problem and advocate technical solution to other team member and client
Must be comfortable with changing requirement and priority
Must be results-oriented and able to move forward without complete information and with minimal supervision
Nice to Have
Experience with commercial aspect of the Life Sciences industry
Experience working with Software a a Service and/or enterprise product
Experience with AWS
Hands-on experience building model with deep learning framework (Tensorflow or similar)
Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with office in more than 15 country around the world.

About the job
DATA SCIENTIST: Challenging, Impactful, Rewarding

WHO WE ARE: Paradigm is an innovative, flexible, leading-edge Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) company. As Canada’s leading mortgage outsourcing company, Paradigm’s mandate is to enable new and existing lender with a cost-effective mortgage operation solution that can quickly respond to market conditions, lead the market in innovation and ultimately provide mortgage consumer with great choice, vastly improving their mortgage experience.

PARADIGM CULTURE: Paradigm is committed to open and honest communication with our staff. We believe by being transparent, truthful, and sincere, we can serve each other and our client with integrity. Our culture can be summed up in one word: family. We work hard at creating an exceptional professional family here at Paradigm and do not take it for granted. Every initiative, new hire, company event and daily activity are focused on maintaining and fostering our Paradigm family because we know that our employee are undoubtedly the key to our success.

THE OPPORTUNITY: As a member of Analytics/AI team in our Data Management & Analytics Function (DMAF), you will be accountable for finding solution to business problem using data and uncover hidden insight through extensive data mining.
Role Specific Accountabilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Provide forward looking data, information, and assessment in support of decision making
Working a a trusted business partner, solve business problem through predictive and prescriptive analytics
Conduct extensive data mining to uncover hidden pattern in data and give proactive and actionable insight to the business
Collaborate with data engineering, data operations, and IT development team to deploy model and algorithm in production across different channel and platform
Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategy to measure the effectiveness of model and make ongoing change
Support building real-time/batch data pipeline and deploy the model in a production environment
Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models, and algorithm used and developed
Present result to business stakeholder and help implement real data-driven change
Manage the execution of analytical project including timeliness, quality, and client value
Support analytics leader within the team in task a assigned with regard to defining and implementing analytics strategy and managing client relationship
Ensure accuracy of data and deliverable and adherence to policy and process
Educational /Technical Experience:
Undergraduate degree in a relevant STEM discipline (Computer Sciences, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering, Mathematics) or Finance/Economics required
3+ year of financial service experience (mortgage finance knowledge/experience will be an asset)
