Job Title
Senior Data Scientist
Who is Mastercard?

Mastercard is a global technology company in the payment sector. We power payment and provide product and service for individual and industry all around the world. Our people, technology, data and brand provide the capability that drive our success. We believe in connecting people to priceless possibilities.

As a company, we know that our success is driven by the skills, experience, integrity and mindset of the talent we hire. By building an inclusive, world-class culture, our employee have once-in-a-career opportunity to be a part of team that have a greater impact on our community and our world. We invite you to join our team to find out how you too can start something priceless.
Overview

Mastercard's Cyber & Intelligence organization develops and delivers world-class security product and service for customer across the globe. NuData Security predicts fraudulent transaction by identifying good user from bad, based on their online behaviour. By analyzing over 38 billion behaviour annually, NuData harness the power of behavioural and biometric analysis to empower it client to predict fraud and verify the user behind the device. This allows client to predict fraud before a critical decision, reduce customer insult, and investigate bad actor efficiently.
Role
Responsibilities
This is a key role within the team responsible for developing model to support various NuData products, and you’ll have exciting responsibilities, including

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with a minimum of 5 year of experience in a related field to join our team in the Vancouver office. The position will be technical in nature where you will provide guidance on the various statistical method and algorithm used in modeling work by our team, and provide mentorship to others in this area.
Analyzing complex, high-volume data from varying source and identifying key regularities, pattern and trends.
Prototyping and developing machine learning model in collaboration with an agile, high-functioning team.
Spotting new opportunity in data collection, feature creation, feature selection, model tuning and evaluation practices, and taking those idea from the first concept to live product integrations.
Implementing effective monitoring and benchmarking for model performance comparison.
Leveraging new research in data modelling to identify opportunities, pioneering algorithm and system that become key commercial products.
Maintaining model development pipelines, library and machine learning infrastructure.
All About You
Ideally, you are:

Statistically adept. You have studied in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, economics, data science) at a doctoral or master’s level. You have the depth of knowledge required to identify appropriate techniques, follow and create formal proofs, define apt performance measure and adeptly explore or transform data.

Someone with a strong foundational knowledge of principle underlying common statistical learning technique such a linear regression, support vector machine, tree-based methods, bagging and boosting methods.
A strong problem solver with critical thinking skill who can formulate a problem into solution. Able to challenge assumption and validate modeling solution from a statistical inference perspective.
Capable of writing complex SQL query to process data. Proficient with manipulating and analyzing data to gain meaningful insight using tool such a Pandas for Python.

Experienced in creating algorithm and applying machine learning model to solve real business problems. You have the vision to see what the next generation model look like and can iterate over production model to generate a competitive edge in the market.

A capable coder, able to write well-abstracted, production-quality code in Python (preferred), R, Java and/or C++. You’re experienced in using cloud service (e.g. AWS, Microsoft Azure and/or Google Cloud), and machine learning tool (e.g. scikit-learn, Tensorflow and/or Keras).

Experienced working with large data sets. You understand the benefit of batch processing and parallelization and know how to design a pipeline to scale-out machine learning workflows. You have experience working with distributed data processing framework such a Apache Spark.
An effective communicator in visual, verbal and spoken channels, able to identify a narrative in complex data and convey clear, actionable finding to different type of audiences.
Experienced in architecting end-to-end solution for production deployment (considered an asset but not required).
It Also Helps If You Are
Collaborative. We do our best work a a team, which mean sharing, being open to giving and receiving support and constructive input.
Evidence-based. We work to eliminate assumption and test our hypotheses, and we value rigour.
Responsible. We offer the opportunity to drive major project that protect consumer every day, internationally. We are looking for colleague who care about that.
Motivated. We’re a team of data scientist with personal and collaborative side projects, and we’re looking for someone who share our enthusiasm.

Innovative. Data Science is a continuously growing field. We like our team to keep pushing for new idea and methods. We are looking for someone who is creative and not just always satisfied with the status quo.

Due to COVID-19, most of our employee are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidate by phone or video and are onboarding new hire remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.

If so, this role offer a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business technical leadership across a broad range of information management function to support various area of data and analytics.

Enjoy partnering with colleague and directing data traffic? In this advanced professional role, you'll work both independently and within team a a senior lead analyst. Colleagues and business partner will look to you to manage and direct activity related to analysis, design and support of business data management solutions, including larger projects.
As a Senior Business Information Management Analyst, You Will
Be the expert-level team analyst, considered an authority with in-depth knowledge and experience in your field of specialty a well a working knowledge of broader related area
Lead project of moderate to complex risk and resource requirements; may lead end-to-end process or functional program

Analyze and understand business and data requirement to develop complete business solution (e.g. analysis of data models, entity relationship diagrams, data lifecycle management, governance, lineage, metadata and reporting elements)
Develop business requirements; design and implement complex business data information management framework
Apply automation and innovation on data platform and on new development project / initiative

Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your in-depth experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirement aligned to business need and for specific data platforms, application system and server
Partner and collaborate with business and technology partner to resolve data / application issue and ensure requirement delivery

Participate fully a a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credential and knowledge for this role, a well a these essential requirement and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Five (5) or more year relevant experience from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background
Sound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialty
Fluent in one or two programming language
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skill
Proficient knowledge of various data sources, tool and technology used in preparing summaries/reports
In-depth knowledge of competitor and market trend
Proficient to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadline
Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis method and reporting technique
Strong ability to work collaboratively and independently, communicate effectively (both speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building relationship across team and function
Act a a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externally

About the job

We're looking for a top-tier Senior Data Scientist to establish and own data science practises at ZenHub. You’ll play a key role in growing the business through your insights, and you’ll help shape the future of the product. Every one of u share a common vision: to create the future we want to live and work in.

At ZenHub, that mean removing the repetitive, monotonous overhead we “need” to do to manage software project while bridging the gap between future-thinking business team with future-building development teams. We need the right people to help u realize that vision. If you are looking for a new challenge within a dynamic and fast­ growing technology company and if you want to create outstanding products, we want to hear from you.
A little about us:
From individual developer to interplanetary organizations, team using ZenHub are changing the world a we know it.

In 2014, ZenHub wa built by a team of developer in Vancouver, Canada, to manage project while preserving their focus in GitHub. Our tight-knit team hail from multiple country and industries. A few of u have worked at Barclays, IBM, Microsoft and Baidu. More than a couple of u are published authors.

Today, ZenHub is the leading team collaboration and project management suite in GitHub, empowering team of 2 to over 20,000 work together. We help team from around the world to work together to make phenomenal thing happen.
Scope of your role:
Establish data science practice for ZenHub
Conduct research and analysis in order to come up with solution to business problem
Evaluate business process to uncover area for improvement
Identify business challenge and opportunity using data modelling technique
Guide data model and architecture decision to help support strategic decision making
Provide business insight based on comprehensive analysis
Identify new opportunity in the conversion funnel
Provide data exploration and analysis to various product team
Make data insight accessible via data visualization
Document, present and effectively communicate your insight to cross-functional team member and leadership team
Drive initiative to automate and modernize process and technology
Oversee the implementation of new technology and system
A little about you:
5+ year experience in an Applied Data Scientist role
1+ year experience in improving SaaS product by applying data science technique on large scale datasets
Exceptional problem solving, conceptual thinking, analytical skill and experiment design (e.g. AB Testing)
Advanced knowledge of statistical machine learning technique and python programming
Experience creating detailed report and presenting insight from the analysis and research
Experience with databases, both relational database (e.g. PostgreSQL) and non relational database (e.g. Mongo)
Experience with data engineering and data warehouse (e.g. Google BigQuery)
More about ZenHub:

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed in the role description. One of our value is “Growth Mindset”. If you have some of the quality listed above, and are excited about the role and motivated to learn – we want to hear from you!

At ZenHub our people are the priority. We believe the more perspective we embrace, the stronger our team. We recruit the best, and welcome people of all background regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or ability. With a focus on respect and a commitment to continuous learning, we’re building an inclusive culture that support our team in doing their best work. We work hard to provide our full-time team member perk that make their life better by offering:

○ Boundaryless working style. We want our team to work from wherever is best for them. Whether you prefer to work from the comfort of your home office or from our bright, spacious, and dog-friendly Zen-den, we support you. For those opting to wfh, we offer a generous monthly stipend to cover ongoing remote work expenses. If you opt to join u in-office, we’ll contribute to your commute expense or bike maintenance.

○ A flexible vacation policy. We work hard and it’s important we take time to recharge. We have a flexible time off policy with no hard limit and encourage our team member to take a minimum of 3 week off per year.

○ A commitment to continued learning and development. We provide an annual professional development budget to use towards conferences, classes, books, and other opportunity to maintain and expand your skill set.
○ Fitness reimbursements. Stay fit with our monthly reimbursement for health-related benefit like gym memberships, fitness apps, and personal training.

○ Top-of-the-line equipment. In addition to receiving a company smartphone of your choice with a paid voice/data plan, every team member receives a generous annual new tech budget to try new gadgets, tools, and platforms.

○ Flexible parental leave policies. We understand the importance and demand of a growing family. In addition to state, provincial, and federal leave allowances, parent on our team have the ability to create flexible schedule or take day off when family need to come first.

○ Social Connection. When it’s safe to gather again our team will have access to a shared collaboration space in Vancouver, but our team is focused on fostering strong relationship and an equitable experience no matter where in the world you’re working.
Check out our career page to learn more about what other benefit we offer!
About the job
Application Deadline: Monday, September 20, 2021
Work Term Length: 4 month
Anticipated Start Date: January 4, 2022
What your day-to-day will look like:
Assisting in conducting reproducible research and iterate over machine learning pipeline to improve our business metric while being constrained by tight deadline
Working with a team of data scientist to help transform complex data into meaningful conclusion in a digestible format
Presenting data using data visualization technique
Using Statistics and Data Science to provide data-driven solution across the organization
Collaborating with cross-functional team
You will thrive if you:
Are comfortable with SQL
Can use Python, including panda
Have exposure to analyzing data and conducting analysis
Are familiar with common regression and classification algorithm
Are familiar with the notion of variance and statistical significance
Are comfortable with software engineering including cloud and code versioning

creative problem-solver

What You’ll Do Here

Here are a few reason why others have joined our team:

Explore new idea and learn best practice in a fun, inclusive environment

About the job

At Vanguard, our mission is to help investor meet their financial goals, and that start with providing the analytical insight they need. The strategic use of data is meaningful to helping our business develop new capability and solutions. As a Marketing Data Scientist at our Center for Analytics & Insights (CAI), you’ll com bine analytical and innovative way to develop advanced marketing analytics solution to help our Marketing organization address complex marketing problem and drive effective decision making. We have a rich array of data available to u and wealth of challenge to offer you. Make it count.
Requirements
In This Role You Will:

Lead meaningful marketing science project that provide deep insight into marketing need and performance, and ultimately, drive better marketing return on investment and business outcomes. Applies significant quality control and risk assessment of the model, methodologies, output and processes.

Identify way of demonstrating data to address marketing challenge and opportunities. Translate requirement into an analytics approach, and through sophisticated analysis, formulate insight that improve the way we do marketing

Demonstrate subject matter expertise and develop core Marketing ML solution such a Marketing mix models, Multi-touch attribution algorithms, Next best action solutions, Channel optimization, etc.to guide business partner and leader in marketing planning and execution
Drive innovative marketing model and application through continuously improve and grow CAI Marketing ML capability to better support marketing core goal and metric
Impact
Reimagine The Investment Experience

Your real passion for data, along with your ability to communicate complex idea through storytelling and visualization, will supply to the development of new way of doing business. You’ll collaborate with a robust, cross-disciplinary team including advanced data analysts, data engineers, consultants, and market researchers—all backed by Vanguard’s sophisticated modeling and data management tools. If you’re driven to lead project that uncover innovative way of investing, you could launch a multifaceted career, helping to serve over twenty million clients, worldwide and transforming the way our industry operates. Invest your skill for the benefit of our clients, and we’ll invest in your future.
Qualifications
What it Takes:

Graduate degree (ideally a PhD) in a quantitative/analytical field such a Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research, Physics or other relevant scientific field
A minimum of five year of relevant professional experience in dynamic analytical roles, combinational of machine learning, data science and marketing analytics
Deep understanding and experience of building model using Deep Learning, Machine Learning and Simulation method
Experienced in developing and deploying marketing mix-models, multi-channel attribution algorithm and marketing measurement & optimization solution
Strong proficiency in Python, R, Spark (Scala, PySpark) and data visualization tool such a D3.js
Maintains flexibility in meeting deadline and expectation in the face of shifting priority
About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It start with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.
Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employee are referred to a crew), and community is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective team of individual who are a unique a the client they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strength to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.
When all crew member feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing idea to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

We work closely with internal and external stakeholder to develop and execute plan that help the company achieve it strategic objective and ensure financial sustainability.
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative service and create original multiplatform medium content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing idea to life and join a community that value bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Position Description

As a Developer, you will be part of an exciting Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) that is a critical enabler of the development and implementation of our Finance 2025 Data and Technology roadmap.
Job Duties/Accountabilities

Work with Finance Data and Analytics CoE team members, Finance a well a other Bell Businesses to understand and ass business need and design and develop data solution by exploring data source and analytics approach to be used (e.g. mining, forecasting, visualization, etc.) and execute to address the business need
Explore new source of information to uncover new business opportunity at all level of the business (judicious to operational)
Exercise leading edge analytics skill in data visualization, mining, forecasting, etc. to address business need
Work with and present to all management level
Maintain and expand your knowledge of data system and current technology through training opportunity
Work in an agile environment and contribute to the improvement of our development process
Implementation of methodology and process to organize and aggregate large datasets to expedite actionable insight from all available data sources.
Leverage data, machine learning and business principle to identify and solve complex business problem for the wider finance organization.

Ensure that the return on investment in advanced financial analytics resource and technology is realised by keeping abreast with strategic requirement from senior management and that these are aligned to internal project being actioned.
Ensure that advanced financial analytics technique that are relevant within non-traditional division are identified and actioned.
Critical Skills/Competencies

Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Statistics, Information Systems, Applied Math, Business Administration, Finance or any other related field (masters degree considered an asset).
CPA or related finance experience considered an asset
Demonstrated experience in business process analysis, data architecture design and development, and the implementation of workflow enabled solution and their intricacy in a finance environment.
Minimum 5 year of coding experience
2 years’ experience with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithm and approach
Advanced skill with SQL and database system such a Hive, Impala, MySQL, SQL Server, Teradata
Highly analytical skill and ability to work with large and complex technical data set
Ability to leverage insight and opportunity from data and metric to build strategy and make recommendation
Knowledge of, and preferably experience with, Big Data and/or software development, and/or developing visualization tool
Ability to work with a team towards common goal
Ability to quickly learn new programming language and framework
Able to manage multiple project and priority
Self starter who is comfortable working with and presenting to all management level
Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, clustering, collecting data from multiple data system on premise and cloud-based data sources.

Working knowledge of machine learning techniques, for example: Support Vector Machine, Naïve Bayes, K-Nearest Neighbours, K-Means, Random Forest, Dimensionality Reduction Algorithms, Deep Learning technique and Gradient Boosting Algorithms.
Experience and knowledge of statistical modelling techniques: GLM multiple regression, logistic regression, log-linear regression, variable selection, etc.

Understanding of and experience using analytical concept and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendation for business units.
Strong SQL and SAS skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple table and subqueries.
Experience writing advanced SAS, SQL, Python, R (or similar) code statements, models, and macros.
Experience using analytics technique to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes.
Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities.
The right candidate will also be proficient and experienced with the following tools/programs:
Strong programming skill with querying languages: SQL, SAS, R, Python, etc.
Experience with big data tools: Alteryx, Teradata, Aster, Hadoop, etc.
Experience with other Analytics/Programming tool will be beneficial: C, C++, JAVA, or other programming language
Experience with Excel (incl. VBA), Word, Access and PowerPoint.
Advanced Visualization Development Experience with Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, Microstrategy, etc.

Statistics and math background
Experience in Telecom, Finance or IT is a strong asset.

About the job
What is the opportunity?

As a Data Scientist, you will develop, design, and implement organization-wide cutting-edge AIOps (AI for IT Operations) solution at RBC Technology Infrastructure. Leveraging leading edge technology and various data sets, you will build machine learning based product to facilitate informed decision-making and business process optimization in order to minimize outage and reduce downtime of RBC service which save considerable amount of cost and also improve user experience.
What will you do?
Work on challenging and research-based initiative using advanced machine learning method focusing on tangible outcome
Collaborate proactively with various business and operation unit to identify business opportunity and designing innovative solution to optimize process and promote informed decision-making
Prepare and integrate large and various type of data (structured/non-structured)
Implement machine learning models, data mining methods, and statistical analysis
Leverage visualization tools/packages to create powerful representation of result
Produce data-driven insight to help in informed decision and action by telling a convincing story and effectively communicate finding to business partner and executive
Collaborate with the development team to deploy production-scale solution
Quickly learn new methods, tool and technology presented in research community to implement and adapt within the daily analytics exercise
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
PhD. or Masters in Computer Science, Statistics, or relevant fields.
Expert in Python programming to write production-ready codes. Strong data profiling, cleaning, mining and technical documentation skill
2+ year of experience in developing machine learning model for real business problem
2+ year of experience with NLP and text analytics method and package
Experience with big data technology - parallel processing technique and Apache Spark, NoSQL/SQL database
Proficient in Linux environment, shell scripting, and Git
Strong communication and presentation skill
Nice-to-have
Strong knowledge and experience of different deep neural network architecture (RNN, CNN, GAN, seq2seq/Transformers) and transfer learning
Experience with MLOps to build end-to-end pipeline and deploying model in production
Familiar with container-type environment: Docker, Openshift
Experience in graph analytics and time-series analysis

About the job
Description
Are you into big data?
Do you have experience with SQL and Python?
Do you want to use your Advanced Analytics skill to transform the client experience?
Do you want to collaborate on a project that is a priority for the Bank?
Then keep reading!
National Bank is seeking two Data Scientists to contribute their expertise to the Client Contact Centre Analytics team.
The Data Scientists must be able to synthesize and leverage big data set to enhance the client experience, increase revenue and identify opportunity for transformation and innovation.

This is a unique opportunity to join a passionate team dedicated to transforming and developing the bank of tomorrow. We will focus on our client and work on highly impactful project that combine big data set analysis and machine learning.
Your Main Challenges
Act a the advanced analytics expert advisor for the Bank’s Contact Centres.

About Netskope

Today, there's more data and user outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter a we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter wa needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security.

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundred of employee spread across office in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core value are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layout and large meeting space to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunch and office celebration to employee recognition event (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional group such a the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive. Visit u at Netskope Careers and follow u on Twitter @Netskope and Facebook.

Netskope Threat Labs is a team of security researcher and subject matter expert working together to solve today’s toughest security challenge in new and innovative ways. The team focus on threat to data and infrastructure in the cloud and attacker that abuse the cloud. We work closely with the security, data science, product, and engineering team to develop novel protection strategy against emerging cybersecurity threats. Our research ha been presented at conference across the globe, including Def Con, Black Hat Europe, CAMLIS, MALCON, Nullcon, and AVAR. Netskope ha been recognized a a leader in the “Magic Quadrant for Cloud Access Security Brokers” (CASBs) for four consecutive year and a visionary in the 2020 “Magic Quadrant for Secure Web Gateway” (SWG). Learn more about Netskope Threat Labs by reading our blog, monthly threat summaries, and Cloud Threat Reports.

In this role, you will shape the direction of research and product development across all of Netskope’s products. By applying your technical knowledge and analytical skill to a set of anonymized usage data collected from the Netskope Security Cloud platform, you will guide research, product development, sales-enablement, and marketing efforts.

Jumio Transaction Monitoring (JTM) is disrupting a $7.5 billion compliance software market by offering an innovative platform and incorporating new data source for our bank and fintech partner to monitor their transaction for suspicious behavior helping make the financial system safer while maximizing the value and utility of critical compliance resources.

We are looking for a data scientist at JTM. In this role, you will get to work alongside various expert in customer success, product and engineering. You will analyze datasets to discover patterns, build and test model and implement them to improve our transactional monitoring system.
Responsibilities:
Mine and analyse data from database to create features, generate insights, drive optimization and improvement of product development.
Develop data model and algorithm to improve the current AML rule based system.
Develop process and tool to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy in production.
Implement end-to-end machine learning solution in a production environment
Keep pace with the state-of-the-art technology in machine learning
Experience and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering

3+ year of industrial experience solving analytical problem using relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience, in related business areas; or equivalent 2+years of industry experience with Master’s degree
Experience with data scripting language (e.g., SQL, Python, R etc.)
Hands-on experience with machine learning framework such a Scikit-learn, Tensorflow and Pytorch
Knowledge of classical machine learning technique (clustering, decision trees, artificial neural networks)
Knowledge of time series approach (ARIMA, Kalman filters, sequence modeling etc)

About the job

In February 2021, Sharethrough and district m entered into a definitive merger agreement to become one of the leading modern omnichannel advertising exchanges. The combined business mission is to build a sustainable advertising ecosystem for journalists, content creator and app developers, connecting publisher and advertiser with true technological innovation supporting all ad formats, devices. and user experiences.
We’re looking for data scientist who share our passion for building data-driven products, a well a the belief data should be tightly integrated into the engineering and product flow.

In this role, you’ll pair with your data science and product peer to explore new way to optimize the 20 billion impression flowing through our exchange every day. We believe in an experiment-driven approach that enables you to test out your ideas. While we’ve implemented some tremendously impactful optimization product already, we believe we’ve just scratched the surface.
About The Role
Analyze Sharethrough data to discover patterns, abnormalities, and increased revenue opportunity
Present finding to data scientist and product manager to influence product roadmaps
Work with our data engineering team to make the data needed for your analysis available
Pair with our product manager to make sure we are properly analyzing the success of our product
Work closely with business leadership to integrate data into every part of the product
About You
3+ year of experience working in an analytics organization
Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Econometrics, or similar domain
Competent performing statistical analysis using a scripting language (Python, R, Julia)
Proficient with SQL
Able to create intuitive and readable dashboard using visualization tool (Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Strong familiarity with experimental design
Comfortable pairing with product
Bonus Points
Experience or familiarity with the adtech ecosystem
Experience working closely with Product team
Comfortable collaborating with leadership to distill down high level business goal and provide data driven recommendation
About the job

At Mozilla, we want to make product that keep the Internet open and secure for all. We collect terabyte of data a day from million of user to guide our decision-making processes. We could use your help.

As a Product Data Scientist, you will work closely with the product and marketing organization. You are an inquisitive thinker who is keen to practice full-stack data science, with experience ranging from designing and engineering data extraction process to finding pattern and anomaly in data through analytical techniques. You have strong interest in honing your technical skill further on real-world data. You believe that data science can lead to insight that can guide the future of Mozilla. You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization to see beyond the number and understand how our worldwide community experience our products.
We Have Multiple Openings For The Following
The Role
As a Data Scientist At Mozilla
You help design and analyze experiment to understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trend
You build key data set to empower operational and exploratory analysis
You advocate for standard methodology across the organization
You own the definition, evaluation and reporting of key product metric
You communicate narrative with data to many audiences, ranging from product manager to technical lead
You sit at the intersection between product, marketing, engineering, and leadership to inform, influence, and help execute our product strategy
Your Professional Profile

You lead with empathy. You value teamwork and teammates. You are invested in knowledge sharing and learning from others. You contribute positively and meaningfully to cultivate an inclusive and equitable team culture.

Ideally, you have prior experience with Internet data or any large, high-dimensional data set. Experience come in all form and personal project count. We’ll be especially excited if you have worked end-to-end on a data-intensive project on a level that you’d see in a graduate degree program in a quantitative or analytical discipline.

You have practice with extracting data from a variety of source using SQL or SQL-like tool a well a have performed statistical modeling using Python or R. You also desire to gain further technical experience on the job.
You have experience concisely presenting result (e.g. through report-writing or presentations) and are comfortable explaining technical concept to non-experts.
You have a keen interest in telling story with data visualization and building impactful, insight-driven narratives.
You consider contributing to a collaborative and open team culture an important responsibility.

About the job

“The front page of the internet," Reddit brings over 430 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousand of communities.

We are looking for a Staff level Data Scientist to work with our Ads Marketplace product team. You will partner closely with cross functional team leader such a Group Product Managers, Engineering Managers and leadership in utilizing data to drive decision making. In addition to strong analytical skills, you will have a keen business acumen and the big picture thinking that can guide our Marketplace strategy in a data driven manner.
How You’ll Have Impact

Advertising is Reddit’s primary business model and we have an ambitious goal to turn it into a massive business. Although several large digital ad platform already exist, advertiser are being increasingly drawn to Reddit because of our passionate community that drive action. This large number of self-governed community have highly-engaged user who are in an unduplicated mindset of consuming relevant information. This ha created the opportunity for Reddit to build a massive and highly differentiated ad business.

We spent the past few year building the foundation of a modern ad serving system, building feature that enable brand and performance advertiser find their audience on Reddit and get high ROI on their ad spend. We’re now building differentiated product on top of those foundations, utilizing data to drive the product decision for both short and long term bets.

As a data scientist on the ad data science team, you’ll be a key player in ensuring we make the right product decision based on data insight and help define the culture that is driven through metric and KPIs. Reddit sits in a unique place, where there is still a lot of low hanging fruit that will immediately impact million of user and thousand of advertisers.
What You’ll Learn

You will partner closely with our Ads Product & Engineering team, which is the core driver of revenue for the company. You’ll play a key role in developing Ads product strategy and roadmap. You’ll play with petabyte of data full of user and advertiser interaction to develop a deeper understanding of Reddit’s ad ecosystem.

In addition, you will work side by side with a world-class org of Engineering, ML, Search, Data Science, Data Warehouse, and Analytics practitioner who work together to create a variety of capability for Reddit to be more successful in it decision-making and product development. In this process, you will be exposed to a variety of new technique in experimentation, statistical frameworks, machine learning, deep learning, and causal inference.
What You’ll Do
Analyze conversation and behavior across Reddit's 10,000 interest-based communities, and convert them into insight and product recommendations.
Understand Reddit advertising and help the company improve Ads Revenue while simultaneously improving ROAS (Return on Ads Spend) for advertiser and ad quality for users.
Conduct product/feature analyses, opportunity sizing, experimentation (A/B testing) and build dashboards/visualizations to ass product health.
Organize data by designing table schemas, data pipelines, aggregations, alert and general data infrastructure for the Ads Organization.

Collaborate with various cross-functional stakeholders, including Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, UX Researchers, Data Engineers and Data Warehouse Engineers to lead project related to organizing and analyzing data.
Be an integral part of the Data Org, leveraging and contributing to the vibrant knowledge base, shared across a community of world-class data experts.
Who You Might Be
5+ year of experience in data analytics or related quantitative role
2+ year of experience in the digital advertising space
Demonstrated ability to influence and guide product strategy with data
Demonstrated ability to take ambiguous problem and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
Desire to mentor other data scientist and share best practice to elevate the data science practice at Reddit
Strong ability to communicate and discus complex topic with technical & non-technical audience
Proficiency with relational database (e.g., SQL) and statistical analysis/programming language (e.g., R / Python)
Proficiency with dashboarding tool (e.g. Mode Analytics, Tableau, Looker)

Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individual with disability and disabled veteran in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact u at ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com.

Job Description

Sinai Health Foundation raise and steward fund to support Sinai Health System. Sinai Health System is Canada’s leading integrated health system and comprises Bridgepoint Active Healthcare; Circle of Care; Lunenfeld-Tanenbaum Research Institute; and Mount Sinai Hospital, Joseph & Wolf Lebovic Health Complex. The generous support of our community fuel everything we do from seamless care to scientific discovery.

People are excited to come to work every day at Sinai Health Foundation. As a w orld-class institution , we have a unique and rich personality. We are driven to make a positive impact for patients, their family and society.
We love the clash of idea that lead to better solutions. Challenging the status quo is encouraged. Collaborating will allow u to push forward.
We recognize that the pace of change continues to accelerate and understand flexibility is vital. We take our work seriously and have a lot of fun doing it! Laughter echo throughout our organization.
We embrace and celebrate differences. We look for diversity and inclusion when we hire top talent. We have great respect for our strengths, perspectives, opinion and lifestyles.
We have high expectation of each other, but even higher expectation of ourselves. We are not hampered by rule and processes, we trust in each other.
We do all that we can do…and then we find a way to do a little bit more. We embody creativity, imagination and a fierce determination to make the world a better place.

The Foundation is seeking an individual with outstanding development and organizational skill to fill the role of Data Scientist. This role will mine and analyze data from the Foundation database to drive optimization and improvement of marketing technique and fundraising strategies. They will use predictive modeling to increase and optimize donor experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcome of the Foundation.
Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To
Executing analytical experiment methodically to help solve various problem and make a true impact across Foundation program
Identifying relevant data source and set to mine for client business needs, and collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variable
Devising and utilizing algorithm and model to mine big data stores, perform data and error analysis to improve models, and clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy
Analyzing data for trend and patterns, and interpreting data with a clear objective in mind
Implementing analytical model into production by collaborating with colleague on Information Technology and Business Intelligence team
Communicating analytic solution to stakeholder and implementing improvement a needed to operational system
Finding creative approach and bringing new perspective on available data to provide insight into performance across Foundation program
Applying theories, conducting experiments, and undertaking study and test using advanced data mining and modeling technique
Interpreting data and trend and presenting material using compelling data visualizations.
Job Requirements
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, or related discipline
Three (3) year of proven experience a a data scientist or industry experience in a quantitative role
Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
Proven experience a a Data Scientist or Data Analyst with experience in data mining and analyzing large datasets
Understanding of machine-learning, knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
Enthusiasm for clean code and sharing reproducible result
An eye for great data visualization with Qlik Sense or Tableau
Analytical mind and business acumen with strong math skill (e.g. statistics, algebra)
Ability to develop and execute data mining and modelling solution
Knowledge of open data and open source software
Excellent communication and problem solving skill
Collaborative and effective team player; able to build trust within team, with colleague and with leadership
Ability to organize, prioritize, work with interruption and deal with several task simultaneously
Resourceful and tenacious with a high level of confidentiality, diplomacy and tact
Flexibility and adaptability; innovative thinking
Knowledge of fundraising an asset
A professional aligned with the Foundation’s five values: collaboration, flexibility, fun, respect and trust.

About the job
Join our team

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capability built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believer that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcome for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
Together, we will develop and execute strategic program that will enhance the experience for TELUS subscriber and internal stakeholder across TELUS.
Always wanted to work with a team of innovator and be part of a culture that embrace creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You will provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployment. You’ll collaborate with team across the company, seeking out various data source to help identify new business opportunity while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI.

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skill to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, function and libraries.

The team take pride in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning model and solution they develop and deploy and take ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing of novel AI technique to discover insights, to developing automation pipeline and web-visualizations, we do it all!
Here's How
Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML model
Collaborate on end-to-end automation effort required to bring model to production
Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboard to uncover actionable insight
Visualize and report data finding creatively in a variety of visual format that provide insight to the organization
Influence how we approach business challenge and opportunity by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goal faster and more reliably
Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practice and emerging tools/technology
Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholder to understand business need and priority

About the job

Wealthsimple is on a mission to help everyone achieve financial freedom, no matter who they are or how much they have. Using smart technology, Wealthsimple take financial service that are often confusing, opaque and expensive and make them simple, transparent, and low-cost. We're the company behind some of Canada's leading digital financial products, and are growing faster than ever.

Our team is reimagining what it mean to manage your money. Smart, high-performing team member will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value great work and great idea — not ego. We're looking for talented people who love a fast-paced environment, and want to ship often and make an impact with groundbreaking ideas.

We’re a remote-first team and output is more important than face time, so where you choose to work is up to you — a long a you have internet access, you can work from anywhere in Canada. Be a part of our Canadian success story and help shape the financial future of million — join us! Read our Culture Manual and learn more about how we work.

At Wealthsimple, we are building product for a diverse world and we need a diverse team to do that successfully. Conduct research to advance the NLP landscape at Wealthsimple
Work with a large amount of autonomy
Skills we're looking for:
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a graduate degree in Natural Language Processing, or a related field

About the job

In February 2021, Sharethrough and district m entered into a definitive merger agreement to become one of the leading modern omnichannel advertising exchanges. The combined business mission is to build a sustainable advertising ecosystem for journalists, content creator and app developers, connecting publisher and advertiser with true technological innovation supporting all ad formats, devices. and user experiences.
We’re looking for data scientist who share our passion for building data-driven products, a well a the belief data should be tightly integrated into the engineering and product flow.

In this role, you’ll pair with your data science and product peer to explore new way to optimize the 20 billion impression flowing through our exchange every day. We believe in an experiment-driven approach that enables you to test out your ideas. While we’ve implemented some tremendously impactful optimization product already, we believe we’ve just scratched the surface.
About The Role
Analyze Sharethrough data to discover patterns, abnormalities, and increased revenue opportunity
Present finding to data scientist and product manager to influence product roadmaps
Work with our data engineering team to make the data needed for your analysis available
Pair with our product manager to make sure we are properly analyzing the success of our product
Work closely with business leadership to integrate data into every part of the product
About You
3+ year of experience working in an analytics organization
Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Econometrics, or similar domain
Competent performing statistical analysis using a scripting language (Python, R, Julia)
Proficient with SQL
Able to create intuitive and readable dashboard using visualization tool (Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Strong familiarity with experimental design
Comfortable pairing with product
Bonus Points
Experience or familiarity with the adtech ecosystem
Experience working closely with Product team
Comfortable collaborating with leadership to distill down high level business goal and provide data driven recommendation

About the job

Now more than ever, the Internet is a utility that facilitates modern life. At Mozilla, we take this to heart, striving to build product that keep the Internet open, accessible, and secure for everyone. We collect terabyte of data every day from million of user to guide our decision-making processes. We need your help to enable the future of Mozilla in a way that make u proud!
As a Data Scientist within the Data Org, you will work a part of a cross-functional team that is responsible for understanding and empowering the future of Mozilla.
The Role
The Data Science team sits at the intersection of finance, business, operations, product, engineering, and leadership. We collaborate closely with these partner to provide meaningful insights.
As a Data Scientist At Mozilla You Will
Apply a variety of statistical method including causal inference to understand the intricate ecosystem of our users, products, partners, revenue
Build key data set to empower operational and exploratory analysis
Define, evaluate and report on key business metric
Generate data-informed insight and communicate these data story to colleague to influence decision making across Mozilla
Contribute to the team through mentorship, technical methods, improvement in how we work
Your Professional Profile

You lead with empathy. You value teamwork and teammates. You are invested in knowledge sharing and learning from others. You contribute positively and meaningfully to cultivate an inclusive and equitable team culture.
You have a background in quantitative analysis knowing how to analyze, visualize, and interpret data and have 2+ year of experience applying these skill in an industry setting.
You have experience in SQL or SQL-like environments, a well a scripting language such a Python or R and desire to gain further technical experience on the job.

You have owned complex project from inception to completion and your work ha influenced entire organizations. You’ve contributed to and executed against data science roadmaps in collaboration with others.

You take stakeholder need into account, bridging methodology and data into meaningful strategy from your analyses. You are a communicator who craft impactful data narrative that inform company decision around product, business, and finance.
Experience synthesizing product and revenue data is a plus!

About the job

At Mozilla, we want to make product that keep the Internet open and secure for all. We collect terabyte of data a day from million of user to guide our decision-making processes. We could use your help.

As a Product Data Scientist, you will work closely with the product and marketing organization. You are an inquisitive thinker who is keen to practice full-stack data science, with experience ranging from designing and engineering data extraction process to finding pattern and anomaly in data through analytical techniques. You have strong interest in honing your technical skill further on real-world data. You believe that data science can lead to insight that can guide the future of Mozilla. You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization to see beyond the number and understand how our worldwide community experience our products.
We Have Multiple Openings For The Following
The Role
As a Data Scientist At Mozilla
You help design and analyze experiment to understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trend
You build key data set to empower operational and exploratory analysis
You advocate for standard methodology across the organization
You own the definition, evaluation and reporting of key product metric
You communicate narrative with data to many audiences, ranging from product manager to technical lead
You sit at the intersection between product, marketing, engineering, and leadership to inform, influence, and help execute our product strategy
Your Professional Profile

You lead with empathy. You value teamwork and teammates. You are invested in knowledge sharing and learning from others. You contribute positively and meaningfully to cultivate an inclusive and equitable team culture.

Ideally, you have prior experience with Internet data or any large, high-dimensional data set. Experience come in all form and personal project count. We’ll be especially excited if you have worked end-to-end on a data-intensive project on a level that you’d see in a graduate degree program in a quantitative or analytical discipline.

You have practice with extracting data from a variety of source using SQL or SQL-like tool a well a have performed statistical modeling using Python or R. You also desire to gain further technical experience on the job.
You have experience concisely presenting result (e.g. through report-writing or presentations) and are comfortable explaining technical concept to non-experts.
You have a keen interest in telling story with data visualization and building impactful, insight-driven narratives.
You consider contributing to a collaborative and open team culture an important responsibility.

As an Actuarial Analyst I you will contribute to corporate, pricing or research and development initiatives. You will collaborate with your peer to support actuarial project to ensure the profitability of property and casualty (P&C) line of business.
What You’re Responsible For
Supporting rate change projects, reserve and (DCAT) analysis and various actuarial models.

Developing and maintaining knowledge of data source including the ability to reconcile to other sources.

Detail oriented work that requires a high degree of mental concentration for extended period of time.
To Be Successful
You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiency and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs.

You have strong communication skill to clearly convey message and explore diverse point of view.

You have a post-secondary degree in Mathematics or Actuarial Science.
You have successfully completed two Actuarial exam and are actively working towards your Associate (ACAS) or Fellow (FCAS) designation.

Training and development opportunity to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Employers.
Flexible work option and paid time off to support your personal and family needs.
A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health program and a supportive workplace culture.

A comprehensive total reward package, including competitive salary, bonus, pension and benefits.

About the job
As a Data Scientist at MindBridge, your day-to-day activity may vary. The ideal candidate will work well within a team and with our client to ensure the project are delivered to the highest

quality and meeting client requirements. Above all we are looking for someone with a great attitude, high energy, and focused on execution, continuous improvement, and accountability. A Data Scientist with a growth mindset who is excited by opportunity to learn will be successful in this role.
Key Responsibilities:
Proactively work with product management and development team to solve complex problem across multiple domains.
Apply specialized skill and fundamental data science method (e.g. research design, testing, evaluation and iteration) to develop algorithmic approach to add to our
platform.
Define and advance best practice within data science and product teams.
Work with customer to understand their requirement and data.
Apply EDA skill to design and deliver analytics within our platform based on existing suite of algorithms.
Research relevant method and keep up-to-date with advancement in the field.
Support other team member in their data science work and provide constructive feedback.
Contribute to the technical vitality and collective knowledge of the team.
Key Skills:
Data Visualization and Communication: You know that storytelling with data is an important skill. You understand how to communicate analytic insight to everyday people without resorting to jargon.

Science/Statistics: You are comfortable with key mathematical concept and have empirical thinking at your core. You may have acquired these skill by studying Math, statistic or you have a scientific or engineering background. Statisticians, Biologists, Chemists, Physicists or Engineers-are all relevant fields.
Machine Learning: You are fluent in machine learning techniques; you know how logistic regression work and you can jump in and train a neural net model on data and understand if
your result are any good. Experience with a range of unsupervised method is an asset.

Data Munging: You know how to work with data, shape it and manipulate it at will. Wizarding skill with data are highly desirable and knowledge of one or all of SQL, Python, TensorFlow, R is essential.
Software Engineering: You are comfortable writing high-quality code in a professional setting.
Experience working with agile development team and GitHub is useful.
Independent Working: You are able to work independently with minimal supervision.
People we’re looking for:
Have an enquiring mind, you are collaborative and like working with colleague and client to change the world.
Have the ability to think strategically, self-direct and believe in bringing their best every day.
Have strong Python programming skills; experience with DASK is highly desirable but not essential.
Have a BS (MS/PhD Preferred) in quant discipline (e.g. Math/Hard Science, Stats, CS, EE, Econ).
Are fluent in written and oral English.
Requirements contingent on employment:
Fulfill requirement necessary to obtain full background check.

About Netskope

Today, there's more data and user outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter a we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter wa needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security.

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundred of employee spread across office in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core value are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layout and large meeting space to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. Netskope Threat Labs is a team of security researcher and subject matter expert working together to solve today’s toughest security challenge in new and innovative ways. The team focus on threat to data and infrastructure in the cloud and attacker that abuse the cloud. We work closely with the security, data science, product, and engineering team to develop novel protection strategy against emerging cybersecurity threats. In this role, you will shape the direction of research and product development across all of Netskope’s products. About the job

Verily, an Alphabet company, life at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world’s health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives.

Our team combine expertise in healthcare, data science and technology to improve the health and well-being of our communities. We are developing the infrastructure and solution to harness the profusion of health information for good. Our data-driven solution span three primary areas: research, care and innovation. Programs include Project Baseline - our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research; Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform, which includes connected tools, lifestyle coaching and clinical support; and Debug - our effort to reduce the threat of mosquito-borne disease by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique. We’re also actively working to combat the spread of COVID-19 through new program like Healthy at Work.
Description
We aim to radically improve healthcare with better outcome at lower cost by collecting, organizing, and activating health information. Our program include:
Verily Health Platform - An Integrated Suite Of Intelligent Care Platforms Across The Ecosystem Of Patients, Healthcare Providers And Health Insurance Comprised Of

Verily Value Suite - an AI-powered learning health informatics platform that identifies high value opportunity to improve patient outcome and decrease cost for health system and help facilitate their implementation through provider and patient interactions.
Granular insurance - where we implement precision model of risk, payments, and servicing.

Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform, which includes devices, lifestyle coaching, clinical support and telemedicine to help patient improve outcome managing diabetes,hypertension and other conditions.
Healthy at Work - helping organization return onsite safely during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Sleep Apnea and OneFifteen where we use experience and data science innovation to tackle complex chronic condition such a OSA and opioid addiction.

Terra: a scalable, secure and open-source platform driving greater collaboration in biomedical research. Terra offer access to various biomedical datasets, researcher workbench and open-source tools, backed by a cloud-based architecture. Organizations or researcher can use Terra to develop new library and tool for multi-modal genomic data analysis, and make them available to the broader community. Terra is based on the key principle of the Data Biosphere: modularity, openness, community-driven and standards-based.

Our Data Science group specializes in analyzing and building model to help make sense of large datasets resulting from bio-sensors, digital pathology, clinical informatics, molecular assays, and patient surveys. We combine domain knowledge and programming expertise with statistical and machine learning skill to build scalable model and solution that help power Verily’s various product areas.

In this position, you will work cross-functionally with Verily's clinical, software, product, and science team to develop and productionize model for disease progression, digital phenotyping and risk stratification. To enable real-world impact, you will deliver key analysis for motivating product direction, build reusable analysis tool and work closely with software engineers, product managers, and clinician to deliver user-facing products.
Responsibilities
Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, handling data challenge from a real-world setting.
Develop quality control and pre-processing tool for a broad range of digital and clinical data types.
Iterate on engineer key feature and build new statistical and machine learning models, relating measured feature to clinical endpoints.
Communicate highly technical result and method clearly, a well a interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, computer science, applied mathematics, or similar) or equivalent practical experience.
Demonstrated experience working with Python for model development and production.
Demonstrated experience working with various healthcare data (EHR, medical and pharmacy claim, social determinant of health, etc).
Experience with exploratory and statistical data analysis (such a linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling and data visualization).
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with the analysis of observational clinical data.
Familiarity with medical terminology and ontologies.
Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.

About Us
Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada!

Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sale and distribution centres, and 5 production facility nationwide.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationship with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and community through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

About the job

“The front page of the internet," Reddit brings over 430 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousand of communities.

We are looking for a Staff level Data Scientist to work with our Ads Marketplace product team. You will partner closely with cross functional team leader such a Group Product Managers, Engineering Managers and leadership in utilizing data to drive decision making. In addition to strong analytical skills, you will have a keen business acumen and the big picture thinking that can guide our Marketplace strategy in a data driven manner.
How You’ll Have Impact

Advertising is Reddit’s primary business model and we have an ambitious goal to turn it into a massive business. Although several large digital ad platform already exist, advertiser are being increasingly drawn to Reddit because of our passionate community that drive action. This large number of self-governed community have highly-engaged user who are in an unduplicated mindset of consuming relevant information. This ha created the opportunity for Reddit to build a massive and highly differentiated ad business.

We spent the past few year building the foundation of a modern ad serving system, building feature that enable brand and performance advertiser find their audience on Reddit and get high ROI on their ad spend. We’re now building differentiated product on top of those foundations, utilizing data to drive the product decision for both short and long term bets.

As a data scientist on the ad data science team, you’ll be a key player in ensuring we make the right product decision based on data insight and help define the culture that is driven through metric and KPIs. Reddit sits in a unique place, where there is still a lot of low hanging fruit that will immediately impact million of user and thousand of advertisers.
What You’ll Learn

You will partner closely with our Ads Product & Engineering team, which is the core driver of revenue for the company. You’ll play a key role in developing Ads product strategy and roadmap. You’ll play with petabyte of data full of user and advertiser interaction to develop a deeper understanding of Reddit’s ad ecosystem.

In addition, you will work side by side with a world-class org of Engineering, ML, Search, Data Science, Data Warehouse, and Analytics practitioner who work together to create a variety of capability for Reddit to be more successful in it decision-making and product development. In this process, you will be exposed to a variety of new technique in experimentation, statistical frameworks, machine learning, deep learning, and causal inference.
What You’ll Do
Analyze conversation and behavior across Reddit's 10,000 interest-based communities, and convert them into insight and product recommendations.
Understand Reddit advertising and help the company improve Ads Revenue while simultaneously improving ROAS (Return on Ads Spend) for advertiser and ad quality for users.
Conduct product/feature analyses, opportunity sizing, experimentation (A/B testing) and build dashboards/visualizations to ass product health.
Organize data by designing table schemas, data pipelines, aggregations, alert and general data infrastructure for the Ads Organization.

Collaborate with various cross-functional stakeholders, including Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, UX Researchers, Data Engineers and Data Warehouse Engineers to lead project related to organizing and analyzing data.
Be an integral part of the Data Org, leveraging and contributing to the vibrant knowledge base, shared across a community of world-class data experts.
Who You Might Be
5+ year of experience in data analytics or related quantitative role
2+ year of experience in the digital advertising space
Demonstrated ability to influence and guide product strategy with data
Demonstrated ability to take ambiguous problem and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
Desire to mentor other data scientist and share best practice to elevate the data science practice at Reddit
Strong ability to communicate and discus complex topic with technical & non-technical audience
Proficiency with relational database (e.g., SQL) and statistical analysis/programming language (e.g., R / Python)
Proficiency with dashboarding tool (e.g. Mode Analytics, Tableau, Looker)

Who are we at Equifax?

We are a global information solution company that us trusted unique data, creative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organization and individual around the world by transforming knowledge into insight that help make more informed business and personal decisions.
Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our people make a difference in our business.

We are looking for individual who can help u disrupt the marketplace. You will do this by delivering leading-edge technology to build and deliver unparalleled customized insight that enrich both the performance of business and the life of consumers.
About the Job
We will give you the opportunity to drive innovation and automation across the enterprise. This includes tool and process integration across all business unit within Equifax globally.

You will be a main point of contact for our client to assist them in developing new query or advise on appropriate analytical technique to address a variety of business issues. By using your deep knowledge of Equifax data assets, you will proactively produce analytics to generate additional value from the different solution installations. This will include advanced modeling technique and machine learning when applicable.

In addition to supporting specific analytical platforms, our new Data Scientist may be deployed directly with customer for special projects. This could include the application of specific skills, such a machine learning, or represent additional capacity to the customer for key work. The broad experience of our Data Scientist will provide strong domain expertise that will deliver better outcome for key customers.
Responsibilities of the Data Scientist – Client Success include:
You will utilise tools, including Python and SQL to extract data and assist others user to improve the performance of queries.
By working closely with customers, you will understand the objective of their project and be able to interpret the business need into a sound analysis plan that considers all relevant data.

Utilising your teamwork skills, you will collaborate with the Data Management team to load new data into the environment a needed and work closely with the IT system administrator to ensure data quality remains strong.
Effectively communicate analytical result to key partner using strong data visualizations, strong presentation skill and business language to emphasize the so what of the analysis.

CircleCI is seeking a Manager, Data Science and Analytics to lead our data team. You'll lead data scientist and data analyst passionate about improving our product experience! We are part of the Product organization. You report to the team's director.
What you’ll do:

Grow analytics talent: Manage four to eight data analyst and data scientists. Support their growth with one-on-ones, feedback, assessments, development plans, mentoring, and removing blockers. Build a team through a talent roadmap, a collaborative culture, clear goals, and metrics. Recruit, hire, onboard, and train new team members.
Collaborate with Product: Partner with product leader and product managers. Ensure your team collaborates well with Product and contributes to Product outcomes.

Build an analytics practice: Improve process to scope work, conduct analyses, and share insights. Procure the right tooling. Collaborate with supporting functions, like data engineering and business intelligence. Refine our data architecture, governance, documentation, and security practices. Celebrate incremental wins!
What we're looking for:
Management experience: At least one year of managing four or more direct, full-time reports.

Analytics experience: Five or more year in analytics, data science, BI, reporting, or a related domain. Ideally, you’ve spent time at high-growth business with well-defined, product-enabled funnel and sophisticated customer flows.
Leadership: A servant leader and a strong collaborator. You enjoy helping developing people. You effectively use soft authority.
Communication: You’re an excellent communicator. On our teams, we strive to give phenomenal feedback and have difficult conversations. We are open to being wrong and changing our minds.
Process Focused: On our teams, we are comfortable with ambiguity, and we try to add just enough structure and process.

Proficient with analytics tools: You’re not expected to write or review code on a regular basis. Still, you are able to use: SQL, Python/Pandas/Jupyter, basic statistics, basic ML, an analytics platform (e.g., Looker), an event platform (e.g., Amplitude), and an A/B testing tool (e.g., Optimizely).

Technical education: You have a bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative field (e.g., Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or Statistics). A similar Master’s degree is a bonus.

You can work remotely anywhere in North America. You also have the option to work out of our San Francisco, Denver, Boston, or Toronto offices, once they reopen. CircleCI is a distributed company with team member across 50+ city and 13 countries.

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code move from idea to delivery. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use u to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.
