Job Description

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched a a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data ha skyrocketed u to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in distributed computing technology and operating across billion and billion of customer transaction to unlock the big opportunity that help everyday people save money, time, and frustration in their financial lives.
On Any Given Day, You Could Be
Writing software to clean and investigate large, messy data set of numerical and textual data
Integrating with internal and external data source and APIs to help uncover new trend and improve analysis
Developing highly scalable data pipelines, tools, and product to enable the analyst community to fully leverage the power of AWS
Streamlining the deployment and maintenance of machine learning model by facilitating efficient model update and creating robust operational monitoring
Investigating the impact of new technology on the future of digital banking and the financial world of tomorrow
The Ideal Candidate Will Be

Curious: You ask why, you explore, you’re not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You probably know Python, Scala, or Java and are constantly exploring new open source tools, and hitting up stack overflow on a regular basis.

A Wrangler: You know how to programmatically extract data from a database and an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and convert into a human-readable form (Matplotlib, d3 visualization, Tableau, etc.).
A Stickler for good software: You have a reverence for DevOps and don’t consider any piece of code complete without a thorough testing suite.
Creative: Big, undefined problem and petabyte of data don’t frighten you. You’re used to working with abstract data and you love discovering new narrative in unmined territories.

At least 1 year of experience writing unit test and integrating with CICD tool (Jenkins, CircleCI, etc...)

At least 1 year of experience with relational database and programming in SQL
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree or PhD
Experience working with AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.)
Experience working with advanced Git Workflows (Pull Requests, Code Reviews, Issues, and Branching)

About the job
Company Description

Dropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered user across more than 180 countries, our mission is to design a more enlightened way of working. From our headquarters in San Francisco to eight dedicated Studios and a worldwide team of employee who choose where they work best, our Virtual First approach is leading the way into the future of work.
Team Description

Our Engineering team is working to simplify the way people work together. They’re building a family of product that handle over a billion file a day for people around the world. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunity to make an impact.
Role Description

Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of million of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, there’s plenty of space for you to grow alongside u and help deliver on this mission. Dropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered user across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the world’s creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox ha more than 12 office around the world.

The Data Science team is a central function whose goal is to build a deep understanding of Dropbox users, their motivations, and how they use our products. This team leverage a variety of data source and quantitative technique to synthesize story around how our customer use our product and develop key insight and actionable recommendation for our product teams.

In this role, you will lead a team of Data Scientists who use data to enable better decision-making for a portfolio Dropbox’s next gen product and features. You will work cross-functionally with product, engineering, design, marketing and research leadership to leverage data to guide both strategic and operational product decisions. You will be responsible for aligning key data science project for you and your team with product roadmaps and ensuring you communicate your insight broadly.  Additionally, you will directly own and complete analytics milestone for a selection of high-priority projects.
Responsibilities
Manage a team of high performing data scientist and help them execute along the most important priority for Dropbox.
Coach, mentor and help set strategy for Data Scientists to drive even more impact for the team
Partner with other data science team across the company to develop a common quantitative perspective on how we understand our product
Maintain a high bar in term of product thinking and analytical depth for your team through selective hiring and mentorship.
Partner with  engineers, researcher , designer and product manager effectively and contribute heavily  to major analytical and product initiative across the product area in your scope
Work to develop a product metric model for your area of the product and continue to refine it through analysis, experimentation and research partnership
Leverage data and analytics to proactively identify the most impactful opportunity areas, and then build case for why we should pursue them
Requirements
7+ year experience performing data-driven product analysis in a tech company
2+ year directly managing or mentoring data scientists, quantitative researchers, or product analyst
3+ year of experience communicating the result of analysis to leadership team to influence the strategy
BS/BA in Math, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
Experience initiating and drive project to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to analyze large datasets and use data to inform product or business decision making, with a track record of driving directly measurable product or business impact
Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment across Product, Engineering, Design and other business team
Deep understanding of and empathy for end-users
Excellent written and oral communication skill

Qualifications (must Have)
At least 5 year of experience in the industry at applying OR and ML algorithm on non-academic problem
Excellent understanding of fundamental of operation research
Experience with machine learning and neural network
Experience with optimizers such a Cplex or Gurobi
Strong programming skill in Python
Knowledge C or C++ programming language is an asset a is knowledge of Julia
Strong capacity at understanding business problem and connecting them with scientific hypothesis

About the job
Manager, Data Science and Analytics

CircleCI is seeking a Manager, Data Science and Analytics to lead our data team. In this role, you will help our product organization and team understand their customer better through insight and analytics. You will build a team that delivers impactful insight through storytelling in a hyperscale environment.
About the Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team
You'll lead data scientist and data analyst passionate about improving our product experience! We are part of the Product organization. You report to the team's director.
What you’ll do:

Grow analytics talent: Manage four to eight data analyst and data scientists. Support their growth with one-on-ones, feedback, assessments, development plans, mentoring, and removing blockers. Build a team through a talent roadmap, a collaborative culture, clear goals, and metrics. Recruit, hire, onboard, and train new team members.
Collaborate with Product: Partner with product leader and product managers. Ensure your team collaborates well with Product and contributes to Product outcomes.

Build an analytics practice: Improve process to scope work, conduct analyses, and share insights. Procure the right tooling. Collaborate with supporting functions, like data engineering and business intelligence. Refine our data architecture, governance, documentation, and security practices. Celebrate incremental wins!
What we're looking for:
Management experience: At least one year of managing four or more direct, full-time reports.

Analytics experience: Five or more year in analytics, data science, BI, reporting, or a related domain. Ideally, you’ve spent time at high-growth business with well-defined, product-enabled funnel and sophisticated customer flows.
Leadership: A servant leader and a strong collaborator. You enjoy helping developing people. You effectively use soft authority.
Communication: You’re an excellent communicator. On our teams, we strive to give phenomenal feedback and have difficult conversations. We are open to being wrong and changing our minds.
Process Focused: On our teams, we are comfortable with ambiguity, and we try to add just enough structure and process.

Proficient with analytics tools: You’re not expected to write or review code on a regular basis. Still, you are able to use: SQL, Python/Pandas/Jupyter, basic statistics, basic ML, an analytics platform (e.g., Looker), an event platform (e.g., Amplitude), and an A/B testing tool (e.g., Optimizely).

Technical education: You have a bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative field (e.g., Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or Statistics). A similar Master’s degree is a bonus.

You can work remotely anywhere in North America. You also have the option to work out of our San Francisco, Denver, Boston, or Toronto offices, once they reopen. CircleCI is a distributed company with team member across 50+ city and 13 countries.
About CircleCI

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code move from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tool that process more than one million build a day, CircleCI ha unique access to data on how engineering team work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use u to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in San Francisco with a global remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures (formerly DFJ), Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, Harrison Metal Capital, Owl Rock Capital Partners, and NextEquity Partners.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status a a protected veteran, status a an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicant with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

Company Description:

NERv aim to create a paradigm shift in post-operative care, utilizing the plethora of data within the body, to help in the detection of post-operative complication at their onset. NERv’s platform sensing technology augments existing wound drain and catheters, providing healthcare provider with a smart monitoring tool that can enhance the delivery of care. NERv’s technology is being built with the goal of decreasing surgeon’s response time to potential complications, making patient recovery easier, and hopefully saving lives.
Job Summary:

Are you a self-driven person who love diving deep into data analysis? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced, technical environment with new and interesting challenge every day? Are you passionate about using data and technology to improve patient outcomes? If any of these sound like you, read on!

We are looking to add a Principal or Senior Data Scientist to our high-performing R&D and Data Science/Engineering team. In this role, you will drive the AI/ML strategy in alignment with our business objective and in collaboration with our team across research, product development, clinical studies, and sale and operations. You will keep data on the table, identify useful data source and method across the organization, and ultimately harvest it to extract business value. You will also be hand on working on the design, development, deployment, and support of NERv’s AI & ML solution for early detection of post-operative complications.
NERv ha a flexible, hybrid office/WFH model.
Responsibilities:
Lead NERv’s data science initiatives.
Perform EDA to discover patterns, trends, and insight from extensive sensor data and peripheral data sources.
Define analytical experiment in collaboration with R&D team to validate hypothesis and test potential solution using statistically-sound method
Train, validate, and test predictive and diagnostic clinical model using machine learning / deep learning algorithm for classification, time series analysis and anomaly detection
Interface with various engineering and clinical team to convert domain expertise into production-ready data science models.
Work with the development team to improve NERv’s AI/ML solutions.
Prepare technical data report and summary for regulatory submission or external presentation on an as-needed basis.
Drive and promote the use of innovative approach within the organization through publication in scientific peer-reviewed journal and presentation at professional meetings.
Contribute actively to IP portfolio by internally disclosing invention and methods, and supporting patent filing activities.
Provide support for clinical trial design.
Ongoing evolution of model and regulatory conformance verification and validation.
What you need
Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or other related fields.
5+ year of experience with Data Science and solving tough data science problem in production.
Extensive experience working with Time Series modelling and analysis.
Strong knowledge of optimization, classification, clustering, and other ML technologies.
Strong experience with Python, especially with it data science libraries.
Familiarity with version control tools.
Ability to adapt to changing priority under high pressure situations.
Team player, ability to take feedback from all team members.
Ability to interpret and distill complex highly technical (Stats/Math/ML/etc.) concept and explain it to a wide variety of audiences.
Strong research organizational skills.
Comfortable working in the Jupyter Notebook/Lab environment.
Demonstrable experience in translating research outcome to commercial products.
Demonstrable experience in taking ML models/stacks into viable products.
Proven excellence in technical and non-technical oral and written communication. • Experience converting raw data into processed, actionable, insightful information.
Demonstrable experience in ML Ops.

Experience working with business stakeholder in understanding data analytics and information needs, and executing on transformation of high-level, abstract data need into meaningful data management solutions, information, and analysis.

About the job
Company Description

Twitter user generate many terabyte of data every day; Twitter engineer run hundred of experiments; Twitter Data Engineers build data pipeline and data process that calculate metric and scale increasingly sophisticated model of user and content.

The Data Science team at Twitter is at the intersection of all this data and strives to make it actionable to all business unit around Twitter. Data Engineers work alongside Data Scientists analyze this data via observational analyses, trend analyses, modeling, and new measurement strategies. We also implement metric to track the impact of new product experiment and more generally find way to make very large scale data approachable to guide our decisions.
Job Description

Twitter ha very large and complex datasets. As a Twitter Data Engineer you will build datasets and make them accessible to our partner team by writing great production code to simplify the complexity. Your work will enable Product Managers and other decision-makers across the company to bring together insight and inform our product and strategy. In every decision that you influence, you will see the product improve and be more valuable to Twitter users.

We are trying to improve Twitter. To improve something, we need to be able to measure it. As a Data Engineer you will enable better measurement and ensure measurement accuracy so that we know where we are doing well and where we want to improve.
As such, you will
Design, develop, and launch extremely efficient and reliable data pipeline to move data and to provide intuitive analytics to our partner teams.
Make Twitter-scale data more discoverable and easy to use for Data Scientists and Analysts across the company.
Collaborate with other engineer and Data Scientists to discover the best solutions.
Support your colleague by reviewing code and designs.
Diagnose and solve issue in our existing data pipeline and envision and build their successors.

Strong understanding of SQL
Broad knowledge of the data infrastructure ecosystem
Experience with Hadoop or other MapReduce-based architecture
Experience working with large data volume
Good understanding of one or more of the following Scala, C++, or Java
About the job
Manager, Data Science and Analytics

CircleCI is seeking a Manager, Data Science and Analytics to lead our data team. In this role, you will help our product organization and team understand their customer better through insight and analytics. You will build a team that delivers impactful insight through storytelling in a hyperscale environment.
About the Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team
You'll lead data scientist and data analyst passionate about improving our product experience! We are part of the Product organization. You report to the team's director.
What you’ll do:

Grow analytics talent: Manage four to eight data analyst and data scientists. Support their growth with one-on-ones, feedback, assessments, development plans, mentoring, and removing blockers. Build a team through a talent roadmap, a collaborative culture, clear goals, and metrics. Recruit, hire, onboard, and train new team members.
Collaborate with Product: Partner with product leader and product managers. Ensure your team collaborates well with Product and contributes to Product outcomes.

Build an analytics practice: Improve process to scope work, conduct analyses, and share insights. Procure the right tooling. Collaborate with supporting functions, like data engineering and business intelligence. Refine our data architecture, governance, documentation, and security practices. Celebrate incremental wins!
What we're looking for:
Management experience: At least one year of managing four or more direct, full-time reports.

Analytics experience: Five or more year in analytics, data science, BI, reporting, or a related domain. Ideally, you’ve spent time at high-growth business with well-defined, product-enabled funnel and sophisticated customer flows.
Leadership: A servant leader and a strong collaborator. You enjoy helping developing people. You effectively use soft authority.
Communication: You’re an excellent communicator. On our teams, we strive to give phenomenal feedback and have difficult conversations. We are open to being wrong and changing our minds.
Process Focused: On our teams, we are comfortable with ambiguity, and we try to add just enough structure and process.

Proficient with analytics tools: You’re not expected to write or review code on a regular basis. Still, you are able to use: SQL, Python/Pandas/Jupyter, basic statistics, basic ML, an analytics platform (e.g., Looker), an event platform (e.g., Amplitude), and an A/B testing tool (e.g., Optimizely).

Technical education: You have a bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative field (e.g., Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or Statistics). A similar Master’s degree is a bonus.

You can work remotely anywhere in North America. You also have the option to work out of our San Francisco, Denver, Boston, or Toronto offices, once they reopen. CircleCI is a distributed company with team member across 50+ city and 13 countries.
About CircleCI

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code move from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tool that process more than one million build a day, CircleCI ha unique access to data on how engineering team work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use u to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in San Francisco with a global remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures (formerly DFJ), Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, Harrison Metal Capital, Owl Rock Capital Partners, and NextEquity Partners.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status a a protected veteran, status a an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicant with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

May perform and plan the programming of database quality control checks.
Program the integration of database from multiple study or sources.
Develop programming documentation including plan and specifications, a appropriate.
Provide advanced technical expertise in conjunction with internal and external clients, and independently bring project solution to team and department.
Perform and plan the development, implementation and validation of new process technologies, macro and applications.
Fulfill project responsibility at the level of statistical team lead for single studies, under supervision.

Understand the Scope of Work, estimate the work completed, and manage Out of Scope for single studies. May manage budget and resource requirement and provide revenue and resource forecast for single studies. May be required to understand budget and quote assumptions.
Provide training and guidance to lower level and new staff.
Qualifications
Master's Degree Computer science or related field and 1 year relevant experience req Or
Bachelor's Degree Computer science or related field and 2 year relevant experience req
Equivalent combination of education, training and experience Req
Knowledge of statistics, programming and/or clinical drug development process
Working knowledge of computing application such a Base SAS, SAS/STAT and SAS Macro Language
Good organizational, interpersonal, leadership and communication skill
Ability to effectively handle multiple task and project
Excellent accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationship with coworkers, manager and client

About the job
Join u on our exciting journey!
From camaraderie to professional development, working at IQVIA provides unique opportunity to advance your career alongside a group of diverse and talented colleagues.

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundary of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customer create a healthier world. The solution and contract research service we provide to the life science industry are made possible by our 70,000+ employee around the world who apply their insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage every step of the way.
We have one of the largest Biostatistics department within the industry of around 1,100+ staff. Due to continued growth, we are seeking new brave mind to join our team.
Job Overview:
As a team/site/staff level, you will provide advanced technical expertise to develop process methodology for department to meet internal and external clients’ needs.
Plan and coordinate the development of integrated programming solution serving the full spectrum of statistical programming needs.
Provide technical expertise and leadership to the department.
Provide internal consulting services, including specification and user need analysis for complex project or client requirements.
Key Responsibilities:
Perform, plan co-ordinate, and implement the following for complex studies:
The programming, testing, and documentation of statistical program for use in creating statistical tables, figures, and listing
The programming of analysis datasets (derived datasets) and transfer file for internal and external client
The programming quality control check for the source data and to report the data issue periodically
Ability to interpret project level requirement and develop programming specifications, a appropriate, for complex studies.
Provide advanced technical expertise in conjunction with internal and external clients, and independently bring project solution to SP team
Fulfil project responsibility at the level of technical team lead for single complex study or group of studies.
Directly communicate with internal and client statistician and clinical team member to ensure appropriate understanding of requirement and project timeline
Estimate programming scope of work, manage resource assignments, communicate project status and negotiate/re-negotiate project timeline for deliverable
Use and promote the use of established standards, SOP’s and best practice
Provide training and mentoring to SP team member
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Maths, Computer science, Statistics, or related field
7+ years’ Statistical Programming experience within the Life Science Industry
Advanced knowledge of statistics, programming and/or clinical drug development process
Advanced knowledge of computing application such a Base SAS, SAS Graph and SAS Macro
Language
Advanced knowledge of relevant Data Standards (such a CDISC/ADaM/SDTM)
JOIN US
You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our client drive healthcare forward and ultimately, improve outcome for patients.
Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundary of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customer create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solution and contract research service we provide to the life science industry are made possible by our 70,000+ employee around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.

About the job

On the AI Applications team, we explore the use of AI and ML to address problem in every aspect of what we do at EA, including game development, player support, streamlining the business and creating new entertainment experiences. Ensure our project use the best techniques, and identify new advance or untapped area with strategic potential.

About the job
Type de poste : Stagiaire en alternance/stagiaire
Lieu principal : Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Emplacements additionnels : Toronto; Montréal; Vancouver
Notre raison d’être

Chez Deloitte, nous somme déterminés à inspirer et à aider no gens, notre organisation, no collectivités et notre pay à prospérer. Notre raison d’être est de bâtir un avenir meilleur en accélérant et en élargissant l’accès au savoir. Cette raison d’être définit qui nous somme et la raison d’exister de notre organisation.
En incarnant notre raison d’être, nous aurons une influence marquante.
À quoi reseemblera votre journée typique?

Vous serez constamment en contact avec le party concernées pour identifier le problèmes de client et élaborer de solutions. Par le ateliers, le entretiens et de recherches, vous identifierez le lacunes dans le capacités commerciales et technologiques actuelles et travaillerez avec une équipe multifonctionnelle pour définir une vision future, l'"Art du possible". Vous identifierez et développerez de ca d'utilisation pour en faire de preuves de concept, vous définirez de modèles de gouvernance et d'exploitation, et vous développerez de feuilles de route pour aider un client à exécuter de initiative - tout cela autour de application de l'IA, de analysis avancées et de données. Enfin, vous guiderez le client dans ce efforts, en diffusant le résultats et en assurant la gestion du changement.
Renseignements sur l’équipe

L'équipe de science de données d'Omnia AI est une équipe multidisciplinaire de plus de 50 personnes réparties dans le bureau de Vancouver, Calgary, Montréal et Toronto. Elle est chargée d'identifier le ca d'utilisation, de concevoir et de construire de modèles, et de travailler avec le pair d'Omnia pour déployer de solution à grande échelle en science de données. Les application comprennent le domaines de la gestion de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, de la clientèle et du marketing, dans le secteurs du gouvernement, de service financiers, de l'énergie et de ressources, de la consommation et de soins de santé.
Assez parlé de nous, parlons de vous
À ce poste, le compétences attendues sont le suivantes :
Inscrit à un diplôme de premier cycle ou de deuxième cycle en mathématiques, en informatique, en génie informatique ou dans d'autres programme connexes.
Capable d'examiner le objectifs et le données et d'appliquer la bonne technique de science de données pour le deux.
Peut trouver de la valeur dans le données et comment elles aident le entreprises à atteindre une valeur réelle et stratégique.
Vous êtes déterminé à résoudre le problème et à donner le meilleur de vous-même chaque jour grâce à votre positivité, votre communication et votre excellente gestion du temp et de tâches.
Vous êtes rapide à apprendre de nouvelles technology et n'êtes pa intimidé par ce dernières.
Exposition/expérience dans la boîte à outils de science de données Python, R, SQL et autres
Exposition aux technology de cloud computing de Google, Amazon et Microsoft
Nos valeurs commune
Bien que notre raison d’être nous guide et nous aide à expliquer pourquoi nous existons, no valeurs commune décrivent le comportements auxquels nous nous attendons le un de autres au Cabinet.

Elles nous unissent par-delà le culture et le frontières. De surcroît, elles nous aident à gagner la confiance et le respect de no principales party prenantes. Nous nous engageons tous à vivre selon ce valeurs communes, à rester fidèles aux principe qu’elles représentent et à honorer l’héritage dont elles sont issues. Elles sont ce qui nous distingue et ce qui caractérise Deloitte.
Chaque jour, nous incarnons notre vision grâce à cinq valeurs commune :

Ouvrir la voie : en plus d’être un chef de file au sein de la profession, Deloitte la réinvente pour l’avenir. Nous nous somme aussi engagés à créer de occasion et à ouvrir la voie vers un monde plus durable.

Servir avec intégrité: Deloitte mérite la confiance de clients, de organismes de réglementation et du public depuis 175 ans. Le maintien de cette confiance est notre responsabilité la plus importante.
Prendre soin le un de autres : nous nous entraidons, et accordons la priorité au respect, à l’équité, au perfectionnement et au mieux-être.

Favoriser l’inclusion : nous excellons lorsque nous favorisons une culture inclusive et que nous souscrivons à la diversité sou toutes s formes. Nous savons que cela attire le meilleurs talents, favorise l’innovation et nous aide à offrir de solution bien équilibrées aux clients.

Collaborer pour avoir une influence mesurable : nous démontrons un esprit de collaboration en misant sur le travail d’équipe entre le services, le régions géographiques et le compétences afin d’avoir une influence tangible et mesurable.
La balle est dans votre camp
L’idée de travailler pour l’unique cabinet vous tente? Posez votre candidature d’ici le avant le 20 septembre 2021 @ 23h59 EST.

Chez Deloitte, nous avon à cœur de faire de affaire de manière inclusive – cela commence par une diversité parmi le collègues de toutes le compétences! Cela comprend, sans s’y limiter, le personnes handicapées, le candidats de communautés autochtones et le candidats de la communauté noire qui souhaitent incarner no valeurs, participer à la création d’une culture de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion, et contribuer à notre engagement envers notre Plan d’action pour l’accessibilité notre Plan d’action pour la réconciliation et l’initiative BlackNorth

Votre candidature serum évaluée en conformité avec le Normes mondiales de Deloitte en matière de talents. Nous avon conçu ce normes pour fournir une expérience client Deloitte exceptionnelle et uniforme partout dans le monde. Deloitte Canada compte 30 bureau et est présent dans la plupart de régions du pays. Nous reconnaissons que no bureau sont situés sur de territoires traditionnels, de territoires couverts par de traités et de territoires non cédés faisant partie de l’île de la Tortue, et que ce territoires sont toujours habités par plusieurs membres de Premières Nations, de Métis et de Inuits.Nous somme tous de peuples visés par un traité.
